browser_content:
## One Plan Details

'One Plan' is a branding term used by Managed Health Services (MHS) for their Indiana health insurance plans and programs. Its purpose is to transform community health one individual at a time.

### Relevant Links and Descriptions

1. **Healthy Indiana Plan**: [/members/hip.html](https://managedhealthservices.com/members/hip.html) - Information about the Healthy Indiana Plan.
2. **Hoosier Care Connect**: [/members/care-connect.html](https://managedhealthservices.com/members/care-connect.html) - Details about Hoosier Care Connect.
3. **Hoosier Healthwise**: [/members/medicaid.html](https://managedhealthservices.com/members/medicaid.html) - Information about Hoosier Healthwise.
4. **Ambetter Health**: [/members/ambetter.html](https://managedhealthservices.com/members/ambetter.html) - Details about Ambetter Health plans.
5. **Wellcare by Allwell**: [/members/medicare-advantage.html](https://managedhealthservices.com/members/medicare-advantage.html) - Information about Wellcare by Allwell Medicare Advantage plans.
6. **Wellcare Complete**: [/members/wellcare-complete.html](https://managedhealthservices.com/members/wellcare-complete.html) - Details about Wellcare Complete plans.
7. **Redetermination Page**: [/members/Redetermination.html](https://managedhealthservices.com/members/Redetermination.html) - Steps to keep Medicaid coverage.

### Key Features and Capabilities

1. **Health Insurance Plans**: MHS offers multiple plans including Healthy Indiana Plan, Hoosier Care Connect, Hoosier Healthwise, Ambetter Health, Wellcare by Allwell, and Wellcare Complete.
2. **Provider Search**: Ability to find doctors in the MHS network through their 'Find a Provider' tool. [/find-a-doctor/find-a-provider-home.html](https://managedhealthservices.com/find-a-doctor/find-a-provider-home.html)
3. **Community Resources**: 'Community Connect' feature to find assistance programs for food, education, housing, jobs, and more. [https://communityconnect.mhsindiana.com](https://communityconnect.mhsindiana.com)
4. **Health Needs Screening (HNS)**: Members can take the HNS and earn rewards through 'My Health Pays' program.

### Important Details

1. **Cost-Sharing**: Healthy Indiana Plan (HIP) cost-sharing is paused; CHIP and MEDWorks cost-sharing resumed as of July 1, 2024.
2. **Contact Information**: Members can call 1-877-647-4848 (TTY: 1-800-743-3333) for assistance.
3. **Language Assistance**: MHS provides information in different languages and formats at no cost.

### Related Resources

1. **Member Handbook**: Available at [/campaign/mobile/handbook.html](https://managedhealthservices.com/campaign/mobile/handbook.html)
2. **Language Assistance**: Details at [/language-assistance.html](https://managedhealthservices.com/language-assistance.html)
3. **Notice of Privacy Practices**: Available at [/privacy-practices.html](https://managedhealthservices.com/privacy-practices.html)

Attachments:

## Always Covered.
The Indiana health insurance plans & programs are committed to transforming the health of the community one individual at a time.

### Health Insurance Plans:
1. Healthy Indiana Plan
2. Hoosier Care Connect
3. Hoosier Healthwise
4. Ambetter Health
5. Wellcare by Allwell
6. Wellcare Complete

### Purpose:
'Always Covered.' is a commitment by MHS to provide continuous health coverage through various plans.

### Relevant Links and Information:
- Redetermination page: https://www.mhsindiana.com/Redetermination page
- Find a Provider: https://www.mhsindiana.com/Find a Provider
- Community Connect: https://www.mhsindiana.com/Community Connect
- Complete Your HNS: https://www.mhsindiana.com/Complete Your HNS

### Important Notices:
- Healthy Indiana Plan (HIP) cost-sharing paused.
- CHIP and MEDWorks cost-sharing resumed as of July 1, 2024.

### Contact Information:
- Phone: 1-877-647-4848 (TTY: 1-800-743-3333)

### Additional Resources:
- Member Handbook: https://www.mhsindiana.com/Member Handbook
- Member FAQs: https://www.mhsindiana.com/Member FAQs
- Language Assistance: https://www.mhsindiana.com/Language Assistance
- Notice of Privacy Practices: https://www.mhsindiana.com/Notice of Privacy Practices

The webpage provides comprehensive information about 'Always Covered.' and related health insurance plans, along with resources for members and providers.

## Take Action Today to Keep Your Medicaid Coverage

MHS wants to make sure you have the information and support you need to keep your benefits. Here are the steps you can take right now to make sure you're ready: [Redetermination page](/members/Redetermination.html).

* The Redetermination page provides information on how to keep Medicaid coverage.
* Healthy Indiana Plan (HIP) cost-sharing, including copayments and POWER Account contributions, will continue to be paused.
* For CHIP and MEDWorks, cost-sharing resumed as of July 1, 2024.

qa_pairs.answer: We're here to help. Visit our website for details on renewing and maintaining your Medicaid coverage, including the Redetermination page and additional resources like 'Find a Provider'. To find a provider, the user can visit the [Find a Provider page](/find-a-doctor/find-a-provider-home.html) on the Managed Health Services (MHS) website. The page allows searching for Primary Medical Providers, hospitals, pharmacies, and more within the MHS network.

### Steps to Find a Provider:
1. Go to the [Find a Provider page](/find-a-doctor/find-a-provider-home.html).
2. Use the search tool to look for providers by name, specialty, location, or other criteria.

  - [Hoosier Care Connect](/members/care-connect/find-a-provider.html)

### Contact Information:
- Phone: 1-877-647-4848
- TTY: 1-800-743-3333

### Additional Resources:
- The website is available in English and Spanish.
- Information can be provided in different languages or formats at no cost. Call the provided phone number for assistance.

browser_content:
## Comprehensive Information about 'Complete Your HNS'

### 1. Explanation of 'Complete Your HNS' and its Purpose
'Complete Your HNS' is a call to action for individuals to take the Health Needs Screening (HNS). The purpose is to encourage individuals to undergo this screening to earn My Health Pays rewards. The Health Needs Screening is likely a requirement or recommendation associated with health insurance plans offered by MHS.

### 2. Relevant Links Mentioned on the Page
- [/test-for-copies.html](/test-for-copies.html): This link is related to the Health Needs Screening (HNS) process. However, accessing this link resulted in a '403 Forbidden' error.

### 3. Instructions, Phone Numbers, People's Names, Addresses, or Related Resources
- Phone Number: 1-877-647-4848 (TTY: 1-800-743-3333) - General inquiries
- Related Resources:
  - Various health insurance plans and programs offered by MHS, such as Healthy Indiana Plan, Hoosier Care Connect, Hoosier Healthwise, Ambetter Health, Wellcare by Allwell, and Wellcare Complete.
  - 'For Members' and 'For Providers' sections on the webpage may contain additional resources.

### 4. Key Features, Capabilities, or Important Details
- The Health Needs Screening (HNS) is tied to earning My Health Pays rewards, suggesting it's a significant step for members to receive benefits.
- The presence of various health insurance plans indicates that 'Complete Your HNS' is likely a common requirement or recommendation across these plans.

### 5. Other Relevant Information
- The webpage emphasizes taking action to keep Medicaid coverage, indicating the importance of staying updated with requirements like the HNS.
- Cost-sharing for certain plans like CHIP and MEDWorks resumed as of July 1, 2024, highlighting the need for members to stay informed about their plan details.

In summary, 'Complete Your HNS' is a crucial step for individuals to comply with health needs screenings and earn rewards. While detailed instructions are not directly available on the main page, related resources and contact information are provided.

Attachments:

## MHS Secure Portal Login Information

### Features for Members
1. Change Primary Medical Provider (PMP)
2. Request a new Member ID Card
3. Update personal information
4. Send a message to MHS

### Features for Providers
1. Verify member eligibility
2. Check and submit claims
3. Submit and confirm authorizations
4. View detailed patient list

### Contact Numbers
* Secure Provider Portal Help Line: 1-877-647-4848
* TTY: 1-800-743-3333

### Related Links
* Vision Provider Portal Login: https://visionbenefits.envolvehealth.com/logon.aspx
* Dental Provider Portal Login: https://pwp.envolvedental.com/PWP/Landing
* Provider Portal: https://provider.mhsindiana.com/
* Member Portal: https://member.mhsindiana.com/
* Ambetter Member Portal: https://member.ambetterhealth.com/

Attachments:

qa_pairs.question: What is the MHS Secure Portal?
qa_pairs.answer: The MHS Secure Portal is a secure online platform that allows members and providers to access various features and services. Members can change their primary medical provider, request a new Member ID Card, update personal information, and send messages to MHS. Providers can verify member eligibility, check and submit claims, submit and confirm authorizations, and view detailed patient lists.

qa_pairs.question: How do I login to the MHS Secure Portal?
qa_pairs.answer: To login to the MHS Secure Portal, members can visit https://member.mhsindiana.com/ and providers can visit https://provider.mhsindiana.com/. The login process involves authentication through the EntryKeyID system, with the specific login URL for members being https://sso.entrykeyid.com/as/authorization.oauth2?response_type=code&client_id=7854f11e-1e38-4508-b1d1-7777a9e0a3bb&scope=openidprofile&state=Pei782YLPH4eb1Ex_Mi5LuD3aA652oswGi9i5yQa28g&redirect_uri=https://member.mhsindiana.com/healthconnect/login/oauth2/code/pingcloud&code_challenge_method=S256&nonce=gJ9orUoQDkah1LjSe3qNRkaFsoet1LEs5Q_A6cp31T0&code_challenge=ZEjFkVat82KeLn64WorU0NRUspN-uuFg5s-70AbDu68&app_origin=https://member.mhsindiana.com/healthconnect/login/oauth2/code/pingcloud&brand=mhsindiana

qa_pairs.question: What features are available for members on the MHS Secure Portal?
qa_pairs.answer: Members can use the MHS Secure Portal to change their primary medical provider (PMP), request a new Member ID Card, update personal information, and send messages to MHS.

qa_pairs.question: What features are available for providers on the MHS Secure Portal?
qa_pairs.answer: Providers can use the MHS Secure Portal to verify member eligibility, check and submit claims, submit and confirm authorizations, and view detailed patient lists.

qa_pairs.question: Why should I use the MHS Secure Portal?
qa_pairs.answer: The MHS Secure Portal provides a convenient and secure way for members and providers to manage their healthcare information and services. It allows for efficient communication and data exchange between members, providers, and MHS.

qa_pairs.question: When is the MHS Secure Portal available?
qa_pairs.answer: The MHS Secure Portal is available 24/7, allowing members and providers to access its features at any time. However, specific service availability may depend on the underlying systems and maintenance schedules.

qa_pairs.question: Where can I find the login links for the MHS Secure Portal?
qa_pairs.answer: The login links for the MHS Secure Portal can be found on the MHS website. For members, the login link is https://member.mhsindiana.com/, and for providers, it is https://provider.mhsindiana.com/. Additional related links include Vision Provider Portal Login: https://visionbenefits.envolvehealth.com/logon.aspx, Dental Provider Portal Login: https://pwp.envolvedental.com/PWP/Landing, and Ambetter Member Portal: https://member.ambetterhealth.com/

qa_pairs.question: Who should I contact if I have issues with the MHS Secure Portal?
qa_pairs.answer: For assistance with the MHS Secure Portal, you can contact the Secure Provider Portal Help Line at 1-877-647-4848 or TTY at 1-800-743-3333.

qa_pairs.question: Can I update my personal information through the MHS Secure Portal?
qa_pairs.answer: Yes, members can update their personal information through the MHS Secure Portal by logging into their account at https://member.mhsindiana.com/

qa_pairs.question: How do I verify member eligibility using the MHS Secure Portal?
qa_pairs.answer: Providers can verify member eligibility by logging into the MHS Secure Portal at https://provider.mhsindiana.com/ and using the 'Verify member eligibility' feature available on the portal.

browser_content:
### Detailed Information about the 'For Members' Section

#### Key Features and Links:
1. **Member Portal**: 
   - Link: [Login](https://member.mhsindiana.com/)
   - Description: View claims, get a new ID card, update information, and more.

2. **Find a Provider**: 
   - Link: [Begin Provider Search](/find-a-doctor/find-a-provider-home.html)
   - Description: Tool to find doctors, hospitals, pharmacies, and specialty providers in the network.

3. **Health Insurance Plans**: 
   - Description: MHS offers various health insurance plans based on age, income, family size, and special health needs.

4. **Member Quick Links**:
   - **Complete a Health Needs Screening**: [Link](https://ux-gateway.pursuanthealth.com/integration/?channel=b775e5e8-04fa-11e7-b995-0e00f81b9900&organization=ad387594-ecf8-11e6-b39f-0a9b658bd5fd&group_alt_id=5.html)
   - **Find an Event**: [Link](/members/hip/life-support-services/community/member-events.html)
   - **Earn Rewards**: [Link](/members/healthy-rewards-program.html)

5. **Health Programs**:
   - **Healthy Indiana Plan (HIP)**: 
     - Link: [See Healthy Indiana Plans](/members/hip.html)
     - Description: Affordable health insurance for uninsured adult Hoosiers aged 19-64.
   - **Hoosier Care Connect**: 
     - Link: [See Hoosier Care Connect Plans](/members/care-connect.html)
     - Description: Coordinated care program for IHCP members aged 65 and over or with blindness/disability.
   - **Hoosier Healthwise**: 
     - Link: [See Hoosier Healthwise Plans](/members/medicaid.html)
     - Description: Health care program for children, pregnant women, and low-income families.
   - **Ambetter Health**: 
     - Link: [See Ambetter Health Marketplace Plans](/members/ambetter.html)
     - Description: Affordable health care coverage for individuals and families through the Health Insurance Marketplace.
   - **Wellcare by Allwell**: 
     - Link: [See Wellcare By Allwell Medicare Advantage Plans](/members/medicare-advantage.html)
     - Description: Medicare Advantage plan providing coverage for Medicare beneficiaries.
   - **Wellcare Complete**: 
     - Link: [See Wellcare Complete Medicare Advantage Plans](/members/wellcare-complete.html)
     - Description: Medicare Advantage Prescription Drug plan with extra benefits.

#### Phone Numbers:
- **Customer Support**: 1-877-647-4848
- **TTY**: 1-800-743-3333

#### Instructions:
- Members can view claims, obtain new ID cards, and update information through the Member Portal.
- Members can search for providers in the network using the 'Find a Provider' tool.
- Members can complete a Health Needs Screening, find events, and earn rewards through specific links provided.
- Members can access detailed information about various health insurance plans offered by MHS by selecting their respective programs.

#### Addresses:
- No specific addresses are mentioned in the 'For Members' section. However, the website provides a 'Contact Us' page that may contain contact information.

#### People Names:
- No specific people names are mentioned in the 'For Members' section.

#### Last Updated:
- The 'For Members' section was last updated on 08/18/2025.

Attachments:

browser_content:
## Healthy Indiana Plan (HIP) Detailed Report

### Overview
The Healthy Indiana Plan (HIP) is a health insurance program for qualified adults aged 19 to 64 who meet specific income levels. It is offered by the state of Indiana and covers medical costs, including dental, vision, and chiropractic services.

### Plans
1. **HIP Plus**: Provides health coverage for a low, predictable monthly cost. It includes dental, vision, and chiropractic services with no copayments except for non-emergency use of the emergency room.
2. **HIP Basic**: Does not cover dental, vision, or chiropractic services and charges a copayment for each service received.
3. **HIP State Plan**: Details not specified in the provided content.
4. **HIP Pregnancy/HIP Maternity**: Details not specified in the provided content.

### POWER Account
- Every HIP member has a Personal Wellness and Responsibility (POWER) account with $2,500 for covered services.
- The state pays most of the $2,500, and members in HIP Plus or HIP State Plan Plus contribute a portion based on their income.

### Cost Sharing and Contributions
- HIP Plus members make a monthly contribution to their POWER account.
- Individuals with income at or below the federal poverty level default to HIP Basic if they don't make their POWER account contribution.
- Cost-sharing (copayments and POWER account contributions) is currently paused for HIP.

### Enrollment and Coverage
- Members select a health plan or are assigned one and stay with it through the calendar year.
- Annual redetermination of eligibility is required every 12 months.
- Coverage begins on the first of the month after making a POWER account contribution or a $10 'Fast Track' payment for HIP Plus.

### Fast Track Payment
- Allows eligible individuals to expedite the start of their HIP Plus coverage by making a $10 payment.
- The $10 payment goes toward the first POWER account contribution.
- If eligible, HIP Plus coverage begins the first of the month in which the Fast Track payment is made.

### Benefits and Services
- HIP Plus includes dental, vision, and chiropractic services.
- Members can earn rewards through the 'My Health Pays' program for taking better care of their health.

### Additional Information
- Members can manage their accounts, view claims, and obtain ID cards through the MHS Member Portal.
- Health Needs Screening is available for members.
- Various support services are available, including transportation and member events.

### Contact Information
- Call Member Services at 1-877-647-4848 to make a payment with rewards.
- For more information, call 1-877-GET-HIP-9.

### Relevant Links
- [Healthy Indiana Plan Terminology Guide](link_to_guide)
- [MHS Member Portal](link_to_portal)

Attachments:

qa_pairs.question: What is the Healthy Indiana Plan (HIP)?
qa_pairs.answer: The Healthy Indiana Plan (HIP) is a health insurance program for qualified adults aged 19 to 64 who meet specific income levels. It is offered by the state of Indiana and covers medical costs, including dental, vision, and chiropractic services.

qa_pairs.question: What are the different plans available under HIP?
qa_pairs.answer: The plans available under HIP are: 1. HIP Plus: Provides health coverage for a low, predictable monthly cost, including dental, vision, and chiropractic services with no copayments except for non-emergency use of the emergency room. 2. HIP Basic: Does not cover dental, vision, or chiropractic services and charges a copayment for each service received. 3. HIP State Plan and 4. HIP Pregnancy/HIP Maternity: Details not specified in the provided content.

qa_pairs.question: What is a POWER account in HIP?
qa_pairs.answer: Every HIP member has a Personal Wellness and Responsibility (POWER) account with $2,500 for covered services. The state pays most of the $2,500, and members in HIP Plus or HIP State Plan Plus contribute a portion based on their income.

qa_pairs.question: How do HIP Plus members contribute to their POWER account?
qa_pairs.answer: HIP Plus members make a monthly contribution to their POWER account. Individuals with income at or below the federal poverty level default to HIP Basic if they don't make their POWER account contribution.

qa_pairs.question: How can I expedite the start of my HIP Plus coverage?
qa_pairs.answer: You can expedite the start of your HIP Plus coverage by making a $10 'Fast Track' payment. The $10 payment goes toward the first POWER account contribution, and if eligible, HIP Plus coverage begins the first of the month in which the Fast Track payment is made.

qa_pairs.question: What benefits and services are included in HIP Plus?
qa_pairs.answer: HIP Plus includes dental, vision, and chiropractic services. Members can also earn rewards through the 'My Health Pays' program for taking better care of their health.

qa_pairs.question: How can I manage my HIP account?
qa_pairs.answer: Members can manage their accounts, view claims, and obtain ID cards through the MHS Member Portal. For more information, you can visit the [MHS Member Portal](link_to_portal).

qa_pairs.question: Who should I contact for more information about HIP?
qa_pairs.answer: For more information about HIP, you can call 1-877-GET-HIP-9. To make a payment with rewards, call Member Services at 1-877-647-4848.

qa_pairs.question: When does my HIP coverage begin?
qa_pairs.answer: Coverage begins on the first of the month after making a POWER account contribution or a $10 'Fast Track' payment for HIP Plus.

qa_pairs.question: How often is annual redetermination of eligibility required for HIP?
qa_pairs.answer: Annual redetermination of eligibility is required every 12 months.

browser_content:
## How to Enroll
The webpage provides information on various health insurance plans and their enrollment processes. The specific enrollment processes are detailed on separate pages for each plan:

1. **Healthy Indiana Plan (HIP)**: [How to Enroll in HIP](https://www.mhsindiana.com/members/hip/how-to-enroll.html)
2. **Hoosier Care Connect**: [How to Enroll in Hoosier Care Connect](https://www.mhsindiana.com/members/care-connect/how-to-enroll.html)
3. **Hoosier Healthwise**: [How to Enroll in Hoosier Healthwise](https://www.mhsindiana.com/members/medicaid/how-to-enroll.html)
4. **Ambetter Health**: Information available on [Ambetter Health page](https://www.mhsindiana.com/members/ambetter.html), with a link to [Ambetter Health enrollment](http://ambetter.mhsindiana.com)

## Enrollment Process
The general enrollment process involves checking eligibility based on age, income, family size, and special health needs. Specific details for each plan can be found on their respective 'How to Enroll' pages.

## Eligibility Criteria
Eligibility criteria vary by plan:
- **Healthy Indiana Plan (HIP)**: Ages 19 to 64 with specific income levels.
- **Hoosier Healthwise**: Children up to age 19 based on family income.
- **Hoosier Care Connect**: Age 65 and over, or with blindness or a disability, residing in the community and not eligible for Medicare.
- **Ambetter Health**: Individuals and families; eligibility for financial help based on family size and income.
- **Wellcare by Allwell and Wellcare Complete**: Medicare Advantage plans; eligibility criteria not detailed on this page.

## Contact Information
For assistance with enrollment or more information:
- Call: 1-877-647-4848 (TTY: 1-800-743-3333)
- Available support for different languages and formats.

## Related Resources
- **FSSA website**: [Medicaid eligibility](https://www.in.gov/medicaid/members/52.htm)
- **HealthCare.gov**: [Health Insurance Marketplace](https://www.healthcare.gov/)
- **Medicare.gov**: [Medicare options](https://www.medicare.gov/)
- **Plan-specific pages**: Links to detailed information on each health insurance plan offered by MHS.

Attachments:

qa_pairs.question: What is the process for enrolling in health insurance plans through MHS?
qa_pairs.answer: The general enrollment process involves checking eligibility based on age, income, family size, and special health needs. Specific details for each plan can be found on their respective 'How to Enroll' pages: Healthy Indiana Plan (HIP) - https://www.mhsindiana.com/members/hip/how-to-enroll.html, Hoosier Care Connect - https://www.mhsindiana.com/members/care-connect/how-to-enroll.html, Hoosier Healthwise - https://www.mhsindiana.com/members/medicaid/how-to-enroll.html, Ambetter Health - https://www.mhsindiana.com/members/ambetter.html with enrollment link at http://ambetter.mhsindiana.com.

qa_pairs.question: How do I check my eligibility for health insurance plans?
qa_pairs.answer: Eligibility criteria vary by plan. You can check eligibility based on age, income, family size, and special health needs. For specific criteria, refer to the respective plan's eligibility details: Healthy Indiana Plan (HIP) - ages 19 to 64 with specific income levels, Hoosier Healthwise - children up to age 19 based on family income, Hoosier Care Connect - age 65 and over, or with blindness or a disability, residing in the community and not eligible for Medicare, Ambetter Health - individuals and families with eligibility for financial help based on family size and income.

qa_pairs.question: What are the eligibility criteria for Healthy Indiana Plan (HIP)?
qa_pairs.answer: The Healthy Indiana Plan (HIP) is available for individuals aged 19 to 64 with specific income levels. More information can be found on the HIP eligibility page.

qa_pairs.question: Where can I find more information about the different health insurance plans offered by MHS?

qa_pairs.question: How do I enroll in Hoosier Healthwise?
qa_pairs.answer: To enroll in Hoosier Healthwise, check your eligibility based on family income for children up to age 19. Detailed enrollment steps can be found on the Hoosier Healthwise enrollment page: https://www.mhsindiana.com/members/medicaid/how-to-enroll.html.

qa_pairs.answer: The specific enrollment periods for Ambetter Health are not detailed on the provided page. However, you can find information on the Ambetter Health page: https://www.mhsindiana.com/members/ambetter.html, with enrollment link at http://ambetter.mhsindiana.com.

qa_pairs.answer: Related resources include the FSSA website for Medicaid eligibility (https://www.in.gov/medicaid/members/52.htm), HealthCare.gov for Health Insurance Marketplace (https://www.healthcare.gov/), and Medicare.gov for Medicare options (https://www.medicare.gov/).

## Benefits Services Information

The 'Benefits Services' section on the MHS Indiana website provides comprehensive information about the benefits and services covered under different health plans. The website contains links to various member handbooks in PDF format, which detail the benefits and services for each plan:
- HIP Member Handbook: https://www.mhsindiana.com/members/hip/health-services.html
- Hoosier Care Connect Member Handbook: https://www.mhsindiana.com/members/care-connect/benefits-services.html
- Hoosier Healthwise Member Handbook: https://www.mhsindiana.com/members/medicaid/benefits-services.html

These handbooks provide detailed information about the benefits, covered services, and member responsibilities for each health plan. Members can access these handbooks to understand their benefits and how to utilize the services provided by MHS Indiana.

### Key Information
- **Phone Number**: 1-877-647-4848 (TTY: 1-800-743-3333)
- **Website**: mhsindiana.com
- **Language Assistance**: MHS will provide information at no cost to members in different languages or formats.

### Instructions
1. Navigate to the relevant member handbook based on your health plan.
2. Review the 'Benefits Services' section in the handbook for detailed information about covered services.
3. Contact MHS Member Services at 1-877-647-4848 for any further assistance or clarification.

browser_content:
## Hoosier Care Connect Information

### What is Hoosier Care Connect?
Hoosier Care Connect is a health care program for individuals aged 59 years and younger, blind or disabled, and who are also not eligible for Medicare.

### Purpose
The purpose of Hoosier Care Connect is to provide health care coverage to eligible individuals.

### Eligibility Criteria
The eligibility criteria for Hoosier Care Connect include:
* Individuals aged 59 years and younger
* Blind individuals
* Disabled individuals
* Individuals receiving Supplemental Security Income (SSI)
* Individuals enrolled through M.E.D. Works
* Some foster care children

### Benefits Covered
Hoosier Care Connect members will receive all Indiana Medicaid-covered benefits, including:
* Care coordination services
* Behavioral Health
* Dental Care
* Flu Shots
* Health Needs Screening
* Immunizations and Preventive Care
* Pharmacy services
* Pregnancy-related services
* Rewards Program
* Smoking Cessation
* Telehealth
* Transportation
* Vision Care

### Relevant Links
The relevant links mentioned on the page are:
* [/members/care-connect/how-to-enroll.html](how to enroll in Hoosier Care Connect)
* [/members/care-connect/benefits-services.html](Benefits and Services)
* [/members/care-connect/benefits-services/health-needs-screening.html](Complete a Health Needs Screening)
* [/login.html](LOGIN to view claims, get an ID card, & more)
* [/members/care-connect/member-handbook.html](Member Handbook)
* [/members/care-connect/resources.html](Member Resources)

Attachments:

## Benefits and Services for Various Health Insurance Plans

The webpage provides information on several health insurance plans, including Healthy Indiana Plan, Hoosier Care Connect, Hoosier Healthwise, Ambetter Health, Wellcare by Allwell, and Wellcare Complete.

### Available Plans and Their Benefits

1. **Healthy Indiana Plan**: 
   - Affordable health insurance for uninsured adult Hoosiers.
   - Pays expenses.
   - Provides incentives for members to be health conscious.
   - Coverage for qualified low-income Hoosiers ages 19 to 64.

2. **Hoosier Care Connect**:
   - Coordinated care program for IHCP members age 65 and over, or with blindness or a disability.
   - Members select a managed care entity (MCE) for care coordination.
   - Includes Medicaid-covered benefits and care coordination services.

3. **Hoosier Healthwise**:
   - Health care program for children, pregnant women, and families with low income.
   - Covers medical care like doctor visits, prescription medicine, mental health care, dental care, hospitalizations, and surgeries.

4. **Ambetter Health**:
   - Affordable health care coverage for individuals and families through the Health Insurance Marketplace.
   - Potential help with monthly premiums based on family size and income.

5. **Wellcare by Allwell**:
   - Medicare Advantage plan providing coverage for seeing doctors and getting necessary care.
   - Offers caring case managers, member service representatives, and a 24-hour nurse line.

6. **Wellcare Complete**:
   - Medicare Advantage Prescription Drug plan.
   - Offers extra benefits and access to the Ascension network of doctors and specialists.

### Links to Detailed Benefits and Services

- [Healthy Indiana Plan Benefits & Services](/members/hip/health-services.html)
- [Hoosier Care Connect Benefits and Services](/members/care-connect/benefits-services.html)
- [Hoosier Healthwise Benefits and Services](/members/medicaid/benefits-services.html)

These links provide detailed information on the benefits and services offered by each plan.

### Contact Information
- Phone: 1-877-647-4848
- TTY: 1-800-743-3333

Attachments:

qa_pairs.question: What are the benefits of the Healthy Indiana Plan?
qa_pairs.answer: The Healthy Indiana Plan provides affordable health insurance for uninsured adult Hoosiers, pays expenses, and offers incentives for members to be health conscious. ## Caregiver Resources Information

### Program Explanation
The Caregiving Collaborations™ program is designed to support caregivers by improving their quality of life and providing extra support as they care for others. The program assists with personal care, chores, emotional support, medical care, and finances.

### Relevant Links
- [Caregiver Resources](https://www.mhsindiana.com/members/care-connect/caregiver-resources.html)
  - [Organizational Tools](https://www.mhsindiana.com/members/care-connect/caregiver-resources/organizational-tools.html)
  - [Member Care](https://www.mhsindiana.com/members/care-connect/caregiver-resources/member-care.html)

### Phone Numbers
- Caregiver Support: 1-877-647-4848
- TTY: 1-800-743-3333

### Instructions
Caregivers can contact the MHS Care Team at 1-877-647-4848 to learn more about the Caregiving Collaborations™ program.

### Other Important Details
- The program is offered by Managed Health Services (MHS).
- Caregivers can access information in different languages or formats at no cost by calling 1-877-647-4848 (TTY: 1-800-743-3333).
- Adobe Reader is required to open PDFs on the website, and can be downloaded for free from [Adobe's website](https://get.adobe.com/reader/).

Attachments:

browser_content:
## Foster Care Resources Explanation
MHS and the state of Indiana provide resources and support for foster children and families. The webpage offers various links, phone numbers, and instructions to assist foster parents and families in need.

## Helpful Links
1. [Adult & Child Health](https://adultandchild.org/) - Therapeutic foster care training programs, licensing forms, and other resources.
2. [Firefly Children & Family Alliance](https://fireflyin.org/) - Information on foster care, older youth services, adoption, child care, and training opportunities.
3. [Child Welfare Information Gateway](https://www.childwelfare.gov/fostercaremonth/) - Information about National Foster Care Month, resources, and real-life foster care stories.
4. [Indiana Association of Resources and Child Advocacy (IARCA)](http://www.iarca.org/) - Promotes cooperation among organizations providing services to children and their families.
5. [Indiana Department of Child Services](https://www.in.gov/dcs/foster-and-kinship-care/) - Information for foster parents, foster children, relative/kinship caregivers, forms, and policies.
6. [Indiana’s Waiting Children](https://www.adoptuskids.org/states/in/browse.aspx) - Information on Indiana’s children in foster care waiting for adoption.
7. [Foster Success](https://fostersuccess.org/) - Assistance and resources for youth transitioning out of the foster care system.
8. [The Villages of Indiana](https://www.villageskids.org/) - Programs related to Indiana families and children, including foster and adoptive parent information.
9. [CBH Training](http://www.centenefostercare.com) - MHS resource for foster care training.

## Phone Numbers
1. Indiana Child Abuse and Neglect Hotline: 1-800-800-5556
2. Foster Care Helpline: 888-631-9510
3. MHS Dedicated Foster Care Team: 1-877-647-4848 (ask for Foster Care Team)

## Instructions for Immediate Support
1. Dial **2-1-1** for free, confidential services 24/7 for food, shelter, housing assistance, employment services, counseling resources, and crisis support.
2. Text **MHS** to **741741** for free, anonymous support 24/7.

## Additional Information
- The webpage is available in English and Spanish.
- For information in different languages or formats, call 1-877-647-4848 (TTY: 1-800-743-3333).

Attachments:

# Member News Compilation

## Overview of 'Member News'
The 'Member News' section on the MHS Indiana website provides updates and information relevant to members. It includes articles on various health programs, member advisory councils, and other related topics.

## Extracted Articles

### Article 1
- **Title**: June is Men’s Health Month!
- **Link**: [/newsroom/men-s-health-month.html](/newsroom/men-s-health-month.html)
- **Description**: Studies show that men have a higher rate of gum disease.

### Article 2
- **Title**: Celebrating Mother's Day: A Reminder of the Importance of Maternal Oral Health
- **Link**: [/newsroom/maternal-oral-health1.html](/newsroom/maternal-oral-health1.html)
- **Description**: This Mother’s Day let us take a moment to honor the amazing mother figures in our lives.

### Article 3
- **Title**: MHS Serves
- **Link**: [/newsroom/mhs-serves-youth-mental-health.html](/newsroom/mhs-serves-youth-mental-health.html)
- **Description**: MHS Serves, the health equity program from MHS, announces the next opportunity for partnership in continuation of its efforts to support key community-based programs and resources across Indiana that focus on reducing and eliminating health disparities.

### Article 4
- **Title**: We’ve Moved!
- **Link**: [/newsroom/office-move.html](/newsroom/office-move.html)
- **Description**: The MHS offices are in a new location! Please make note of our new address.

### Article 5
- **Title**: Change Health Incident
- **Link**: [/newsroom/notice-of-data-breach/change-health-incident.html](/newsroom/notice-of-data-breach/change-health-incident.html)
- **Description**: This notice is from Change Healthcare (CHC) about a recent security incident.

### Article 6
- **Title**: Maximize Your Health During Health Literacy Month
- **Link**: [/newsroom/member-health-literacy.html](/newsroom/member-health-literacy.html)
- **Description**: Have you ever gone to the doctor and felt confused by all the big medical words they use? You’re not alone!

### Article 7
- **Title**: Notice of Data Breach
- **Link**: [/newsroom/notice-of-data-breach.html](/newsroom/notice-of-data-breach.html)
- **Description**: We are sorry to tell you about a privacy event. This letter is from Change Healthcare (“CHC”).

### Article 8
- **Title**: YMCA Partnership
- **Link**: [/newsroom/YMCA-2.html](/newsroom/YMCA-2.html)
- **Description**: As an MHS member, your child can get a FREE 6-month YMCA Membership. That’s right, a gym membership at no cost to you!

### Article 9
- **Title**: MHS at the 2024 Indiana State Fair
- **Link**: [/newsroom/2024-state-fair.html](/newsroom/2024-state-fair.html)
- **Description**: Summer is here and so is the opening day for the 2024 Indiana State Fair.

### Article 10
- **Title**: MHS Serves
- **Link**: [/newsroom/mhs-serves.html](/newsroom/mhs-serves.html)
- **Description**: Today, MHS announced the creation of MHS Serves, a $12 million health equity fund that will support key community-based programs and resources across Indiana that focus on reducing and eliminating health disparities.

## Additional Information
- The 'Member News' page includes articles from different months, indicating regular updates.
- There are navigation buttons for multiple pages, suggesting extensive content.
- Contact information: 1-877-647-4848 (TTY: 1-800-743-3333) is available at the bottom of the page.

## Key Features and Capabilities
- The 'Member News' section provides timely updates on health programs and initiatives.
- It includes information on member benefits, such as the YMCA partnership.
- Announcements about changes, like the office move, are also communicated here.

## Relevant Links
- [/newsroom/men-s-health-month.html](/newsroom/men-s-health-month.html)
- [/newsroom/maternal-oral-health1.html](/newsroom/maternal-oral-health1.html)
- [/newsroom/mhs-serves-youth-mental-health.html](/newsroom/mhs-serves-youth-mental-health.html)
- [/newsroom/office-move.html](/newsroom/office-move.html)
- [/newsroom/notice-of-data-breach/change-health-incident.html](/newsroom/notice-of-data-breach/change-health-incident.html)
- [/newsroom/member-health-literacy.html](/newsroom/member-health-literacy.html)
- [/newsroom/notice-of-data-breach.html](/newsroom/notice-of-data-breach.html)
- [/newsroom/YMCA-2.html](/newsroom/YMCA-2.html)
- [/newsroom/2024-state-fair.html](/newsroom/2024-state-fair.html)
- [/newsroom/mhs-serves.html](/newsroom/mhs-serves.html)

## Instructions and Resources
- Members are encouraged to stay informed about health literacy and various programs.
- Contact information is provided for additional assistance: 1-877-647-4848 (TTY: 1-800-743-3333).

## Conclusion
The 'Member News' section on the MHS Indiana website is a valuable resource for members, providing updates on health initiatives, member benefits, and important announcements. Members can stay informed about various programs and services available to them.

browser_content:
## Member Resources Summary

### Purpose
Member Resources are designed to provide support and information to members of Managed Health Services (MHS) across various health insurance plans.

### Relevant Links
1. [Hoosier Care Connect Member Resources](https://www.mhsindiana.com/members/care-connect/resources.html)
2. [Hoosier Healthwise Member Resources](https://www.mhsindiana.com/members/medicaid/resources.html)

### Instructions
Members can access resources specific to their health insurance plans through the provided links.

### Phone Numbers
1. 1-877-647-4848 (General Inquiry)
2. TTY: 1-800-743-3333 (For hearing or speech impairments)

### Key Features
1. **Health Insurance Plans**: MHS offers various health insurance plans including Healthy Indiana Plan, Hoosier Care Connect, Hoosier Healthwise, Ambetter Health, Wellcare by Allwell, and Wellcare Complete.
2. **Member Portal**: Members can view claims, get a new ID card, and update their information through the Member Portal.
3. **Provider Search**: Members can find doctors, hospitals, pharmacies, and specialty providers in the MHS network.
4. **Health Needs Screening**: Members can complete a Health Needs Screening.
5. **Rewards Program**: Members can participate in the Healthy Rewards Program.

### Other Relevant Details
1. **Language Assistance**: MHS provides language assistance at no cost to members. Members can call 1-877-647-4848 (TTY: 1-800-743-3333) for assistance.
2. **Member Handbooks**: Members can access handbooks specific to their health insurance plans.
3. **News and Events**: Members can find news and events related to their health insurance plans.

Attachments:

qa_pairs.question: Who should I contact about Member Resources?
qa_pairs.answer: Members can contact MHS by calling 1-877-647-4848 (General Inquiry) or TTY: 1-800-743-3333 (For hearing or speech impairments) for assistance.

qa_pairs.question: What health insurance plans are offered by MHS?
qa_pairs.answer: MHS offers various health insurance plans including Healthy Indiana Plan, Hoosier Care Connect, Hoosier Healthwise, Ambetter Health, Wellcare by Allwell, and Wellcare Complete.

qa_pairs.answer: Members can view claims, get a new ID card, and update their information through the Member Portal. Specific instructions are not provided, but members can likely find more information on the MHS website or by contacting MHS directly.

qa_pairs.question: Can I get language assistance through Member Resources?
qa_pairs.answer: Yes, MHS provides language assistance at no cost to members. Members can call 1-877-647-4848 (TTY: 1-800-743-3333) for assistance.

qa_pairs.question: How can I participate in the Healthy Rewards Program?
qa_pairs.answer: Members can participate in the Healthy Rewards Program through the Member Resources. Specific steps are not provided, but members can likely find more information on the MHS website or by contacting MHS directly.

browser_content:
## Opioid Resources

### Explanation
Opioid use disorder is recognized as a disease, and there are treatment options available. Recovery is possible.

### Relevant Links
1. [Indiana Commission to Combat Substance Use Disorder Website](https://www.in.gov/recovery/know-the-facts/?gad_source=1&gad_campaignid=21991732682&gbraid=0AAAAAphOB6aUdZQEOX-pTO6LvIzhyjaFO&gclid=EAIaIQobChMIrNSi0JzvjQMVzjYIBR0v5TquEAAYASAAEgKsdfD_BwE)): Provides information on prevention, education, treatment options, and resources for substance use disorder.
2. [Indiana 211](https://www.in211.org/need-help-call-2-1-1-or-search-our-database/): Offers substance abuse resources by dialing 2-1-1 or searching their database.
3. [Krames Health Library](https://mhsindiana.kramesonline.com/): Contains evidence-based information on opioid use.

### Instructions
1. For substance abuse resources, dial 2-1-1 or search the database on the Indiana 211 website.
2. Visit the Indiana Commission to Combat Substance Use Disorder website for resources on prevention, education, treatment options, and more.
3. Use the Krames Health Library for evidence-based information on opioid use.

### Phone Numbers
1. **1-877-647-4848**: Call to ask for Care Management or use the nurse advice line.
2. **1-800-743-3333** (TTY): For hearing impaired assistance.

### Key Features
1. **Indiana 211**: Connects Hoosiers to substance abuse resources.
2. **Indiana Commission to Combat Substance Use Disorder**: Provides resources on prevention, education, and treatment options.
3. **Krames Health Library**: Offers evidence-based information on opioid use.
4. **MHS Care Manager**: Available for personalized support and services.
5. **Crisis Text Line**: Text **MHS** to **741741** for free, anonymous support 24/7.
6. **Nurse Advice Line**: Call **1-877-647-4848** for health concerns.

### Other Relevant Details
1. **Available Resources**: 
   - Fresh Start for You (PDF)
   - Indiana's Opioid Epidemic (PDF)
   - Recovery is Possible (PDF)
   - Stay Safe When Using Pain Medication (PDF)
2. **Language Assistance**: MHS will provide information in different languages or formats at no cost. Call 1-877-647-4848 (TTY: 1-800-743-3333).

Attachments:

qa_pairs.question: What is Opioid Resources?
qa_pairs.answer: Opioid Resources provides information and support for individuals dealing with opioid use disorder. It includes links to various resources such as the Indiana Commission to Combat Substance Use Disorder Website, Indiana 211, and Krames Health Library.

qa_pairs.question: How do I access substance abuse resources in Indiana?
qa_pairs.answer: You can access substance abuse resources by dialing 2-1-1 or searching the database on the Indiana 211 website. Additionally, you can visit the Indiana Commission to Combat Substance Use Disorder website for more information.

qa_pairs.question: Why should I use the Krames Health Library?
qa_pairs.answer: The Krames Health Library offers evidence-based information on opioid use, which can help individuals understand their condition and make informed decisions about their treatment.

qa_pairs.question: When can I contact the Nurse Advice Line?
qa_pairs.answer: You can contact the Nurse Advice Line at 1-877-647-4848 for health concerns. This service is available for personalized support.

qa_pairs.question: Where can I find more information on opioid use disorder treatment options?
qa_pairs.answer: You can visit the Indiana Commission to Combat Substance Use Disorder website for resources on prevention, education, and treatment options. Additionally, the Krames Health Library provides evidence-based information on opioid use.

qa_pairs.question: Who should I contact for Care Management services?
qa_pairs.answer: You can call 1-877-647-4848 to ask for Care Management services or use the nurse advice line. MHS Care Manager is available for personalized support and services.

qa_pairs.question: What resources are available for individuals dealing with opioid use disorder?
qa_pairs.answer: Available resources include Fresh Start for You (PDF), Indiana's Opioid Epidemic (PDF), Recovery is Possible (PDF), and Stay Safe When Using Pain Medication (PDF). You can also contact MHS for more information.

qa_pairs.question: How can I get language assistance for Opioid Resources?
qa_pairs.answer: MHS will provide information in different languages or formats at no cost. You can call 1-877-647-4848 (TTY: 1-800-743-3333) for language assistance.

qa_pairs.question: What is the Crisis Text Line and how do I use it?
qa_pairs.answer: The Crisis Text Line is a service that provides free, anonymous support 24/7. You can text 'MHS' to '741741' to use this service.

qa_pairs.question: Can I get help if I am hearing impaired?
qa_pairs.answer: Yes, MHS provides assistance for the hearing impaired. You can call 1-800-743-3333 (TTY) for help.

browser_content:
## Hoosier Healthwise Information

### Definition and Purpose
Hoosier Healthwise (HHW) is one of the Indiana Medicaid programs. It is the State of Indiana’s health care program for children, pregnant women, and families with low income. The purpose of Hoosier Healthwise is to provide health care coverage to eligible individuals, including medical care like doctor visits, prescription medicine, mental health care, dental care, hospitalizations, surgeries, and family planning at little or no cost.

### Eligibility
Children up to age 19 may be eligible for coverage based on family income.

### Key Features
- Covers medical care like doctor visits, prescription medicine, mental health care, dental care, hospitalizations, surgeries, and family planning.
- Offers various benefits and services, including:
  + Behavioral Health
  + Health Needs Screening
  + Immunizations and Preventive Care
  + Member ID Card
  + Pharmacy services
  + Pregnancy-related services
  + Premiums and Copays
  + Care Management
  + Dental Care
  + Flu Shots
  + Rewards Program
  + Smoking Cessation
  + Telehealth
  + Transportation
  + Vision Care

### Relevant Links
- [Hoosier Healthwise Main Page](/members/medicaid.html)
- [Login to Hoosier Healthwise](/members/medicaid/login1.html)
- [How to Enroll](/members/medicaid/how-to-enroll.html)
- [Benefits and Services](/members/medicaid/benefits-services.html)
- [Find a Provider](/members/medicaid/find-a-provider.html)
- [Member Handbook](/members/medicaid/member-handbook.html)
- [Member Resources](/members/medicaid/resources.html)
- [Opioid Resources](/members/medicaid/opioid-resources.html)
- [Health & Wellness](/members/medicaid/health-wellness.html)

### Instructions
- To enroll, visit the [How to Enroll](/members/medicaid/how-to-enroll.html) page.
- Members can complete a [Health Needs Screening](/members/medicaid/benefits-services/health-needs-screening.html).
- To view claims, get an ID card, and more, [login to Hoosier Healthwise](/members/medicaid/login1.html).

### Phone Numbers
- Main Phone: 1-877-647-4848
- TTY: 1-800-743-3333

Attachments:

browser_content:
## Overview of Ambetter Health

Ambetter Health is a health insurance provider that offers affordable health plans in Indiana. It is underwritten by Coordinated Care Corporation, a Qualified Health Plan issuer in the Indiana Health Insurance Marketplace.

## Key Features and Capabilities

1. **My Health Pays Rewards Program**: Earn rewards for taking charge of your health.
   - Link: [My Health Pays Rewards](https://ambetter.mhsindiana.com/health-plans/my-health-pays.html)

2. **Optional Dental and Vision**: Available for additional coverage.
   - Link: [View Options](https://ambetter.mhsindiana.com/health-plans/our-benefits.html)

3. **Tax Credits**: Eligible members can receive premium tax credits.
   - Link: [Learn More](https://ambetter.mhsindiana.com/health-plans/ways-to-save/premium-tax-credits.html)

4. **Start Smart for Your Baby**: Maternity health programs for expecting mothers.
   - Link: [See Details](https://ambetter.mhsindiana.com/health-plans/our-benefits/start-smart.html)

5. **Better Health Center**: Resources for health tips, financial advice, and more.
   - Link: [Read Now](https://ambetter.mhsindiana.com/resources/better-health-center.html)

6. **Health Management Programs**: Personalized help for managing chronic conditions like diabetes and asthma.
   - Link: [Find Support](https://ambetter.mhsindiana.com/health-plans/our-benefits/health-management.html)

7. **Virtual 24/7 Care**: Access to medical help via video and phone.
   - Link: [Learn More](https://ambetter.mhsindiana.com/health-plans/our-benefits/ambetter-telehealth.html)

8. **Ambetter Health App**: Mobile app for managing healthcare on-the-go.
   - Link: [Download](https://ambetter.mhsindiana.com/resources/mobile-app.html)

## Important Details

- **Phone Number**: 1-877-687-1182 (TTY 1-800-743-3333)
- **Member Services**: Contact for assistance with plans and services.

## Relevant Links

- [What is Ambetter Health?](https://ambetter.mhsindiana.com/health-plans/what-is-ambetter.html)
- [Shop and Compare Plans](https://enroll.ambetterhealth.com/)
- [Find a Doctor](https://ambetter.mhsindiana.com/find-a-provider.html)
- [Member Login](https://member.ambetterhealth.com/)
- [Provider Login](https://ambetter.mhsindiana.com/provider-resources/login.html)
- [Broker Login](https://broker.ambetterhealth.com/s/login/)

## Instructions and Resources

1. **How to Enroll**: Four easy steps to enroll in a plan.
   - Link: [Become a Member](https://ambetter.mhsindiana.com/join-ambetter/become-a-member/how-to-enroll.html)

2. **Forms and Materials**: Access to necessary forms for members.
   - Link: [Forms and Materials](https://ambetter.mhsindiana.com/resources/handbooks-forms.html)

3. **Renew Your Plan**: Information on renewing your health insurance plan.
   - Link: [Renewal Information](https://ambetter.mhsindiana.com/resources/renewal-information.html)

## Related Resources

- **Provider Resources**: Information and login for healthcare providers.
  - Link: [Provider Resources](https://ambetter.mhsindiana.com/provider-resources/manuals-and-forms.html)
- **Broker Resources**: Information and login for brokers.
  - Link: [Broker Login](https://broker.ambetterhealth.com/s/login/)

Attachments:

browser_content:
## Information about 'Wellcare by Allwell'

### Purpose
Wellcare by Allwell is a Medicare Advantage plan provided by Centene Corporation, offering various health benefits and care options to its members.

### Relevant Links
- [Shop for a Plan](https://wellcare.isf.io/2026)
- [Health Benefits & Care Options](/health-benefits-care-options.html)
- [Find Your Plan](/find-your-plan.html)
- [Search for a Drug](/drug-pharmacy/formulary.html)
- [Member Login](/member-resources/member-login.html)
- [Contact Us](/contact-us.html)

### Instructions
- To shop for a plan, visit [Shop for a Plan](https://wellcare.isf.io/2026).
- To find your plan details, visit [Find Your Plan](/find-your-plan.html).
- To search for a drug, visit [Search for a Drug](/drug-pharmacy/formulary.html).

### Phone Numbers
- Member Services: Available on the [Contact Us](/contact-us.html) page.

### People Names
- No specific people names are mentioned on the webpage.

### Addresses
- No specific addresses are mentioned on the webpage.

### Key Features
1. **Over-the-Counter (OTC) Benefits**: Allowance for everyday items. [Explore OTC Benefits](/member-resources/member-perks/otc-benefit.html)
2. **Telehealth**: Virtual visits with a provider. [Explore Telehealth Benefits](/member-resources/member-perks/telehealth.html)
3. **Dental Benefits**: Benefits to make you smile. [Explore Dental Benefits](/member-resources/member-perks/dental.html)
4. **Wellcare Spendables Card**: Added perks for D-SNP members. [Explore Wellcare Spendables](/member-resources/member-perks/spendables.html)
5. **My Wellcare Rewards**: It pays to make healthy choices. [Explore Wellcare Rewards](/member-resources/member-perks/member-rewards.html)

### Other Relevant Details
- Wellcare by Allwell is becoming Wellcare in 2026, with the same dependable coverage and benefits.
- The plan offers a secure member portal to view plan details, access digital Member ID Card, and search for in-network doctors and pharmacies.
- Wellcare is the Medicare brand for Centene Corporation, an HMO, PPO, PFFS, PDP plan with a Medicare contract and is an approved Part D Sponsor.
- D-SNP plans have a contract with the state Medicaid program.
- Enrollment in the plans depends on contract renewal.
- Out-of-network/non-contracted providers are under no obligation to treat Plan members, except in emergency situations.

Attachments:

## Wellcare Complete and its Purpose

Wellcare By Allwell is a Medicare Advantage plan designed with the member's health in mind. It offers various benefits and services to its members.

## Key Features and Capabilities

1. **Over-the-Counter Benefits**: Members can access personal care items.
2. **Telehealth**: Members can access care remotely.
3. **Dental Benefits**: Coverage for dental care.
4. **Transportation Benefits**: Assistance with transportation to healthcare services.
5. **Wellcare Spendables Card**: Available for Dual Eligible Special Needs Plans (DSNPs).
6. **Interoperability and Patient Access Rule**: Members can view their health information through third-party apps.
7. **Video Library**: Educational videos on various health-related topics.

## Relevant Links

1. [Learn about your 2026 coverage options](https://www.wellcarecomplete.com/plan-transition.html)

browser_content:
## Get the Most from Your Coverage Information

The 'Get the Most from Your Coverage' section on the MHS Indiana website provides information about various health insurance plans available. The purpose is to help users understand and maximize their coverage.

### Health Insurance Plans:
1. Healthy Indiana Plan (/members/healthy-indiana-plan.html)

browser_content:
## Detailed Information about 'Provider Portal Login'

### Purpose
The Provider Portal Login is designed for contracted healthcare providers to access various tools and services, including verifying member eligibility, checking and submitting claims, submitting and confirming authorizations, and viewing detailed patient lists.

### Relevant Links
1. **Provider Portal Login**: [/providers/login.html](https://provider.mhsindiana.com/)
2. **Vision Provider Portal Login**: [Vision Provider Portal Login](https://visionbenefits.envolvehealth.com/logon.aspx)
3. **Dental Provider Portal Login**: [Dental Provider Portal Login](https://pwp.envolvedental.com/PWP/Landing)

### Instructions
1. Contracted providers can register directly on the Provider Portal.
2. Non-contracted providers can register after submitting their first claim.
3. For registration assistance, contact the Secure Provider Portal Help Line at 1-877-647-4848.

### Phone Numbers
1. **Secure Provider Portal Help Line**: 1-877-647-4848
2. **TTY**: 1-800-743-3333

### Key Features
1. Verify member eligibility
2. Check and submit claims
3. Submit and confirm authorizations
4. View detailed patient list
5. Access to user manual after successful login

### Additional Details
1. The Provider Portal is part of the Managed Health Services (MHS) offerings for providers.
2. MHS provides language assistance and accessibility features, including information in different languages and formats at no cost to the user.
3. The website is accessible in English and Spanish.

### Registration Help
For trouble with registration, providers may need to submit a non-par set-up form, available on the [Become a Provider](https://provider.mhsindiana.com/providers/become-a-provider.html) page.

### User Manual
The user manual for the Provider Portal is available after successful login.

### Contact Information
For further assistance, providers can call the Secure Provider Portal Help Line at 1-877-647-4848 or visit the [Contact Us](https://provider.mhsindiana.com/contact-us.html) page.

Attachments:

qa_pairs.question: What is the Provider Portal Login used for?
qa_pairs.answer: The Provider Portal Login is designed for contracted healthcare providers to access various tools and services, including verifying member eligibility, checking and submitting claims, submitting and confirming authorizations, and viewing detailed patient lists.

qa_pairs.question: How do I register for the Provider Portal?
qa_pairs.answer: Contracted providers can register directly on the Provider Portal. Non-contracted providers can register after submitting their first claim. For registration assistance, contact the Secure Provider Portal Help Line at 1-877-647-4848.

qa_pairs.question: Why should I use the Provider Portal Login?
qa_pairs.answer: The Provider Portal Login provides access to various tools and services that help healthcare providers manage their practice, including verifying member eligibility, checking and submitting claims, submitting and confirming authorizations, and viewing detailed patient lists.

qa_pairs.question: When can I access the Provider Portal Login?
qa_pairs.answer: The Provider Portal Login is available for use at any time. Contracted providers can register directly, while non-contracted providers can register after submitting their first claim.

qa_pairs.question: Where can I find the Provider Portal Login?
qa_pairs.answer: The Provider Portal Login can be accessed at https://provider.mhsindiana.com/. There are also separate login portals for Vision and Dental providers at https://visionbenefits.envolvehealth.com/logon.aspx and https://pwp.envolvedental.com/PWP/Landing, respectively.

qa_pairs.question: Who should I contact for help with Provider Portal Login?
qa_pairs.answer: For assistance with the Provider Portal Login, contact the Secure Provider Portal Help Line at 1-877-647-4848 or visit the Contact Us page at https://provider.mhsindiana.com/contact-us.html.

qa_pairs.question: What are the key features of the Provider Portal?
qa_pairs.answer: The key features of the Provider Portal include verifying member eligibility, checking and submitting claims, submitting and confirming authorizations, viewing detailed patient lists, and accessing the user manual after successful login.

qa_pairs.question: How do I access the user manual for the Provider Portal?
qa_pairs.answer: The user manual for the Provider Portal is available after successful login to the portal.

qa_pairs.question: What language options are available on the Provider Portal?
qa_pairs.answer: The Provider Portal is accessible in English and Spanish. MHS also provides language assistance and accessibility features, including information in different languages and formats at no cost to the user.

qa_pairs.question: What should I do if I have trouble registering for the Provider Portal?
qa_pairs.answer: If you have trouble registering, you may need to submit a non-par set-up form, available on the Become a Provider page at https://provider.mhsindiana.com/providers/become-a-provider.html. You can also contact the Secure Provider Portal Help Line at 1-877-647-4848 for assistance.

## Behavioral Health Services Information

* **Behavioral Care for Adults**: 
  - Clinical and member services teams provide information and support.
  - Flexible care coordination and utilization management programs are available to help with recovery barriers such as housing, transportation, and employment.

* **Behavioral Care for Children**: 
  - Assistance is provided to help families manage symptoms and stress.
  - Support includes helping families navigate the system, treatment options, transportation, childcare, and community resources.

* **Accessing Services**: 
  - Members can call MHS at **1-877-647-4848** to ask for a Behavioral Health Case Manager.

* **Additional Resources**:
  - BH Forms: Available at [/providers/behavioral-health/bh-provider-forms.html](/providers/behavioral-health/bh-provider-forms.html)
  Opioid Resources: Available at [/providers/behavioral-health/opioid-resources.html](/providers/behavioral-health/opioid-resources.html)

* **Language Assistance**: 
  - Information is available in different languages and formats at no cost.
  - Contact: **1-877-647-4848** (TTY: **1-800-743-3333**) for assistance.

* **Last Updated**: 02/07/2025

Attachments:

qa_pairs.question: What is Behavioral Health?
qa_pairs.answer: Behavioral Health refers to the services provided for mental health and substance abuse treatment. It includes care for adults and children, offering support for managing symptoms, stress, and recovery barriers like housing and employment.

qa_pairs.question: How do I access Behavioral Health services?
qa_pairs.answer: To access Behavioral Health services, members can call MHS at 1-877-647-4848 to request a Behavioral Health Case Manager. This service is available for both adults and children.

qa_pairs.question: What kind of support is available for adults under Behavioral Health?
qa_pairs.answer: For adults, Behavioral Health provides clinical and member services teams for information and support. It also includes flexible care coordination and utilization management programs to help with recovery barriers such as housing, transportation, and employment.

qa_pairs.question: Why should I use Behavioral Health services?
qa_pairs.answer: Behavioral Health services are designed to provide comprehensive support for managing mental health and substance abuse issues. They offer assistance in navigating the healthcare system, treatment options, and community resources, making it easier for individuals and families to manage their conditions.

qa_pairs.question: When can I access Behavioral Health services?
qa_pairs.answer: Behavioral Health services are available by contacting MHS at 1-877-647-4848. The service is accessible at any time to request a Behavioral Health Case Manager, although specific hours of operation are not mentioned.

qa_pairs.question: Where can I find additional resources for Behavioral Health?
qa_pairs.answer: Additional resources for Behavioral Health can be found on the MHS website. BH Forms are available at /providers/behavioral-health/bh-provider-forms.html and Opioid Resources at /providers/behavioral-health/opioid-resources.html.

qa_pairs.question: Who should I contact for Behavioral Health services?
qa_pairs.answer: For Behavioral Health services, you should contact MHS at 1-877-647-4848. For language assistance, the same number can be used, and TTY users can call 1-800-743-3333.

qa_pairs.question: Are Behavioral Health services available in different languages?
qa_pairs.answer: Yes, Behavioral Health services information is available in different languages and formats at no cost. You can contact 1-877-647-4848 (TTY: 1-800-743-3333) for language assistance.

qa_pairs.question: How can families with children benefit from Behavioral Health services?
qa_pairs.answer: Families with children can benefit from Behavioral Health services as they provide assistance in managing symptoms and stress. The services help families navigate the healthcare system, offer treatment options, transportation, childcare, and community resources.

qa_pairs.question: When was the Behavioral Health information last updated?
qa_pairs.answer: The Behavioral Health information was last updated on 02/07/2025.

## BH Forms

### Explanation and Purpose
'BH Forms' refer to various forms used for Behavioral Health services, specifically for Substance Use Disorder (SUD) treatment and other related services. The purpose of these forms is to facilitate the delivery of behavioral health services by providing necessary documentation for treatment, prior authorization, and other related processes.

### Relevant Links
1. [Discharge Consultation Documentation (PDF)](/content/dam/centene/mhsindiana/medicaid/pdfs/MHS_Discharge-Consultation_Doc_Form_508.pdf) - Form for discharge consultation documentation.
2. [Initial Assessment Form for Substance Use Disorder Treatment Admission](https://www.in.gov/medicaid/providers/files/SUD-Admission-Assessment-Form.pdf) - Initial assessment form for SUD treatment admission.
3. [Reassessment Form for Continued Substance Use Disorder Treatment](https://www.in.gov/medicaid/providers/files/SUD-Reassessment-Form.pdf) - Reassessment form for continued SUD treatment.
4. [Residential/Inpatient Substance Use Disorder Treatment Prior Authorization Request Form](https://www.in.gov/medicaid/providers/files/SUD-PA-form.pdf) - Prior authorization request form for residential/inpatient SUD treatment.
5. [Applied Behavioral Analysis Treatment OTR (PDF)](/content/dam/centene/mhsindiana/medicaid/pdfs/508-BH-IN-Medicaid-ABA-OTR.pdf) - Outpatient Treatment Request (OTR) form for Applied Behavioral Analysis treatment.
6. [IN Medicaid ABA Provider Request Tip Sheet (PDF)](/content/dam/centene/mhsindiana/medicaid/pdfs/508-ABA-Request-Tip-Sheet.pdf) - Tip sheet for IN Medicaid ABA provider requests.
7. [Intensive Outpatient Day Treatment Form (PDF)](/content/dam/centene/mhsindiana/medicaid/pdfs/MHS-BH-Intensive-Outpatient-Treatment-form-508.pdf) - Form for intensive outpatient day treatment.
8. [HHW/HIP Outpatient Treatment Request (OTR) Form (PDF)](/content/dam/centene/mhsindiana/medicaid/pdfs/MHS-Outpatient-Treatment-Request-Form-508.pdf) - OTR form for HHW/HIP outpatient treatment.

### Instructions
The webpage provides links to various forms and instructions for their use in behavioral health services, including SUD treatment.

### Phone Numbers
1. 1-877-647-4848 - Main contact number.
2. 1-800-743-3333 (TTY) - TTY number for those who need it.

### People Names
No specific people names are mentioned on the page.

### Addresses

<result>
## Clinical & Payment Policies 

### Clinical Policies
* Clinical policies are guidelines used to administer health plan benefits through prior authorization or payment rules.
* They cover evolving medical technologies, procedures, and pharmacy policies to determine medical necessity.
* Policies are based on:
  + Generally accepted standards of medical practice
  + Peer-reviewed medical literature
  + Government agency/program approval status
  + Evidence-based guidelines and positions of leading national health professional organizations
  + Views of physicians practicing in relevant clinical areas
  + Other available clinical information

### Relevant Policies and Resources
#### Ambetter Clinical Policies
* Available at: [Ambetter Clinical Payment Policies](https://ambetter.mhsindiana.com/provider-resources/clinical-payment-policies.html)

#### Medicaid Clinical Policies (A-H)
* [Adopted Clinical Practice and Preventive Health Guidelines (CPG Grid) (PDF)](/content/dam/centene/mhsindiana/policies/clinical-policies/CPG-Grid.pdf)

* [Applied Behavioral Analysis Documentation Requirements (CP.BH.105) (PDF)](/content/dam/centene/modes/mhsindiana/policies/clinical-policies/CP.BH.105.pdf)
* [Behavioral Health Treatment Documentation Requirements (CP.BH.500) (PDF)](/content/dam/centene/mhsindiana/policies/clinical-policies/CP.BH.500.pdf)
* [Biofeedback for Behavioral Health Disorders (CP.BH.300) (PDF)](/content/dam/centene/mhsindiana/policies/clinical-policies/CP.BH.300.pdf)
* [Bone-Anchored Hearing Aid (CP.MP.93) (PDF)](/content/dam/centene/mhsindiana/policies/clinical-policies/CP.MP.93.pdf)
* [Burn Surgery (CP.MP.186) (PDF)](/content/dam/centene/mhsindiana/policies/clinical-policies/CP.MP.186.pdf)
* [Caudal or Interlaminar Epidural Steroid Injections (CP.MP.164) (PDF)](/content/dam/centene/mhsindiana/policies/clinical-policies/CP.MP.164.pdf)
* [Clinical Trials (CP.MP.94) (PDF)](/content/dam/centene/policies/clinical-policies/CP.MP.94.pdf)
* [Cochlear Implant Replacements (CP.MP.14) (PDF)](/content/dam/centene/mhsindiana/policies/clinical-policies/CP.MP.14.pdf)

#### Medicaid Clinical Policies (I-Q)
* [Implantable Hypoglossal Nerve Stimulation for Obstructive Sleep Apnea (CP.MP.180) (PDF)](/content/dam/centene/mhsindiana/policies/clinical-policies/CP.MP.180.pdf)

* [Implantable Wireless Pulmonary Artery Pressure Monitoring  (CP.MP.160) (PDF)](/content/dam/centene/mhsindiana/policies/clinical-policies/CP.MP.160.pdf)
* [Intensity-Modulated Radiotherapy (CP.MP.69) (PDF)](/content/dam/centene/mhsindiana/policies/clinical-policies/CP.MP.69.pdf)

### Contact Information
For questions regarding clinical payment policies, contact Member Services and ask to be directed to the Medical Management department.

### Additional Resources

* [InterQual criteria](https://www.mhsindiana.com/providers/clinical-payment-policies.html)

## Comprehensive Information about 'Dental Providers'

### Clear Explanation of 'Dental Providers'
'Dental Providers' refers to a category of healthcare professionals including general and pediatric dentists, orthodontists, oral surgeons, and other dental professionals. The MHS Provider Directory allows members to search for these providers based on their location and insurance plan.

### Relevant Links
1. [MHS Provider Directory](https://findaprovider.mhsindiana.com): This is the main directory where members can search for dental providers.
2. [Find a Provider Home](https://www.mhsindiana.com/find-a-doctor/find-a-provider-home.html): This page provides instructions on how to search for providers, including dental providers.

### Instructions
1. Visit the [MHS Provider Directory](https://findaprovider.mhsindiana.com).
2. Enter your location (e.g., 'Indianapolis').
3. Select your insurance plan (e.g., 'Hoosier Healthwise').
4. Choose 'Dental' under the category section.
5. Perform the search to find a list of dental providers.

### Contact Information
- MHS Member Services: 1-877-647-4848

### Key Features and Capabilities
- The directory includes general and pediatric dentists, orthodontists, oral surgeons, and other dental professionals.
- Members can search for providers based on location and insurance plan.
- In case of an emergency, members are instructed to dial 911 immediately.

### Additional Information
The 'Find a Provider' page on the MHS website provides additional guidance on searching for providers and selecting the correct insurance plan. Members can also contact MHS Member Services for further assistance.

## Education & Trainings Details

### Purpose
The Education & Trainings section is designed to offer MHS providers and their office staff opportunities to learn from subject matter experts and ask questions about current topics and best practices.

### Relevant Links
- [Foster Care Training](/providers/provider-training/foster-care-training.html)
- [Orientations](/providers/provider-training/provider-meetings-and-orientations.html)

### Instructions
To register for webinars:
1. Fill out the registration form with First Name, Last Name, Practice/Organization, and Email.
2. Ensure the email address used is associated with a secure Provider Portal account if applicable.
3. Complete the reCAPTCHA verification.

### Phone Numbers
- 1-877-647-4848 (TTY: 1-800-743-3333)

### People's Names
No specific people's names are mentioned in the provided content.

### Addresses
No specific addresses are mentioned in the provided content.

### Key Features
- **Webinars**: Monthly webinars on various topics such as claims submission, billing best practices, and patient care.
- **Past Webinar Presentations**: Available topics include Access to Care, Behavioral Health Case Management, and Social Determinants of Health.
- **IHCP Works Seminars**: Topics include Behavioral Health Made Easy, Claims CMS-1500, and Prior Authorizations.

### Other Relevant Information
- Webinars are free and one hour in length.
- Registration is required for webinars.
- Past webinar presentations are available in PDF format.
- The section is updated regularly with new webinar schedules and topics.

### Upcoming Webinars
- **UB04 Open Office Hours: Mastering Claims Submission and Billing Best Practices** - October 30, 10:00 - 11:00 a.m. EST
- **CMS1500 Open Office Hours: Mastering Claims Submission and Billing Best Practices** - November 13, 10:00 - 11:00 a.m. EST
- **WellCare Provider Webinar: Advancing Excellence in Patient Care** - November 25, 1:00 - 2:00 p.m. EST
- **What's New in 2026: Innovations and Trends Shaping the MHS Provider** - December 18, 10:00 - 11:00 a.m. EST

browser_content:
## Foster Care Training Details

### Purpose and Explanation
The 'Foster Care Training' program is designed to provide foster care providers with the necessary skills and knowledge to care for children in foster care. The training covers various topics related to child development, trauma-informed care, and behavior management.

### Trainings Available:
1. Advocacy: Champion for Better Lives
2. Attachment Among Children & Youth in Foster Care
3. Behavior Management & Using Behavior Charts
4. Childhood Development: Birth to Early Adulthood
5. Childhood Traumatic Grief for Caregivers
6. Coping with Holiday Stress for Children
7. Fetal Alcohol Spectrum Disorders (FASD)
8. Helping Kids Cope With Bullying and Preventing Bullying Behavior
9. Human Trafficking
10. Intellectual & Developmental Disorder Diagnosis & Care
11. Providing Foster Care Placement Stability
12. Resilience: The Art & Science of Healing from Trauma
13. Intro to Trauma Informed Parenting: Caring for Children Who Have Experienced Trauma (with The National Child Traumatic Stress Network)
14. Advanced Trauma Informed Parenting: More About Caring for Children Who Have Experienced Trauma (with The National Child Traumatic Stress Network)

### Registration and Contact Information
To register, visit the [Fostercare Training Page](https://www.centenefostercare.com/training/caregiver-training.html). Email [BH_Training@Centene.com](mailto:BH_Training@Centene.com) with any questions.

### Key Features and Capabilities
- Comprehensive training topics covering child development and trauma-informed care
- Live training opportunities
- Registration available online
- Contact information for further queries

### Last Updated
04/23/2024

Attachments:

- **Frequency**: Occurs on the second Tuesday of every month.
- **Time**: 10:00-11:00 am ET.

## Comprehensive Information on 'Enrollment and Updates'

### Explanations

1. **New Contract**: The process for a new provider to join the network involves requesting a new contract through an online information request form. An MHS representative will then contact the provider to discuss contracting options.
2. **Add Provider to Existing Contract**: Existing contracted providers can add new providers to their contract using an online contracted enrollment form.
3. **Demographic Updates**: Contracted providers can update their existing information using the online provider update forms.

### Relevant Links

1. [Request a New Contract](https://www.mhsindiana.com/providers/become-a-provider/Provider-Network-Participation-Enrollment-Process.html)
2. [Enroll a Contracted Provider](https://www.mhsindiana.com/providers/become-a-provider/Provider-Network-Participation-Enrollment-Process-Existing.html)
3. [Demographic Update Tool](https://www.mhsindiana.com/providers/become-a-provider/demographic-update-tool.html)

### Instructions

1. For a new contract, fill out the online information request form.
2. To add a provider to an existing contract, use the online contracted enrollment form.
3. For demographic updates, use the online provider update forms.

### Phone Numbers

1. **Provider Services**: 1-877-647-4848
2. **TTY**: 1-800-743-3333

### Key Features

1. **Online Forms**: Available for new contract requests, adding providers to existing contracts, and demographic updates.
2. **Request ID**: Assigned upon submission of new contract or add provider requests, to be used for reference in follow-ups.
3. **Secure Messaging**: Available through the provider portal for inquiries and updates.

### Other Relevant Details

2. **Last Updated**: The 'Enrollment and Updates' page was last updated on 06/30/2025.
3. **Accessibility**: Information is available in different languages and formats upon request at no cost to the provider.
