## Demographic Update Tool Information 

### Definition and Purpose 
The 'Demographic Update Tool' is a resource provided by Managed Health Services (MHS) to facilitate updates to provider information. Its purpose is to ensure that provider data is accurate and up-to-date, supporting administrative needs.

### Relevant Links 
- [Update a Billing Address](https://www.mhsindiana.com/providers/become-a-provider/demographic-update-tool/update-billing-address.html)
- [Change a Primary Location](https://www.mpsindiana.com/providers/become-a-provider/demographic-update-tool/primary-location.html)
- [Add an Additional Location](https://www.mhsindiana.com/providers/become-a-provider/demographic-update-tool/additional-location.html)
- [Remove a Location](https://www.mhsindiana.com/providers/become-a-provider/demographic-update-tool/remove-location.html)
- [Notify Us of an Office Move](https://www.mhsindiana.com/providers/become-a-provider/demographic-update-tool/office-move.html)
- [Add/Remove a Language Spoken](https://www.mhsindiana.com/providers/become-a-provider/demographic-update-tool/language-spoken.html)
- [Change Email Address](https://www.mhsindiana.com/providers/become-a-provider/demographic-update-tool/email-address.html)
- [Change Phone Number](https://www.mhsindiana.com/providers/become-a-provider/demographic-update-tool/phone-number.html)
- [Change Provider Name](https://www.mhsindiana.com/providers/become-a-provider/demographic-update-tool/provider-name.html)
- [Update Service Location Office Hours](https://www.mhsindiana.com/providers/become-a-provider/demographic-update-tool/service-location-office-hours.html)
- [Change Accepting New Members Status](https://www.mhsindiana.com/providers/become-a-provider/demographic-update-tool/change-accepting-new-member-status.html)
- [Change Panel Size (PCP Only)](https://www.mhsindiana.com/providers/become-a-provider/demographic-update-tool/change-panel-size.html)
- [Change Age Restrictions](https://www.mhsindiana.com/providers/become-a-provider/demographic-update-tool/age-restrictions.html)
- [Term an Existing Provider (PCP/Specialist)](https://www.mhsindiana.com/providers/become-a-provider/demographic-update-tool/pmp-term.html)
- [Change an IRS Number (TIN)](https://www.mhsindiana.com/providers/become-a-provider/demographic-update-tool/irs-number.html)
- [Change an NPI Number](https://www.mhsindiana.com/providers/become-a-provider/demographic-update-tool/npi-number.html)
- [Update an IRS Address](https://www.mhsindiana.com/providers/become-a-provider/demographic-update-tool/irs-address.html)

### Instructions 
To use the Demographic Update Tool, providers can click on the relevant link based on the type of update they need to make and follow the instructions provided on the subsequent pages.

### Phone Numbers 
- Provider Services: 1-877-647-4848
- TTY: 1-800-743-3333

### Related Resources 
- [Provider Directory](https://www.mhsindiana.com/members/hip/find-a-provider.html)
- [Contact Us](https://www.mhsindiana.com/contact-us.html)
- [Ambetter Provider Update Information](https://ambetter.mhsindiana.com/provider-resources/manuals-and-forms/provider-updates.html)

### Last Updated 
The Demographic Update Tool information was last updated on 08/09/2024.

browser_content:
## Detailed Information about 'Become a Contracted Provider'

### Explanation
To become a contracted provider with Managed Health Services (MHS), you can either request a new contract or add a provider to an existing contract. MHS appreciates your interest in joining their network and is excited to set up your office as a participating provider.

### Links
1. [Request a New Contract](https://www.mhsindiana.com/providers/become-a-provider/Provider-Network-Participation-Enrollment-Process.html)
2. [Add Provider to Existing Contract](https://www.mhsindiana.com/providers/become-a-provider/Provider-Network-Participation-Enrollment-Process-Existing.html)
3. [Demographic Update Tool](https://www.mhsindiana.com/providers/become-a-provider/demographic-update-tool.html)

### Instructions
1. **New Contract**: Fill out the online information request form to initiate the contracting process. An MHS representative will contact you to discuss contracting options.
2. **Add Provider to Existing Contract**: Use the online contracted enrollment form to add a new provider to your existing medical or behavioral health entity.
3. **Demographic Updates**: Use the online provider update forms to update existing information if you are already a contracted provider with MHS.

### Phone Numbers
1. Provider Services: 1-877-647-4848
2. TTY: 1-800-743-3333

### Names
No specific names are mentioned in the provided content.

### Addresses
No specific addresses are mentioned in the provided content.

### Key Features
1. **Request ID**: Upon submitting a new contract or adding a provider to an existing contract, a Request ID will be assigned in your confirmation email. This ID is crucial for referencing your application.
2. **Secure Messaging**: You can login to your provider portal account to send a secure message to MHS.
3. **Contact Us Page**: Available for general questions or inquiries.
4. **Language Assistance**: MHS will provide information at no cost to you in different languages or formats. Call 1-877-647-4848 (TTY: 1-800-743-3333).

### Additional Information
- Last Updated: 06/30/2025
- Adobe Reader is required to open PDFs on the MHS site. You can download it for free from [Adobe's website](https://get.adobe.com/reader/).

Attachments:

browser_content:
## Comprehensive Information on 'Contracted Enrollment Request'

### Purpose and Explanation
The 'Contracted Enrollment Request' is a process used by MHS to add additional practitioners or facilities to an existing contract. It involves submitting a Network Participation Request, which includes completing the Contracted Enrollment Request form and attaching required documents.

### Steps to Enroll a Provider to an Existing Contract:
1. Go to mhsindiana.com.
2. Select 'For Providers' tab.
3. Select 'Enrollments and Updates.'
4. Select 'Add Provider to Existing Contract (Enroll a Contracted Provider)'. 
5. Complete the Contracted Enrollment Request form.
6. Attach the required documents.

### Required Information for Network Participation Request:
- Current valid license to practice.
- Status of clinical privileges at the primary admitting facility.
- Current and valid DEA or CSR certificate.
- Proof of graduation and completion of residency or board certification.
- Work history (minimum 5 years).
- Current malpractice insurance.
- History of pending professional liability claims.
- Proof of IHCP enrollment.
- Verification that the provider is not debarred or excluded by Federal agencies.

### Required Forms for Credentialing and Enrolling:
1. For Facilities/Hospitals:
   - IHCP MCE Hospital/Ancillary Provider Enrollment and Credentialing application.
   - Behavioral Health Facility and Ancillary Demographic Information (if applicable).
   - Valid IN License.
   - Accreditation certificate (if applicable).
   - Copy of Medicare/Medicaid certification letters.
   - Liability coverage face sheet.
   - CLIA certificate (if applicable).
   - DEA# (if applicable).
   - Provider Location Listing.
   - W-9 Form.

2. For Physicians/Midlevels:
   - IHCP MCE Practitioner Enrollment Form.
   - Collaborative Agreement (for certain practitioners).
   - Provider Credentialing Application Accessibility Form Supplement (New Contract Request Only).
   - Provider Location Listing.
   - W-9 Form.
   - Behavioral Health Specialty Form and HSPP Attestation (for Behavioral Health Physicians/Mid-Levels).

### Key Features and Capabilities:
- MHS Credentialing verifies completion of required criteria.
- Requests receive a unique identifier for status checking.
- Missing/incomplete requests are notified within 5 business days.
- Providers have 30 days to complete missing information.
- MHS Data Team enrolls Facility/Hospital and Physician/Mid-Level as requested.

### Relevant Links:
- [MHS Indiana Homepage](https://www.mhsindiana.com)
- [Contracted Enrollment Request Page](https://www.mhsindiana.com/providers/become-a-provider/Provider-Network-Participation-Enrollment-Process-Existing.html)

### Important Details:
- A brand-new provider not part of an existing contract will be effective the first of the month following contract execution.
- Provisional Credentialing applies to providers never credentialed or enrolled with MHS.
- Providers have 5 business days to respond to incomplete credentialing or network participation requests.

Attachments:

<url>
https://www.mhsindiana.com/providers/become-a-provider/Provider-Network-Participation-Enrollment-Process-Existing.html
</url>
<query>
Contracted Enrollment Request
</query>
<result>
To enroll a provider to an existing contract, follow these steps:

1. **Submit a Network Participation Request**: 
   - Go to [mhsindiana.com](http://www.mhsindiana.com).
   - Select "For Providers" tab.
   - Select "Enrollments and Updates."
   - Select "Add Provider to Existing Contract (Enroll a Contracted Provider)".
   - Complete the Contracted Enrollment Request.
   - Attach the required documents.

2. **Verification of complete Network Participation Request**: 
   - The request must include the information/fields outlined on the Indiana Health Coverage Programs (IHCP) MCE Practitioner and IHCP MCE Hospital/Ancillary Provider Enrollment and Credentialing Forms.
   - Required information includes:
     - Current valid license to practice.
     - Status of clinical privileges at the hospital designated by the practitioner as the primary admitting facility.
     - Current and valid Drug Enforcement Administration (DEA) or controlled-substance registration (CSR) certificate.
     - Proof of graduation from medical school and completion of a residency, or board certification.
     - Work history that includes a minimum of five years on the curriculum vitae.
     - Current, adequate malpractice insurance.
     - History detailing any pending professional liability claims and claims resulting in settlements or judgments paid by or on behalf of the practitioner.

3. **Required forms for Credentialing and Enrolling a Facility/Hospital (Provider)**:
   - IHCP MCE Hospital/Ancillary Provider Enrollment and Credentialing application.
   - Behavioral Health Facility and Ancillary Demographic Information (if applicable).
   - Valid IN License.
   - Accreditation certificate (if applicable).
   - Copy of Medicare certification letter.
   - Copy of Medicaid certification letter.
   - Liability coverage face sheet.
   - Clinical Laboratory Improvement Amendments (CLIA) certificate (if applicable).
   - Drug Enforcement Agency (DEA)# (if applicable).
   - Provider Location Listing.
   - W-9 Form.

4. **Required forms for Credentialing and Enrolling a Physician/Midlevel (Practitioner)**:
   - IHCP MCE Practitioner Enrollment Form.
   - Collaborative Agreement (for Nurse Practitioner, Physician Assistant, Clinical Nurse Specialist, Midwives).
   - Provider Credentialing Application Accessibility Form Supplement Form (New Contract Request Only).
   - Provider Location Listing.
   - W-9 Form.
   - For Behavioral Health Physicians/Mid-Levels: Behavioral Health Specialty Form, HSPP Attestation (Psychologists Only).

5. **Contracting/Negotiating a new contract or adding a line of business or service**: 
   - The process involves the provider and MHS formally executing an agreement (or amendment) for the provider to deliver medical or behavioral health services.

6. **Credentialing and enrollment into the MHS Provider Network**: 
   - Credentialing is the process of reviewing the qualifications and appropriateness of a provider to join the health plan’s network.
   - Enrollment is the process of loading a contracted and credentialed provider to all MHS internal systems.

**Specialty types that require credentialing**:
- Ancillary Providers (Ambulance, Ambulatory Surgery Center, Clinic Facility, etc.).
- Medical or Behavioral Health Practitioners (participating in a group, RHC, or FQHC setting).

**Effective Date Policy (Effective 1/1/2024)**: 
- A brand-new provider that is not part of an existing contract with MHS will be effective the first of the month following the contract execution.
</result>

qa_pairs.question: What is a Contracted Enrollment Request?
qa_pairs.answer: A Contracted Enrollment Request is a process used by MHS to add additional practitioners or facilities to an existing contract. It involves submitting a Network Participation Request, which includes completing the Contracted Enrollment Request form and attaching required documents.

qa_pairs.question: How do I enroll a provider to an existing contract?
qa_pairs.answer: To enroll a provider to an existing contract, go to mhsindiana.com, select 'For Providers' tab, then 'Enrollments and Updates,' and 'Add Provider to Existing Contract (Enroll a Contracted Provider)'. Complete the Contracted Enrollment Request form and attach the required documents.

qa_pairs.question: What information is required for a Network Participation Request?
qa_pairs.answer: Required information includes: current valid license to practice, status of clinical privileges at the primary admitting facility, current and valid DEA or CSR certificate, proof of graduation and completion of residency or board certification, work history (minimum 5 years), current malpractice insurance, history of pending professional liability claims, proof of IHCP enrollment, and verification that the provider is not debarred or excluded by Federal agencies.

qa_pairs.question: What forms are required for credentialing and enrolling a facility or hospital?
qa_pairs.answer: Required forms for facilities/hospitals include: IHCP MCE Hospital/Ancillary Provider Enrollment and Credentialing application, Behavioral Health Facility and Ancillary Demographic Information (if applicable), valid IN License, accreditation certificate (if applicable), copy of Medicare/Medicaid certification letters, liability coverage face sheet, CLIA certificate (if applicable), DEA# (if applicable), Provider Location Listing, and W-9 Form.

qa_pairs.question: Why is credentialing necessary?
qa_pairs.answer: Credentialing is necessary to review the qualifications and appropriateness of a provider to join the health plan's network. It ensures that providers meet certain standards and criteria before they can provide services.

qa_pairs.question: When is a new provider effective?
qa_pairs.answer: A brand-new provider not part of an existing contract will be effective the first of the month following contract execution, as per the Effective Date Policy effective 1/1/2024.

qa_pairs.question: Where can I find the Contracted Enrollment Request form?
qa_pairs.answer: The Contracted Enrollment Request form can be found on the MHS Indiana website (mhsindiana.com) under 'For Providers' > 'Enrollments and Updates' > 'Add Provider to Existing Contract (Enroll a Contracted Provider)'.

qa_pairs.question: Who should I contact about Contracted Enrollment Request?
qa_pairs.answer: For specific inquiries about Contracted Enrollment Request, you can visit the MHS Indiana website (mhsindiana.com) or contact MHS directly through the information provided on their website.

qa_pairs.question: What happens if my Network Participation Request is incomplete?
qa_pairs.answer: If your Network Participation Request is incomplete, you will be notified within 5 business days. You have 30 days to complete the missing information.

qa_pairs.question: How long does it take to process a Contracted Enrollment Request?
qa_pairs.answer: The processing time involves verifying the completion of required criteria by MHS Credentialing. While the exact timeframe isn't specified, requests receive a unique identifier for status checking, and providers are notified within 5 business days if the request is incomplete.

browser_content:
## Provider Effective Date Policy

### Explanation
The Provider Effective Date Policy outlines the effective date for new providers joining the Managed Health Services (MHS) network. The policy differentiates between brand-new providers not part of an existing contract and providers being added to an existing contract.

### Key Features
1. **Effective Date for Brand-New Providers**: The first of the month following the contract execution date, which is when MHS countersigns the first signature agreement received from the provider.
2. **Effective Date for Providers Added to Existing Contracts**: The first of the month following the receipt of the network participation request from the provider.
3. **Network Participation Receipt Date**: The date MHS receives the provider’s complete network participation request.
4. **Credentialing**: Providers requiring credentialing must be credentialed to be effective with MHS. MHS notifies providers within 15 days of the full credentialing decision in writing.
5. **Reimbursement**: MHS reimburses for medically necessary services rendered between the credentialing decision date and the network participation date at the out-of-network reimbursement rate.
6. **Claims Submission**: Providers should hold claims until they receive a final welcome letter from MHS confirming their effective date.

### Relevant Details
- **Contract Execution**: The date MHS countersigns the first signature agreement.
- **Network Participation Request**: Must be complete with all required fields and supporting documentation.
- **Credentialing Decision**: MHS notifies providers within 15 days.
- **Reimbursement Rate**: Out-of-network rate until the contract effective date.
- **Exceptions**: Granted in specific circumstances like changes in ownership, provider mergers, or upon request from FQHCs/RHCs.

### Instructions
1. Providers must submit a complete network participation request.
2. Providers requiring credentialing must undergo the credentialing process.
3. Providers should wait for the final welcome letter before submitting claims.

### Phone Numbers
- **Customer Service**: 1-877-647-4848
- **TTY**: 1-800-743-3333

### Links
- [Provider Effective Date Policy Page](https://www.mhsindiana.com/providers/become-a-provider/Provider-Effective-Date-Policy.html)
- [Become a Contracted Provider](https://www.mhsindiana.com/providers/become-a-provider/Provider-Network-Participation-Enrollment-Process.html)
- [Demographic Update Tool](https://www.mhsindiana.com/providers/become-a-provider/demographic-update-tool.html)

### Last Updated
01/17/2024

### Additional Information
The policy does not affect delegated provider arrangements. For information in different languages or formats, contact MHS at the provided phone numbers.

Attachments:

## MHS Pharmacy Program Information

### Purpose
MHS is committed to providing appropriate, high-quality, and cost-effective drug therapy to all MHS members. MHS works with providers and pharmacists to ensure that medications used to treat a variety of conditions and diseases are covered.

### Relevant Links
- [Drug Search Tool](/providers/pharmacy/drug-search-tool.html): A tool to search for covered drugs.
- [Preferred Drug Lists](https://inm.pharmacy.optum.com/inm/prelogin): Lists of preferred medications.
- [Pharmacy Forms](/providers/pharmacy/pharmacy-forms.html): Forms related to pharmacy services.
- [Pharmacy FAQs](/members/hip/health-services/pharmacy-services/pharmacy-faqs.html): Frequently Asked Questions about pharmacy services.

### Instructions
- MHS covers prescription medications and certain over-the-counter (OTC) medications when ordered by an Indiana Medicaid enrolled MHS practitioner.
- Some medications require prior authorization (PA) or have limitations on age, dosage, gender, and maximum quantities.
- MHS encourages the use of electronic prescriptions or e-prescribing.

### Phone Numbers
- Main Contact: 1-877-647-4848
- TTY: 1-800-743-3333

### Key Features
- Electronic prescriptions are accepted by Envolve Pharmacy contracted pharmacies.
- The pharmacy program does not cover all medications.
- MHS will provide information at no cost to members in different languages or formats upon request.

### Additional Information
MHS works with providers and pharmacists to ensure appropriate medication coverage. The program includes various resources such as drug search tools and pharmacy forms to facilitate the process.

Attachments:

browser_content:
### Prior Authorization Information

**What is Prior Authorization?**
Prior Authorization is an approval from Managed Health Services (MHS) for a member to receive services that are designated as needing approval prior to treatment and/or payment.

**Purpose:**
The purpose of Prior Authorization is to ensure that certain medical services or treatments are necessary and appropriate before they are provided.

**Key Details:**
- It is a communication between the member's doctor and MHS.
- Services requiring Prior Authorization are specified in the member handbook.
- The Primary Medical Provider (PMP) can assist in meeting prior authorization requirements.

**Process:**
1. The doctor initiates a request for Prior Authorization.
2. MHS reviews the request and makes a determination.
3. Members can contact MHS Member Services at 1-877-647-4848 for assistance with Prior Authorization.

**Relevant Links:**
- [MHS Member Handbook](https://www.mhsindiana.com/campaign/mobile/handbook.html): Contains detailed information about Prior Authorization and other health plan details.

**Contact Information:**
- Phone: 1-877-647-4848 (MHS Member Services)
- TTY/TDD: 1-800-743-3333
- Website: [mhsindiana.com](https://www.mhsindiana.com/)

**Additional Resources:**
- MHS Member Services can provide guidance on the Prior Authorization process.
- The MHS website offers various resources and FAQs that may help members understand Prior Authorization requirements.

qa_pairs.question: What is Prior Authorization?
qa_pairs.answer: Prior Authorization is an approval from Managed Health Services (MHS) for a member to receive services that are designated as needing approval prior to treatment and/or payment. It ensures that certain medical services or treatments are necessary and appropriate before they are provided.

qa_pairs.question: Why is Prior Authorization required?
qa_pairs.answer: Prior Authorization is required to ensure that certain medical services or treatments are necessary and appropriate before they are provided. It is a communication between the member's doctor and MHS to validate the need for specific services.

qa_pairs.question: How do I get Prior Authorization?
qa_pairs.answer: To get Prior Authorization, the doctor initiates a request, which is then reviewed by MHS. Members can contact MHS Member Services at 1-877-647-4848 for assistance with the Prior Authorization process. The Primary Medical Provider (PMP) can also assist in meeting prior authorization requirements.

qa_pairs.question: When is Prior Authorization needed?
qa_pairs.answer: Prior Authorization is needed before certain medical services or treatments are provided. The specific services requiring Prior Authorization are listed in the MHS Member Handbook, available at https://www.mhsindiana.com/campaign/mobile/handbook.html.

qa_pairs.question: Where can I find information about services that require Prior Authorization?
qa_pairs.answer: Information about services that require Prior Authorization can be found in the MHS Member Handbook, which is available online at https://www.mhsindiana.com/campaign/mobile/handbook.html. Members can also contact MHS Member Services at 1-877-647-4848 for guidance.

qa_pairs.question: Who should I contact for help with Prior Authorization?
qa_pairs.answer: For help with Prior Authorization, members should contact MHS Member Services at 1-877-647-4848. The Primary Medical Provider (PMP) can also assist with prior authorization requirements. Additional resources and FAQs are available on the MHS website at https://www.mhsindiana.com/.

qa_pairs.question: What happens if I don't get Prior Authorization?
qa_pairs.answer: While the content doesn't explicitly state the consequences of not obtaining Prior Authorization, it's implied that failing to do so may result in issues with payment or treatment. Members are advised to check the MHS Member Handbook or contact MHS Member Services for specific guidance.

qa_pairs.question: How long does it take to get a decision on Prior Authorization?
qa_pairs.answer: The content doesn't provide a specific timeline for Prior Authorization decisions. Members are advised to contact MHS Member Services at 1-877-647-4848 for assistance and updates on their Prior Authorization request.

qa_pairs.question: Can I appeal a denied Prior Authorization request?
qa_pairs.answer: The content doesn't explicitly mention the appeals process for denied Prior Authorization requests. Members are advised to contact MHS Member Services at 1-877-647-4848 for guidance on next steps if their request is denied.

qa_pairs.question: Is there a TTY/TDD number for Prior Authorization inquiries?
qa_pairs.answer: Yes, the TTY/TDD number for Prior Authorization inquiries and other MHS services is 1-800-743-3333. Members can use this number to communicate if they need assistance with Prior Authorization or other health plan details.

browser_content:
## Medicaid Pre-Auth Information

### Explanations
- Medicaid Pre-Auth is required for certain services to ensure payment.
- Services performed in the Emergency Department or Urgent Care Center or Family Planning services billed with a contraceptive management diagnosis do NOT require prior authorization.
- Non-participating providers must submit Prior Authorization for all services.

### Links
- [Medicaid Pre-Auth Tool](http://provider.mhsindiana.com) - Login to submit an authorization.
- [2023 30 Most Frequently Submitted CPT Codes (PDF)]https://www.mhsindiana.com/content/dam/centene/mhsindiana/medicaid/pdfs/AMB-IN-2023-Frequently-Submitted-CPT.pdf)
- [2024 30 Most Frequently Submitted CPT Codes (PDF)](https://www.mhsindiana.com/content/dam/centene/mhsindiana/medicaid/pdfs/Medicaid-2024-CPT-Codes-508.pdf)

### Instructions
1. Check if the service requires prior authorization using the tool on the website.
2. Login to [provider.mhsindiana.com](http://provider.mhsindiana.com) to submit a prior authorization request.
3. Verify services with specific vendors:
   - Vision services: [Centene Vision Services](https://visionbenefits.envolvehealth.com/)
   - Dental services: [Centene Dental Services](https://dental.envolvehealth.com/)
   - Ambulance and Transportation services: [LCP Transportation](http://lcptransportation.com/)
   - Musculoskeletal services: [Evolent](https://www.evolent.com/)
   - Complex imaging, MRA, MRI, PET, CT scans, PT, ST, OT, and Pain Management: [Evolent](https://www.evolent.com/)
   - Medication under the pharmacy benefit: [State Unified PDL](https://inm-providerportal.optum.com/providerportal/faces/PreLogin.jsp)

### Phone Numbers
- Main Phone: 1-877-647-4848
- TTY: 1-800-743-3333

### Related Resources
- [Provider Manual](https://www.mhsindiana.com/providers/resources/guides-and-manuals.html) - Refer to the provider manual for specific details on prior authorization and billing practices.
- [Become a Contracted Provider](https://www.mhsindiana.com/providers/become-a-provider.html) - Information for non-participating providers to join the network.

### Last Updated
- The Medicaid Pre-Auth information was last updated on 03/11/2025.

Attachments:

2. Anesthesia services for pain management, dental surgery, or services in the office rendered by a non-participating provider
3. Gender reassignment services
4. HMO Out of Network service requests

### How to Submit a Prior Authorization Request
To submit a prior authorization, [login here](https://provider.mhsindiana.com).

### Additional Information
- Payment of claims is dependent on eligibility, covered benefits, provider contracts, correct coding, and billing practices.
- For specific details, refer to the Medicare Advantage provider manual.
- The information on the Pre-Auth Needed Tool does not guarantee payment.
- Last Updated: 01/17/2024.

## Medicare Pre-Authorization Information

3. Gender reassignment services
4. HMO Out of Network service requests

### How to Submit a Prior Authorization Request

### Additional Information

qa_pairs.question: What is Medicare Pre Auth?
qa_pairs.answer: Medicare Pre Auth refers to the prior authorization process for certain medical services under Medicare Advantage plans. It ensures that specific services are approved before they are performed.

qa_pairs.question: What services require prior authorization under Medicare Pre Auth?
qa_pairs.answer: Services requiring prior authorization include complex imaging (MRA, MRI, PET, CT scan), musculoskeletal services, cardiac surgical services, inpatient facility admissions, anesthesia services for pain management or dental surgery, gender reassignment services, and HMO Out of Network service requests.

qa_pairs.question: How do I submit a prior authorization request for Medicare Pre Auth?
qa_pairs.answer: To submit a prior authorization request, you need to login to the provider portal at https://provider.mhsindiana.com. The website provides the necessary forms and instructions for the prior authorization process.

qa_pairs.question: Are there any exceptions to the prior authorization requirement?
qa_pairs.answer: Yes, prior authorization is not required for services performed in the Emergency Department or Urgent Care Center, or for dialysis or hospice services.

qa_pairs.question: Why is prior authorization necessary for certain services?
qa_pairs.answer: Prior authorization ensures that the services provided are medically necessary and meet the criteria for coverage under the Medicare Advantage plan. It helps in managing healthcare costs and ensuring appropriate care.

qa_pairs.question: When should I submit a prior authorization request?
qa_pairs.answer: You should submit a prior authorization request before performing the service that requires authorization. The exact timing may depend on the urgency of the service and the requirements of the Medicare Advantage plan.

qa_pairs.question: Who needs to submit prior authorization requests?
qa_pairs.answer: Both participating and non-participating providers need to submit prior authorization requests. Non-participating providers must submit prior authorization for all services when treating HMO members.

qa_pairs.question: Where can I find more information about Medicare Pre Auth?
qa_pairs.answer: You can find more information about Medicare Pre Auth on the Medicare Advantage provider manual and on the provider portal at https://www.mhsindiana.com/providers/prior-authorization/medicare-pre-auth.html.

qa_pairs.question: Does prior authorization guarantee payment?
qa_pairs.answer: No, prior authorization does not guarantee payment. Payment of claims is dependent on eligibility, covered benefits, provider contracts, correct coding, and billing practices.

qa_pairs.question: When was the Medicare Pre Auth information last updated?
qa_pairs.answer: The Medicare Pre Auth information was last updated on 01/17/2024.

browser_content:
## Ambetter Pre-Authorization Details

### Purpose
Ambetter Pre-Authorization is required for certain services/procedures that are frequently over- or underutilized or complex and may indicate a need for case management.

### Relevant Links
- [Ambetter Pre-Auth](https://www.ambetterhealth.com/en/in/provider-resources/manuals-and-forms/pre-auth/)

### Instructions
1. Check if a pre-authorization is necessary using the online tool on the sidebar.
2. For imaging, outpatient surgeries, and testing, requests can be made via:
   - Phone: 1-877-647-4848
   - Fax: 1-866-912-4245
   - Online: [Provider Portal](https://provider.mhsindiana.com/sso/login?service=httpprovider.mhsindiana.com/sso/login?service=http...06805e603)
3. For DME, orthotics, prosthetics, home healthcare, and therapy, requests must be faxed to 1-866-912-4245.

### Phone Numbers
- Phone: 1-877-647-4848
- Fax: 1-866-912-4245
- TTY: 1-800-743-3333

### Important Details
- Urgent (expedited) PA requests are reviewed within 24 hours.
- Non-urgent PA requests are reviewed within 48 hours.
- Providers must respond to adverse determinations within 48 hours.
- Previously approved authorizations can be updated within 30 days of the original date of service.
- Contracted providers must obtain PA at least two days prior to the date of service.
- Non-contracted providers must obtain PA two days prior to the date of service; retroactive authorizations are not granted except in emergent situations.

### Additional Information
- A full list of services requiring PA can be found in the [Provider Manual](/providers/resources/guides-and-manuals.html) and other related documents.
- Authorization approval is for medical necessity only.

Attachments:

browser_content:
### Quality Improvement Program Details

*   **Purpose**: The Quality Improvement (QI) program aims to improve the health status of members through various quality improvement activities across all care settings, enhancing the quality of care and services delivered.
*   **Scope**: The QI Program is comprehensive, addressing the quality and safety of clinical care and services provided to MHS members, including medical, behavioral health, dental, and vision care.
*   **Key Features**:
    1.  Credentialing Standards: All licensed physicians and healthcare professionals must complete an application and submit supporting documentation to participate in the MHS network.
    2.  Cultural Competency Plan: MHS has a plan to respond to the healthcare needs of all individuals, regardless of their ethnic, cultural, or religious beliefs or language, reviewed and updated annually.
    3.  Participation in QI: Providers and practitioners are required to cooperate with QI activities, including the collection, evaluation, and use of performance data.
    4.  CAHPS (Consumer Assessment of Healthcare Providers and Systems): MHS conducts annual surveys to assess members' experiences with their doctors, services, and health plan.
*   **Relevant Links**:
    1.  [Provider Guides and Manuals](https://www.mhsindiana.com/providers/resources/guides-and-manuals.html) - Contains the MHS QI Program description.
    2.  [Care Compare](https://urldefense.com/v3/__https:/lnks.gd/l/eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJidWxsZXRpbl9saW5rX2lkIjoxMDEsInVyaSI6ImJwMjpjbGljayIsImJ1bGxldGluX2lkIjoiMjAyMDExMTguMzA3MTg3ODEiLCJ1cmwiOiJodHRwczovL3d3dy5tZWRpY2FyZS5nb3YvY2FyZS1jb21wYXJlLyJ9.SKVP-9ntw-86adtBacWQ0KwiECyFH2WGXmMIUFRyhwg/s/975807959/br/90034321186-l__;!!Js732Vmb!9DCGMjk7pAfZBFp-iECJmBLBeteMpuCk2kAlaUB3oH4Imcl_XGeIXvwUH7CrxG-Kxb_tvg$) - Streamlined compare tools from CMS.
    3.  [Indiana Hospital Association (IHA)](http://www.ihaconnect.org/) - Provides data on hospital quality measures.
    4.  [Healthgrades](https://www.healthgrades.com/) - Offers information about physicians, hospitals, and healthcare providers.
    5.  [The Leapfrog Hospital Safety Grade](https://www.hospitalsafetygrade.org/) - Evaluates hospital performance in patient safety.
*   **Instructions and Phone Numbers**:
    1.  To obtain a printed copy of the MHS QI Program description, contact MHS at 1-877-647-4848.
    2.  TTY: 1-800-743-3333 for assistance.

Attachments:

browser_content:
### Providing Quality Care

'Providing Quality Care' is part of the Quality Improvement (QI) program designed to address both the quality and safety of services provided to patients and members. It encompasses various initiatives and guidelines to ensure high-quality healthcare.

#### Key Features and Capabilities

1. **Annual CAHPS Survey**: Members report their satisfaction with healthcare, including their experience with providers and health plans.
2. **Annual Provider Satisfaction Survey**: Providers' experiences with the health plan are assessed to improve the provider experience.
3. **Provider Credentialing Rights**: Providers can review the status of their credentialing or recredentialing application.
4. **Provider Directory & Continued Access to Care**: Providers must notify MHS of changes to their address, telephone number, or patient acceptance status.
5. **Utilization Management (UM)**: UM decisions are based on the appropriateness of care and service, with no financial incentives for denials.
6. **Transition to Other Care**: Assistance is available for adolescents transitioning to adult care providers.
7. **Pharmacy**: The health plan follows the Indiana Medicaid State Unified Preferred Drug List (SUPDL) as its formulary.
8. **Health Equity**: Efforts are made to address historical and contemporary injustices and eliminate preventable health disparities.
9. **Language & Interpreter Services**: Language assistance services are available to people with Limited English Proficiency (LEP) at no cost.
10. **Cultural Humility Resources**: Providers are encouraged to engage in Cultural Humility trainings and education.
11. **Access to Case Management**: Care Management is available for members who may benefit from increased coordination of services.
12. **Appointment Access Standards**: Standards are established for appointment availability for PCPs, specialists, and behavioral health practitioners.
13. **Member Rights and Responsibilities**: Providers are expected to follow member rights, and members are informed of their rights and responsibilities.

#### Links, Instructions, Phone Numbers, and Other Resources

1. **Provider Manual**: Available for review of appointment access standards and member rights and responsibilities.
2. **Office of Medicaid Policy and Planning's (OMPP) website**: For information on SUPDL policy changes.
3. **U.S. Department of Health & Human Services' website**: For information on Culturally and Linguistically Appropriate Services (CLAS) Standards.
4. **Office of Minority Health's (OMH) website**: For information on the Cultural and Linguistic Competency e-Learning Program.
5. **Provider Customer Contact Center**: 1-877-647-4848 (TTY: 1-800-743-3333) for scheduling language services.
6. **Provider Portal**: For referring members to MHS Care Management.
7. **Health plan website**: For the current SUPDL and other resources.

Attachments:

browser_content:
## Immunization Information

### Key Features and Explanations
* The National Immunization Program within the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) has developed guidelines for immunization data collection and assessment systems or registries.
* The CDC's objective is to ensure that at least 90% of children under the age of two and 95% of children under the age of 18 are adequately immunized.
* Major healthcare organizations have endorsed immunization registries as an important tool in vaccine delivery.

### Guidelines and Objectives
* The CDC has identified the following areas as obstacles to reaching the immunization objective:
  + Incomplete records due to fragmentation of healthcare delivery
  + Large and cumbersome files of paper records
  + Difficulties in assessing immunization needs due to complex and dynamic immunization schedules

### Relevant Links and Resources
* CDC's recommended immunization schedule for children, adolescents, and adults: https://www.cdc.gov/vaccines/hcp/imz-schedules/index.html
* Information on the State of Indiana's immunization registry (CHIRP): https://chirp.in.gov/

### Contact Information
* Phone Number: 1-877-647-4848
* TTY: 1-800-743-3333

### Last Updated
* 11/20/2024

### Additional Information
* The webpage is available in English and Spanish.
* Information is available in different languages or formats at no cost. Call 1-877-647-4848 (TTY: 1-800-743-3333).

Attachments:

qa_pairs.answer: Immunization Information is crucial for ensuring that individuals receive the necessary vaccinations. It helps in tracking immunization records, assessing immunization needs, and ultimately achieving the CDC's immunization objectives.

## Detailed Information about Medical Records

### Purpose
The purpose of maintaining medical records is to ensure consistent and complete documentation, which is an essential component of providing quality patient care.

### Relevant Links
- [MHS Provider Manual](https://www.mhsindiana.com/providers/resources/guides-and-manuals.html): Contains detailed information about medical record-keeping practices.

### Instructions
1. Maintain uniform, organized medical records that contain patient demographics and medical information regarding services rendered to members.
2. Ensure medical records are maintained in an organized medical record-keeping system in compliance with MHS medical documentation and record-keeping practice standards.
3. Keep medical records confidential and protected from public access, complying with HIPAA guidelines.
4. Make medical records available for utilization review, quality improvement studies, regulatory agencies’ requests, and member relations’ inquiries.
5. Provide a copy of a member’s medical record upon reasonable request by the member at no charge.
6. Facilitate the transfer of the member’s medical record to another provider at the member’s request.

### Phone Numbers
- 1-877-647-4848 (TTY: 1-800-743-3333) for inquiries or requests related to medical records or other services.

### Key Features
1. **Content**: Must include patient demographics and medical information regarding services rendered.
2. **Organization**: Must be maintained in an organized medical record-keeping system.
3. **Confidentiality**: Must be kept confidential and protected from public access in compliance with HIPAA guidelines.
4. **Retention**: Must be retained for at least seven (7) years.
5. **Availability**: Must be available for review and transfer as required.
6. **Compliance**: Must comply with state contract requirements and NCQA accreditation standards.

qa_pairs.question: What is the purpose of maintaining medical records?
qa_pairs.answer: The purpose of maintaining medical records is to ensure consistent and complete documentation, which is an essential component of providing quality patient care.

qa_pairs.question: Where can I find detailed information about medical record-keeping practices?
qa_pairs.answer: You can find detailed information about medical record-keeping practices in the MHS Provider Manual, available at https://www.mhsindiana.com/providers/resources/guides-and-manuals.html.

qa_pairs.question: How should medical records be maintained?
qa_pairs.answer: Medical records should be maintained in an organized medical record-keeping system in compliance with MHS medical documentation and record-keeping practice standards. They should contain patient demographics and medical information regarding services rendered.

qa_pairs.question: Why is it important to keep medical records confidential?
qa_pairs.answer: Medical records must be kept confidential and protected from public access in compliance with HIPAA guidelines to ensure patient privacy and comply with legal requirements.

qa_pairs.question: When should medical records be made available?
qa_pairs.answer: Medical records should be made available for utilization review, quality improvement studies, regulatory agencies' requests, and member relations' inquiries. They should also be provided to members or transferred to another provider upon reasonable request.

qa_pairs.question: Who should I contact for inquiries or requests related to medical records?
qa_pairs.answer: You can contact 1-877-647-4848 (TTY: 1-800-743-3333) for inquiries or requests related to medical records or other services.

qa_pairs.question: What information must be included in medical records?
qa_pairs.answer: Medical records must include patient demographics and medical information regarding services rendered.

qa_pairs.question: How long must medical records be retained?
qa_pairs.answer: Medical records must be retained for at least seven (7) years.

qa_pairs.question: Why are medical records important for quality patient care?
qa_pairs.answer: Medical records are important for quality patient care because they ensure consistent and complete documentation, which is essential for providing high-quality care.

qa_pairs.question: How can a member obtain a copy of their medical record?
qa_pairs.answer: A member can obtain a copy of their medical record upon reasonable request at no charge. The medical record can also be transferred to another provider at the member's request.

## Practice Guidelines

### Detailed Information

* **Purpose**: Clinical policies are used to assist in administering health plan benefits, either by prior authorization or claim payment rules.
* **Scope**: They include policies relating to evolving medical technologies and procedures, as well as pharmacy policies.
* **Guiding Principles**: Identify whether services are medically necessary based on:
  + Generally accepted standards of medical practice
  + Peer-reviewed medical literature
  + Government agency/program approval status
  + Evidence-based guidelines and positions of leading national health professional organizations
  + Views of physicians practicing in relevant clinical areas affected by the policy
  + Other available clinical information

### Key Features and Resources

* **Clinical Policy Manuals**: Available through a link on the website, allowing providers to:
  + Search all folders by keyword
  + Browse by catalog subject using manual dropdowns on the left-hand side
* **InterQual**: A nationally recognized, evidence-based decision support tool used for medical technologies, procedures, or pharmaceutical treatments not covered in the Clinical Policy Manuals.
* **Medicare National Coverage Determinations (NCDs) and Local Coverage Determinations (LCDs)**: Applied to the Medicare population and available on the [cms.gov website](https://www.cms.gov/medicare-coverage-database/search.aspx?redirect=Y&from=Overview).

### Contact Information

* **Provider Services**: For questions regarding clinical policies, contact Provider Services and ask to be directed to the Medical Management department.
* **Phone Number**: 1-877-647-4848 (TTY: 1-800-743-3333)

### Additional Information

* **Last Updated**: 02/07/2025
* **Language Assistance**: Information available in different languages or formats at no cost. Call 1-877-647-4848 (TTY: 1-800-743-3333).

Attachments:

browser_content:
## Report Fraud, Waste and Abuse

### Explanation and Purpose
The 'Report Fraud, Waste and Abuse' page provides comprehensive information about reporting healthcare fraud. It includes explanations of neglect, abuse, and fraud, as well as instructions on how to report such incidents. The purpose is to guide individuals on how to identify and report fraudulent activities related to healthcare benefits.

### Explanations
*   **Neglect**: Failing to provide or withholding necessities like food, clothing, shelter, or medical care.
*   **Abuse**: Causing physical, sexual, or mental injury, or exploiting financial resources. Types include:
    *   Physical Abuse: Inappropriate contact causing bodily harm.
    *   Sexual Abuse: Non-consensual sexual behavior or contact.
    *   Mental Abuse: Emotional distress from demeaning or threatening actions.
    *   Financial Abuse: Using someone's money without consent.
*   **Fraud**: Knowingly receiving benefits or payments not entitled to. Examples include:
    *   Misrepresenting information to obtain benefits.
    *   Falsifying records or claims.

### Reporting Instructions
To report waste, abuse, or fraud, gather as much information as possible. When reporting about a provider (a doctor, dentist, counselor, etc.), include:
*   Name, address, and phone number of provider.
*   Name and address of the facility (hospital, nursing home, home health agency, etc.).
*   Medicaid number of the provider and facility, if available.
*   Type of provider (doctor, dentist, therapist, pharmacist, etc.).
*   Names and phone numbers of other witnesses who can help in the investigation.
*   Dates of events.
*   Summary of what happened.

When reporting about someone who receives benefits, include:
*   The person's name.
*   The person's date of birth, Social Security Number, or case number if available.
*   The city where the person lives.
*   Specific details about the waste, abuse, or fraud.

### Links and Resources
*   [Report Fraud, Waste and Abuse](https://www.mhsindiana.com/members/hip/support-services/responsibilities/reducing-fraud.html)

### Phone Numbers
*   1-877-647-4848 (TTY: 1-800-743-3333)

### Key Features
*   Comprehensive guidance on reporting fraud, waste, and abuse.
*   Detailed instructions on what information to provide when reporting.
*   Contact information for reporting, including phone numbers.

### Other Relevant Details
*   The page emphasizes the importance of providing detailed information when reporting fraud, waste, or abuse.
*   It is part of the MHS Indiana website, which provides various resources for members, including health insurance information and member tools.

Attachments:

## Report Fraud, Waste and Abuse

### Explanation and Purpose
The 'Report Fraud, Waste and Abuse' page on the MHS Indiana website provides detailed information on how to identify and report fraudulent activities, waste, and abuse in healthcare. It explains the different types of fraud, waste, and abuse, and offers guidance on reporting such incidents.

### Explanations
* **Neglect**: Failing to provide or withholding necessities like food, clothing, shelter, or medical care.
* **Abuse**: Causing physical, sexual, or mental injury, or exploiting financial resources. Types include:
    * Physical Abuse: Inappropriate contact causing bodily harm.
    * Sexual Abuse: Non-consensual sexual behavior or contact.
    * Mental Abuse: Emotional distress from demeaning or threatening actions.
    * Financial Abuse: Using someone's money without consent.
* **Fraud**: Knowingly receiving benefits or payments not entitled to. Examples include:
    * Lying on an application.
    * Using someone else's ID card.
    * Billing for undone services.
    * Transportation usage abuse.

### Reporting Fraud, Waste, and Abuse
* **Phone Numbers**:
    * MHS Member Services: 1-877-647-4848 (TTY: 1-800-743-3333)
    * Confidential Reporting: 1-866-685-8664
    * Family and Social Services Administration Hotline: 1-800-403-0864
* **Email**: mhsfraudreport@mhsindiana.com

### Information to Provide When Reporting
* For Providers:
    * Name, address, and phone number.
    * Facility name and address.
    * Medicaid number (if available).
    * Type of provider.
    * Witnesses' names and phone numbers.
    * Dates of events and summary.
* For Individuals Receiving Benefits:
    * Name.
    * Date of birth, Social Security Number, or case number (if available).
    * City of residence.
    * Specific details about the waste, abuse, or fraud.

### Links and Resources
* [Report Fraud, Waste and Abuse](https://www.mhsindiana.com/members/hip/support-services/responsibilities/reducing-fraud.html)

qa_pairs.question: What is Report Fraud, Waste and Abuse?
qa_pairs.answer: The 'Report Fraud, Waste and Abuse' page provides comprehensive information about reporting healthcare fraud, including explanations of neglect, abuse, and fraud, as well as instructions on how to report such incidents.

qa_pairs.question: How do I report fraud, waste, or abuse?
qa_pairs.answer: To report waste, abuse, or fraud, gather as much information as possible and contact MHS Member Services at 1-877-647-4848 (TTY: 1-800-743-3333) or email mhsfraudreport@mhsindiana.com. You can also use the Confidential Reporting line at 1-866-685-8664 or the Family and Social Services Administration Hotline at 1-800-403-0864.

qa_pairs.question: What information should I provide when reporting fraud, waste, or abuse about a healthcare provider?
qa_pairs.answer: When reporting about a provider, include their name, address, and phone number, the name and address of the facility, Medicaid number if available, type of provider, names and phone numbers of other witnesses, dates of events, and a summary of what happened.

qa_pairs.question: Why is it important to report fraud, waste, and abuse?
qa_pairs.answer: Reporting fraud, waste, and abuse is crucial to prevent financial loss and ensure the integrity of healthcare benefits. It helps in identifying and addressing fraudulent activities, thereby protecting the healthcare system.

qa_pairs.question: When should I report suspected fraud, waste, or abuse?
qa_pairs.answer: You should report suspected fraud, waste, or abuse as soon as possible after gathering the necessary information. The page emphasizes the importance of providing detailed information when reporting.

qa_pairs.question: Where can I find more information about reporting fraud, waste, and abuse?
qa_pairs.answer: More information can be found on the MHS Indiana website at https://www.mhsindiana.com/members/hip/support-services/responsibilities/reducing-fraud.html.

qa_pairs.question: Who should I contact if I have questions about reporting fraud, waste, or abuse?
qa_pairs.answer: You can contact MHS Member Services at 1-877-647-4848 (TTY: 1-800-743-3333) for any questions or concerns about reporting fraud, waste, or abuse.

qa_pairs.question: What are the different types of abuse?
qa_pairs.answer: The different types of abuse include Physical Abuse (inappropriate contact causing bodily harm), Sexual Abuse (non-consensual sexual behavior or contact), Mental Abuse (emotional distress from demeaning or threatening actions), and Financial Abuse (using someone's money without consent).

qa_pairs.question: Can I report fraud, waste, or abuse anonymously?
qa_pairs.answer: While the page does not explicitly state that reports can be made anonymously, you can use the Confidential Reporting line at 1-866-685-8664 to report incidents.

qa_pairs.question: What is considered fraud in healthcare benefits?
qa_pairs.answer: Fraud includes knowingly receiving benefits or payments not entitled to, such as misrepresenting information to obtain benefits, falsifying records or claims, lying on an application, using someone else's ID card, billing for undone services, and transportation usage abuse.

## Comprehensive Information about 'Partnered Member Events'

### Purpose
The purpose of 'Partnered Member Events' is to encourage MHS members to receive preventive care and educate them on healthy living through various events and programs.

### Key Features
1. **Healthy Celebrations**: Events focused on getting members to receive preventive care, including children's health (EPSDT/Well-Child) and women's health (mammography & Chlamydia screenings).
2. **Baby Showers**: Two to three-hour events educating members on prenatal and postpartum care, and immunizations for babies.
3. **Member Advisory Council (MAC)**: A forum for gathering member feedback to enhance MHS's relationship with its members and community partners.
4. **MHS Adopt-a-School Program**: Collaborative initiatives with schools to educate students and their families on healthy living.

### Relevant Links
- [MHS Baby Shower](/members/baby-shower.html)
- [Member Advisory Council (MAC)](/members/MAC-Meeting.html)
- [Adopt a School](/about-us/school-based-services.html)

### Instructions
- Events are hosted at provider offices or local community centers.
- Members are encouraged to attend and participate in activities such as games, prizes, and health education sessions.

### Phone Numbers
- 1-877-647-4848
- TTY: 1-800-743-3333

### Addresses
No specific addresses are mentioned on the webpage.

### People Names
No specific people names are mentioned on the webpage.

### Other Relevant Details
- Events include food, drinks, and giveaways to encourage participation.
- The Adopt-a-School program emphasizes exercise, healthy eating, bullying prevention, school nurse support, and access to care.
- MHS provides information in different languages and formats at no cost to members. 
- Last Updated: 07/03/2025.

### Comprehensive Information about 'Frequently Asked Questions'

#### Purpose and Explanation
The 'Frequently Asked Questions' section on the MHS Indiana website is designed to provide members with answers to common queries regarding their health insurance coverage. It includes detailed information about various aspects of their services, such as portal accounts, doctor selection, covered services, and rewards programs.

#### FAQs
1. How do I get a Secure Member Portal Account?
   - Sign up on the Secure Member Portal website.
2. How do I update the information in my Secure Member Portal Account?
   - Call the Department of Family Resources (DFR) at 1-800-403-0864.
3. I’ve had a recent change with income. How do I update this information?
   - Call the Department of Family Resources (DFR) at 1-800-403-0864 or visit the FSSA Benefits Portal.
4. How do I choose or change my doctor?
   - Find providers in your area, pick a doctor, and notify MHS through the Secure Member Portal or by calling Member Services at 1-877-647-4848.
5. I am newly eligible with MHS. I don’t have a doctor, but I need to see someone now. What do I do?
   - Call the MHS 24-hour nurse advice line at 1-877-647-4848 or visit a walk-in clinic.
6. What services are covered?
   - Full health benefits including preventive care, hospital services, behavioral health care, and prescriptions.
7. Are dental and vision benefits covered?
   - Yes, for members enrolled in HIP, Hoosier Care Connect, and Hoosier Healthwise.
8. How can I make a HIP POWER Account payment online?
   - Visit the online payment site.
9. What is the My Health Pays rewards program?
   - Earn rewards for making healthy choices, such as completing a Health Needs Screening and staying up-to-date on preventive care.
10. How long does it take for rewards to be loaded to my My Health Pays™ Visa® Prepaid Card?
    - Up to 4-6 weeks after completing a Health Needs Screening and up to 3 months after getting preventive services.
11. Can I check my eligibility online?
    - Yes, on the Secure Member Portal homepage.
12. How often is member eligibility information updated?
    - Within 3 business days on the Secure Portal.
13. How do I know when it’s time to re-enroll for my benefits?
    - The state will begin the renewal process 75 days before the end of your 12-month enrollment period.

#### Relevant Links
- [Secure Member Portal](https://member.mhsindiana.com/)

   - Call the Department of Family Resources (DFR) at 1-800-403-0864.

browser_content:
### Grievance Process Details

#### Purpose
The grievance process allows members (or their authorized representatives or providers acting on their behalf with written consent) to file a grievance either orally or in writing regarding any expression of dissatisfaction other than an "adverse action."

#### Relevant Links
- [Grievance Process Page](https://www.mhsindiana.com/providers/resources/grievance-process.html)

#### Instructions
1. Members can file a grievance orally or in writing.
2. Grievances must be filed within 60 calendar days from the date of notice of action or inaction.
3. MHS acknowledges receipt of each grievance in the manner it was received.

#### Phone Numbers
- Main Contact: 1-877-647-4848
- TTY: 1-800-743-3333

#### Addresses
- Not explicitly mentioned; contact information is provided via phone numbers.

#### Key Features
1. **Grievance Resolution Time Frame**: Grievances are resolved within 30 calendar days, with expedited reviews available for urgent situations within 72 hours.
2. **Expedited Grievance Reviews**: Available for situations deemed urgent, such as denial of an expedited appeal request.
3. **No Punitive Action**: MHS will not take punitive action against providers who file a grievance on a member's behalf.
4. **Clinical Expertise**: Decision-makers for grievances involving clinical issues have appropriate clinical expertise.

#### Other Relevant Information
1. **Appeals**: Requests for review of a "Notice of Adverse Action" can be made in writing or orally.
2. **Appeal Resolution Time Frame**: Standard appeals are resolved within 30 days (with a possible 14-day extension), while expedited appeals are resolved within 72 hours.
3. **Notice of Adverse Action**: Includes denial or limited authorization of a service, reduction, suspension, or termination of a previously authorized service, and more.
4. **Member Support**: MHS provides information at no cost to members in different languages or formats upon request.

#### Additional Details
- Last Updated: 02/17/2025
- MHS values its providers and ensures that individuals making decisions on grievances are not involved in previous levels of review or decision-making.

Attachments:

qa_pairs.question: What is the Grievance Process?
qa_pairs.answer: The grievance process allows members (or their authorized representatives or providers acting on their behalf with written consent) to file a grievance either orally or in writing regarding any expression of dissatisfaction other than an 'adverse action.'

qa_pairs.question: How do I file a grievance?
qa_pairs.answer: Members can file a grievance orally or in writing. Grievances must be filed within 60 calendar days from the date of notice of action or inaction. MHS acknowledges receipt of each grievance in the manner it was received.

qa_pairs.question: Why should I use the Grievance Process?
qa_pairs.answer: The grievance process is available for members to express dissatisfaction regarding any issue other than an 'adverse action.' It ensures that members have a formal channel to address their concerns.

qa_pairs.question: When should I file a grievance?
qa_pairs.answer: Grievances must be filed within 60 calendar days from the date of notice of action or inaction.

qa_pairs.question: Where can I find more information about the Grievance Process?
qa_pairs.answer: More information about the Grievance Process can be found on the Grievance Process Page: https://www.mhsindiana.com/providers/resources/grievance-process.html

qa_pairs.question: Who should I contact about filing a grievance?
qa_pairs.answer: You can contact MHS at 1-877-647-4848 (Main Contact) or 1-800-743-3333 (TTY) for assistance with filing a grievance.

qa_pairs.question: How long does it take to resolve a grievance?
qa_pairs.answer: Grievances are resolved within 30 calendar days, with expedited reviews available for urgent situations within 72 hours.

qa_pairs.question: What happens if I file a grievance on behalf of a member?
qa_pairs.answer: MHS will not take punitive action against providers who file a grievance on a member's behalf with written consent.

qa_pairs.question: Can I request an expedited grievance review?
qa_pairs.answer: Yes, expedited grievance reviews are available for situations deemed urgent, such as denial of an expedited appeal request. These are resolved within 72 hours.

qa_pairs.question: What is the difference between a grievance and an appeal?
qa_pairs.answer: A grievance is filed for any expression of dissatisfaction other than an 'adverse action,' while an appeal is a request for review of a 'Notice of Adverse Action.' Appeals can be made in writing or orally and are resolved within 30 days (with a possible 14-day extension) for standard appeals, and within 72 hours for expedited appeals.

browser_content:
## Case and Disease Management

### Overview
The Managed Health Services (MHS) Case and Disease Management programs are designed to support patients with complex medical needs by providing resources and specialized information to manage their health, prevent complications, and improve their quality of life.

### Referrals
To refer a member to these programs, providers can:
1. Complete the Care/Case/Disease Management Request form available on the [Provider Forms](https://www.mhsindiana.com/providers/resources/case-and-disease-management.html) page.
2. Call MHS Case/Disease Management at 1-877-647-4848.
3. Send a message through the MHS website.

### Case Management
#### Who Qualifies for Case Management?
Patients may benefit from Case Management if they:
* Have been diagnosed with a serious medical condition
* Have multiple injuries or medical problems
* Are at risk for a future adverse health event due to an existing medical condition
* Are undergoing an extended hospital stay
* Are seeing several doctors
* Have had recurring re-admissions for a single diagnosis
* May need an organ transplant
* Have a condition that renders them incapable of performing daily independent living activities

#### Complex Case Management
MHS members are automatically enrolled in the complex case management program after being identified with a qualifying condition. Eligibility is based on diagnosis and medical services. Membership is voluntary, and members can opt-out at any time. Complex Case Management is available for members with:
* Transplants
* Multiple chronic illnesses with high utilization
* Catastrophic conditions/special needs requiring coordination of care
* Special needs populations not already covered in an MHS Disease Management program

### Disease Management
#### Who Qualifies for Disease Management?
The following Disease Management programs are available to MHS members:
* Asthma
* Adult Diabetes
* High-risk Pregnancy
* Substance abuse
* Perinatal Depression
* Depression
* ADHD
* COPD
* CHF
* CAD
* CKD

#### Health Condition Management
Additional Health Condition Management programs are available for:
* Asthma
* Diabetes
* Depression
* Pediatric Asthma
* Pediatric Diabetes
* Perinatal Depression
* ADHD
* COPD
* CHF
* CAD
* CKD

### MHS Care Manager's Role
MHS Case Managers are trained professionals (registered nurses and social workers) who:
1. Work with patients to develop a care plan
2. Identify available services
3. Provide options to maximize covered benefits
4. Assist with issues such as housing, food, and transportation

### Additional Resources
MHS provides a [Health Library](https://www.mhsindiana.com/providers/resources/case-and-disease-management.html) where providers can print health information sheets for their patients.

### Contact Information
For more information on Case and Disease Management programs, providers can:
1. Call 1-877-647-4848
2. Send a message through the MHS website

Last Updated: 02/17/2025

Attachments:

qa_pairs.answer: You can access the Resource Center by visiting the MHS Indiana website at https://www.mhsindiana.com/providers/resources/resource-center.html. The page contains links to various resources, including CLAS Standards, Correct Coding Initiative, Patient Centered Medical Home Model, and Tobacco Cessation Resources.

qa_pairs.question: What resources are available in the Resource Center?
qa_pairs.answer: The Resource Center provides access to several key resources, including CLAS Standards (https://www.mhsindiana.com/providers/resources/resource-center/clas-standards.html), Correct Coding Initiative (https://www.mhsindiana.com/providers/resources/resource-center/correct-coding.html), Patient Centered Medical Home Model (https://www.mhsindiana.com/providers/resources/resource-center/medical-home.html), and Tobacco Cessation Resources (https://www.mhsindiana.com/providers/resources/resource-center/tobacco-cessation.html).

qa_pairs.question: Why should I use the Resource Center?
qa_pairs.answer: The Resource Center is a valuable tool for providers as it offers a centralized location for accessing important resources, such as clinical standards, coding guidelines, and patient care models, which can help improve the quality of care and operational efficiency.

qa_pairs.question: When was the Resource Center last updated?
qa_pairs.answer: The Resource Center was last updated on October 8, 2025.

qa_pairs.question: Where can I find information on CLAS Standards?
qa_pairs.answer: Information on CLAS Standards can be found in the Resource Center by visiting https://www.mhsindiana.com/providers/resources/resource-center/clas-standards.html.

qa_pairs.question: Who should I contact if I have questions about the Resource Center?
qa_pairs.answer: If you have questions about the Resource Center, you can contact MHS Indiana by calling 1-877-647-4848 (TTY: 1-800-743-3333).

qa_pairs.question: Can I access the Resource Center in different languages?
qa_pairs.answer: Yes, the Resource Center is available in different languages and formats. To request materials in a different language or format, call 1-877-647-4848 (TTY: 1-800-743-3333).

qa_pairs.question: What software is required to access PDFs on the Resource Center website?
qa_pairs.answer: Adobe Reader is required to open PDFs on the Resource Center website. You can download Adobe Reader for free at https://get.adobe.com/reader/.

qa_pairs.question: How do I get help with Tobacco Cessation Resources?
qa_pairs.answer: You can access Tobacco Cessation Resources by visiting https://www.mhsindiana.com/providers/resources/resource-center/tobacco-cessation.html. For additional assistance, you can contact MHS Indiana at 1-877-647-4848 (TTY: 1-800-743-3333).

## Electronic Transactions

### Explanation
Electronic Transactions (EDI) support is provided by Centene Corporation for HIPAA transactions. The health plan currently receives professional, institutional, and encounter transactions electronically, as well as generates an electronic remittance advice/explanation of payment (ERA/EOP).

### Relevant Links and Resources
- PaySpan: https://www.payspan.com - Provides Electronic Funds Transfers (EFTs) and Electronic Remittance Advices (ERAs)
- Secure Provider Portal: https://www.mhsindiana.com/providers/resources/secure-provider-portal.html - Offers various features like Member Eligibility Verification, Claims Submission, and Authorization
- EDI Department Contact: 1-800-225-2573, ext. 25525

### Instructions and Contact Information
- To conduct other HIPAA transactions not listed, contact the EDI department at 1-800-225-2573, ext. 25525.
- Trading partners for electronic transactions: Availity, Capario, Smarta Data, Allscripts/Payerpath, IGI, Physicians CC, Claimson, Claim Remedi, First Health Care, Viatrack, GHNonline, Medassets/exactimed, Practice Insight, SSI, Gateway EDI, Relay Health, McKesson, MDOnLine.

### Key Features and Capabilities
- Electronic Funds Transfers (EFTs)
- Electronic Remittance Advices (ERAs)
- Support for HIPAA transactions

### Other Related Resources
- Electronic Data Interchange (EDI) support is provided by Centene Corporation for HIPAA transactions.
- Last Updated: 07/01/2025

Attachments:

qa_pairs.question: What is Electronic Transactions?
qa_pairs.answer: Electronic Transactions (EDI) support is provided by Centene Corporation for HIPAA transactions, enabling the exchange of electronic funds transfers (EFTs) and electronic remittance advices (ERAs).

qa_pairs.question: How do I use Electronic Transactions for claims submission?
qa_pairs.answer: You can use the Secure Provider Portal (https://www.mhsindiana.com/providers/login.html) to submit claims and check claim status. Additionally, you can utilize PaySpan (https://www.mhsindiana.com/providers/resources/electronic-transactions/payspan.html) for Electronic Funds Transfers (EFTs) and Electronic Remittance Advices (ERAs).

qa_pairs.question: Why should I use Electronic Transactions?
qa_pairs.answer: Electronic Transactions capabilities speed up the processing and payment of claims, improving administrative efficiency for participating providers.

qa_pairs.question: When is Electronic Transactions available?
qa_pairs.answer: Electronic Transactions are available now through the Secure Provider Portal and PaySpan. The information was last updated on 07/01/2025.

qa_pairs.question: Where can I find more information about Electronic Transactions?
qa_pairs.answer: More information about Electronic Transactions can be found on the Secure Provider Portal (https://www.mhsindiana.com/providers/resources/secure-provider-portal.html) and PaySpan (https://www.payspan.com).

qa_pairs.question: Who should I contact about Electronic Transactions?
qa_pairs.answer: For inquiries about Electronic Transactions, you can contact the EDI Department at 1-800-225-2573, ext. 25525, or call General Information at 1-877-647-4848 (TTY: 1-800-743-3333).

qa_pairs.question: What are the key features of Electronic Transactions?
qa_pairs.answer: Key features include Electronic Funds Transfers (EFTs), Electronic Remittance Advices (ERAs), and support for HIPAA transactions.

qa_pairs.question: How do I verify member eligibility using Electronic Transactions?
qa_pairs.answer: You can verify member eligibility using the Secure Provider Portal (https://www.mhsindiana.com/providers/login.html).

qa_pairs.question: What trading partners are supported for Electronic Transactions?
qa_pairs.answer: Supported trading partners include Availity, Capario, Smarta Data, Allscripts/Payerpath, IGI, Physicians CC, Claim Remedi, First Health Care, Viatrack, GHNonline, Medassets/exactimed, Practice Insight, SSI, Gateway EDI, Relay Health, McKesson, MDOnLine, CPSI, and DeKalb.

qa_pairs.question: Can I submit authorizations electronically?
qa_pairs.answer: Yes, you can submit and confirm authorizations electronically using the Secure Provider Portal (https://www.mhsindiana.com/providers/login.html).

## Comprehensive Information on 'Forms'

### Purpose and Explanation
The 'Forms' page on the MHS Indiana website provides various forms and documents required for different purposes such as Provider Enrollment, Prior Authorization, Medical Record Submission, Member Management, and Pharmacy. These forms are essential for healthcare providers to comply with the requirements of MHS Indiana.

### Form Categories and Relevant Information

1. **Provider Enrollment**
   - Behavioral Health Provider Specialty Profile (PDF): [/content/dam/centene/mhsindiana/medicaid/pdfs/BhavorHelthPrvdrSpcalFrm-508.pdf](/content/dam/centene/mhsindiana/medicaid/pdfs/BhavorHelthPrvdrSpcalFrm-508.pdf)
   - Behavioral Health Facility and Ancillary Demographic Form (PDF): [/content/dam/centene/mhsindiana/medicaid/pdfs/508-MHS-Facility-Demo-Info.pdf](/content/dam/centene/mhsindiana/medicaid/pdfs/508-MHS-Facility-Demo-Info.pdf)
   - Hoosier Healthwise, Healthy Indiana Plan and Hoosier Care Connect Hospital and Ancillary Credentialing Form (PDF): [/content/dam/centene/mhsindiana/medicaid/pdfs/IHCPAncilaryEnrollmentForm-508.pdf](/content/dam/centene/mhsindiana/medicaid/pdfs/IHCPAncilaryEnrollmentForm-508.pdf)
   - IHCP Practitioner Enrollment Form (PDF): [/content/dam/centene/mhsindiana/medicaid/pdfs/IHCPPrctitionerEnrlmetForm-508.pdf](/content/dam/centene/mhsindiana/medicaid/pdfs/IHCPPrctitionerEnrlmetForm-508.pdf)
   - Provider Specialty Profile Form (PDF): [/content/dam/centene/mhsindiana/medicaid/pdfs/508-Specialty-Medication-PA.pdf](/content/dam/centene/mhsindiana/medicaid/pdfs/508-Specialty-Medication-PA.pdf)

2. **Prior Authorization**
   - EDO Supplemental Notification Requirement (52744 Application for Emergency Detention): [https://forms.in.gov/download.aspx?id=7322](https://forms.in.gov/download.aspx?id=7322)
   - IHCP Prior Authorization Form (PDF): [/content/dam/centene/mhsindiana/medicaid/pdfs/IHCP-PA-Form-508.pdf](/content/dam/centene/mhsindiana/medicaid/pdfs/IHCP-PA-Form-508.pdf)
   - Supplemental PA Form (PDF): [/content/dam/centene/mhsindiana/medicaid/pdfs/Supplemental-PA-Form-508.pdf](/content/dam/centene/mhsindiana/medicaid/pdfs/Supplemental-PA-Form-508.pdf)

3. **Prior Authorization for Inpatient SUD Treatment**
   - Initial Assessment Form for Substance Use Disorder Treatment Admission (PDF): [/content/dam/centene/mhsindiana/medicaid/pdfs/508-InitialAssessSUDTreatment.pdf](/content/dam/centene/mhsindiana/medicaid/pdfs/508-InitialAssessSUDTreatment.pdf)
   - Reassessment Form for Continued Substance Use Disorder Treatment (PDF): [/content/dam/centene/mhsindiana/medicaid/pdfs/508-ReassessContinuSUDTreatmnt.pdf](/content/dam/centene/mhsindiana/medicaid/pdfs/508-ReassessContinuSUDTreatmnt.pdf)

4. **Medical Record Submission**
   - Supplemental Information Fax Back Form (PDF): [/content/dam/centene/mhsindiana/medicaid/pdfs/Fax-Back-Form-2025-508.pdf](/content/dam/centene/mhsindiana/medicaid/pdfs/Fax-Back-Form-2025-508.pdf)

5. **Member Management**
   - Key Provider Partnership Outreach Program Order Form (PDF): [/content/dam/centene/mhsindiana/medicaid/pdfs/Key-Provider-Order-Form-508.pdf](/content/dam/centene/mhsindiana/medicaid/pdfs/Key-Provider-Order-Form-508.pdf)
   - MemberConnections Referral Form (PDF): [/content/dam/centene/mhsindiana/medicaid/pdfs/MemberConnections-Referral-508.pdf](/content/dam/centene/mhsindiana/medicaid/pdfs/MemberConnections-Referral-508.pdf)

6. **Pharmacy**
   - Disease/Drug Specific Prior Authorization Forms: [/providers/pharmacy/pharmacy-forms.html](/providers/pharmacy/pharmacy-forms.html)
   - General Specialty Prior Authorization Form (PDF): [/content/dam/centene/mhsindiana/medicaid/pdfs/508-SpecialtyMedicationPA-form.pdf](/content/dam/centene/mhsindiana/medicaid/pdfs/508-SpecialtyMedicationPA-form.pdf)
   - Medication Prior Authorization Form (PDF): [/content/dam/centene/mhsindiana/medicaid/pdfs/Medication-Prior-Authorization-Form-508.pdf](/content/dam/centene/mhsindiana/medicaid/pdfs/Medication-Prior-Authorization-Form-508.pdf)

7. **Ambetter and Wellcare and Wellcare Complete Manuals & Forms**
   - Ambetter, Wellcare & Wellcare Complete Provider Enrollment Form (PDF): [/content/dam/centene/mhsindiana/medicaid/pdfs/508-AMB-WC-Enrollment-Form.pdf](/content/dam/centene/mhsindiana/medicaid/pdfs/508-AMB-WC-Enrollment-Form.pdf)

### Instructions
- All files are available as Adobe Acrobat PDF unless otherwise stated.
- Prior Authorizations can be completed via the MHS Secure Web Portal.
- The Full Panel Add and Hold Request form and Member Disenrollment form are now available on the [Provider Portal](https://provider.mhsindiana.com/sso/login?service=httpsprovider.mhsindiana.comcareconnectj_spring_cas_security_check).
- Copies of completed paper forms are no longer accepted via fax or email.
- To order MHS brochures and other office items, please reach out to your Provider Relations Representative or fill out the online [Materials Order Form](/materials-order-form.html).

### Important Details
- Last Updated: 09/02/2025
- Need information in a different language or format? MHS will provide it at no cost to you. Call 1-877-647-4848 (TTY: 1-800-743-3333).
- You will need Adobe Reader to open PDFs on this site. [Download the free version of Adobe Reader.](https://get.adobe.com/reader/)

### Key Features and Capabilities
- The 'Forms' page provides a comprehensive list of forms categorized by purpose.
- Most forms are available as PDF links for easy access.
- Some forms can be completed online via the MHS Secure Web Portal.
- Instructions are provided for submitting forms and accessing additional resources.

### Other Relevant Information
- The page includes contact information for Provider Relations Representatives.
- There are links to additional resources such as the Provider Portal and Materials Order Form.
- The page is regularly updated, with the last update on 09/02/2025.
