browser_content:
## Member Portal Information

### Purpose and Explanation
The Member Portal is a platform that allows members to manage their health insurance plans. It enables members to view claims, get a new ID card, update their information, and more.

### Relevant Links
1. **Member Portal Login**: [Login](https://member.mhsindiana.com/)
2. **Find a Provider**: [Begin Provider Search](/find-a-doctor/find-a-provider-home.html)
3. **Complete a Health Needs Screening**: [Complete Health Needs Screening](https://ux-gateway.pursuanthealth.com/integration/?channel=b775e5e8-04fa-11e7-b995-0e00f81b9900&organization=ad387594-ecf8-11e6-b39f-0a9b658bd5fd&group_alt_id=5.html)
4. **Earn Rewards**: [Earn Rewards](/members/healthy-rewards-program.html)
5. **Healthy Indiana Plan**: [See Healthy Indiana Plans](/members/hip.html)
6. **Hoosier Care Connect**: [See Hoosier Care Connect Plans](/members/care-connect.html)
7. **Hoosier Healthwise**: [See Hoosier Healthwise Plans](/members/medicaid.html)
8. **Ambetter Health**: [See Ambetter Health Marketplace Plans](/members/ambetter.html)
9. **Wellcare by Allwell**: [See Wellcare By Allwell Medicare Advantage Plans](/members/medicare-advantage.html)
10. **Wellcare Complete**: [See Wellcare Complete Medicare Advantage Plans](/members/wellcare-complete.html)

### Instructions
- To access the Member Portal, visit the [Login](https://member.mhsindiana.com/) page.
- To find a provider, use the [Begin Provider Search](/find-a-doctor/find-a-provider-home.html) tool.
- To complete a Health Needs Screening, visit the [Complete Health Needs Screening](https://ux-gateway.pursuanthealth.com/integration/?channel=b775e5e8-04fa-11e7-b995-0e00f81b9900&organization=ad387594-ecf8-11e6-b39f-0a9b658bd5fd&group_alt_id=5.html) page.

### Phone Numbers
1. **Customer Service**: 1-877-647-4848
2. **TTY**: 1-800-743-3333

### Key Features
1. **View Claims**: Access your claims information through the Member Portal.
2. **Get a New ID Card**: Request a new ID card through the Member Portal.
3. **Update Information**: Update your personal information through the Member Portal.
4. **Health Insurance Plans**: Various plans are available, including Healthy Indiana Plan, Hoosier Care Connect, Hoosier Healthwise, Ambetter Health, Wellcare by Allwell, and Wellcare Complete.
5. **Care Coordination Services**: Available for Hoosier Care Connect members.
6. **Health & Wellness Programs**: Various programs are available for members, including health screenings and rewards programs.

### Additional Information
Members can access additional resources, including:
- Member Handbooks for various plans
- Member News and Updates
- Health Library and Resources
- Language Assistance: Available at no cost to members. Call 1-877-647-4848 (TTY: 1-800-743-3333).

Attachments:

qa_pairs.question: What is the Member Portal?
qa_pairs.answer: The Member Portal is a platform that allows members to manage their health insurance plans. It enables members to view claims, get a new ID card, update their information, and more.

qa_pairs.answer: To access the Member Portal, visit the Login page at https://member.mhsindiana.com/.

qa_pairs.answer: On the Member Portal, you can view claims, request a new ID card, and update your personal information.

## Information about Complete a Health Needs Screening

The 'Complete a Health Needs Screening' link is present in the 'Member Quick Links' section on the MHS Indiana portal for members. The URL associated with it is https://ux-gateway.pursuanthealth.com/integration/?channel=b775e5e8-04fa-11e7-b995-0e00f81b9900&organization=ad387594-ecf8-11e6-b39f-0a9b658bd5fd&group_alt_id=5.html

The page contains information about various health programs such as Hoosier Care Connect, Hoosier Healthwise, and Ambetter Health. These programs provide different healthcare services for various demographics.

### Key Features and Instructions:
- Hoosier Care Connect: For Indiana Health Coverage Programs (IHCP) members age 65 and over, or with blindness or a disability.
- Hoosier Healthwise: For children, pregnant women, and families with low income.
- Ambetter Health: Affordable health care coverage for individuals and families.

### Contact Information:
- Phone: 1-877-647-4848
- TTY: 1-800-743-3333

### Comprehensive Information about 'Earn Rewards'

#### Purpose
The 'Earn Rewards' program, also known as My Health Pays® Rewards, is designed to encourage members to focus on their health by completing various healthy activities. Members can earn rewards for activities such as yearly wellness exams, annual screenings, and other health-related actions.

#### Relevant Links
- [My Health Pays® Rewards Program Page](https://www.mhsindiana.com/members/healthy-rewards-program.html)
- [My Health Pays Common Questions](/members/healthy-rewards-program/my-health-pays-common-questions.html)
- [Member Portal Login](https://member.mhsindiana.com/sso/login?service=httpsmember.mhsindiana.comhealthconnectj_spring_cas_security_check)
- [MHS Indiana My Plan](https://www.mhsindiana.com/members/my-plan.html)
- [Pregnancy Page](/members/hip/health-services/pregnancy/pregnancy.html)

#### Instructions
1. Complete a Health Needs Screening (HNS) within 30 or 90 days of becoming a member.
2. Create a Secure Portal Account on the MHS Indiana website.
3. Attend an Annual Well-Visit with your primary medical provider.
4. Take your child for Infant Well-Child Visits at specified ages.
5. Have an Annual Dental Visit (for members aged 1-20).
6. Stop Smoking by completing the IN Tobacco Quitline.
7. Participate in Health Management Coaching.
8. Enroll in the Fresh Start Program if diagnosed with a substance use disorder.
9. Notify MHS of Pregnancy within the first or second trimester.
10. Attend a Postpartum Visit 3-8 weeks after delivery.

#### Phone Numbers
- Main Contact: 1-877-647-4848
- TTY: 1-800-743-3333

#### Key Features
- Earn rewards for various health-related activities.
- Use rewards for utilities, transportation, telecommunications, childcare services, education, rent, and POWER Account Contributions.
- Rewards can also be used to shop at Walmart for everyday items.
- Funds expire 90 days after termination of insurance coverage or 365 days after the date the reward was earned.

#### Other Relevant Details
- The rewards card is issued by The Bancorp Bank, N.A., Member FDIC, pursuant to a license from Visa U.S.A. Inc.
- The card cannot be used everywhere Visa debit cards are accepted; see the Cardholder Agreement for complete usage restrictions.
- Members can check their current My Health Pays® rewards balance by logging into their member account.
- To be eligible for Pregnancy rewards, members must notify MHS of their pregnancy prior to having their baby.
</result>

qa_pairs.question: What is the 'Earn Rewards' program?
qa_pairs.answer: The 'Earn Rewards' program, also known as My Health Pays® Rewards, is designed to encourage members to focus on their health by completing various healthy activities. Members can earn rewards for activities such as yearly wellness exams, annual screenings, and health-related actions.

qa_pairs.question: How do I earn rewards?
qa_pairs.answer: Members can earn rewards by completing various healthy activities such as yearly wellness exams, annual screenings, and health-related actions. Specific activities include: completing a Health Needs Screening within 30 or 90 days of becoming a member, attending an Annual Well-Visit with your primary medical provider, taking your child for Infant Well-Child Visits, having an Annual Dental Visit (for members aged 1-20), stopping smoking by completing the IN Tobacco Quitline, participating in Health Management Coaching, enrolling in the Fresh Start Program if diagnosed with a substance use disorder, and notifying MHS of Pregnancy within the first or second trimester, and attending a Postpartum Visit 3-8 weeks after delivery.

qa_pairs.question: What can I use my rewards for?
qa_pairs.answer: Rewards can be used for utilities, transportation, telecommunications, childcare services, education, rent, and other expenses. They can also be used to shop at Walmart for everyday items and for POWER Account Contributions.

qa_pairs.question: How do I check my rewards balance?
qa_pairs.answer: Members can check their current My Health Pays® rewards balance by logging into their member account on the MHS Indiana website. The Member Portal Login is available at https://member.mhsindiana.com/sso/login?service=httpsmember.mhsindiana.comhealthconnectj_spring_cas_security_check.

qa_pairs.question: Why should I participate in the 'Earn Rewards' program?
qa_pairs.answer: Participating in the 'Earn Rewards' program encourages members to focus on their health by completing various healthy activities, which can lead to better health outcomes. Members can also earn rewards that can be used for various expenses.

qa_pairs.question: When do rewards expire?
qa_pairs.answer: Funds expire 90 days after termination of insurance coverage or 365 days after the date the reward was earned, whichever comes first.

qa_pairs.question: Where can I find more information about the 'Earn Rewards' program?
qa_pairs.answer: For detailed information about the 'Earn Rewards' program, members can refer to the MHS Indiana website at https://www.mhsindiana.com/members/healthy-rewards-program.html. Additional resources include the My Health Pays Common Questions page and the Member Portal Login.

qa_pairs.question: Who should I contact if I have questions about the 'Earn Rewards' program?
qa_pairs.answer: Members can contact MHS Indiana at 1-877-647-4848 for general inquiries. For TTY, the number is 1-800-743-3333.

qa_pairs.question: What are the key features of the 'Earn Rewards' program?
qa_pairs.answer: Key features of the 'Earn Rewards' program include earning rewards for various health-related activities, using rewards for a variety of expenses, and the ability to check rewards balance through the member account. The program includes activities such as Health Needs Screenings, Annual Well-Visits, Stop Smoking initiatives, and Pregnancy-related rewards.

qa_pairs.question: Can I use my rewards card anywhere?
qa_pairs.answer: The rewards card, issued by The Bancorp Bank, N.A., Member FDIC, pursuant to a license from Visa U.S.A. Inc., cannot be used everywhere Visa debit cards are accepted. See the Cardholder Agreement for complete usage restrictions.

## Ambetter Health (Health Insurance Marketplace)

### Explanation
Ambetter Health is a health insurance plan offered by Managed Health Services (MHS) through the Health Insurance Marketplace. It provides affordable health care coverage for individuals and families. The plan's eligibility and premium costs may be influenced by family size and income, potentially qualifying individuals for financial assistance.

### Relevant Links
- [Ambetter Health](/members/ambetter.html)
- [Ambetter Health External Link](https://ambetter.mhsindiana.com/)

### Instructions
To learn more about Ambetter Health plans and their benefits, visit the [Ambetter Health page](/members/ambetter.html). For enrollment or plan details, you may need to navigate through the Health Insurance Marketplace or contact MHS directly.

### Phone Numbers
- General inquiries: 1-877-647-4848--8-800-743-3333

### Key Features
- Affordable health care coverage for individuals and families.
- Eligibility for financial assistance based on family size and income.
- Access to a network of doctors,azza, and specialty providers.

### Other Relevant Details
- Ambetter Health is part of the Health Insurance Marketplace, allowing for comparison and purchase of health plans.
- Members can manage their plans, view claims, and update information through the [Member Portal](https://member.mhsindiana.com/).
- MHS provides language assistance and alternative formats for information at no additional cost to members. Call 1-877-647-4848 (TTY: 1-800-743-3333) for assistance.

### Purpose and Explanation
The 'Login External Link' is a portal for members to access their accounts and manage their health insurance plans provided by MHS Indiana. It allows members to view claims, obtain new ID cards, update their information, and more.

### Login External Link URL
The URL for the 'Login External Link' is: https://member.mhsindiana.com/

### Instructions
To access the member portal, follow these steps:
1. Click on the 'Login' link under the 'For Members' section.
2. You will be redirected to the login page at https://member.mhsindiana.com/.
3. Enter your credentials to access your account.

browser_content:
## Detailed Information about Healthy Indiana Plan (HIP)

### Purpose
The Healthy Indiana Plan (HIP) is a health insurance program designed for eligible Indiana residents, providing various health benefits based on the member's income and eligibility status. It covers medical costs including dental, vision, and chiropractic services.

### Relevant Links
1. [Healthy Indiana Plan (HIP) Main Page](/members/hip.html)
2. [How to Enroll](/members/hip/how-to-enroll.html)
3. [Benefits & Services](/members/hip/health-services.html)
4. [Resources](/members/hip/support-services.html)
5. [POWER Account Payments](/members/hip/support-services/coverage/power-account-payments.html)
6. [HIP Terminology Guide](http://www.in.gov/fssa/hip/2456.htm)
7. [My Health Pays Rewards Program](/members/hip/health-services/rewards/healthy-rewards-program.html)
8. [Member Portal account](https://member.mhsindiana.com/sso/login?service=httpsmember.mhsindiana.comhealthconnectj_spring_cas_security_check)
9. [Division of Family Resources (DFR)](http://www.in.gov/fssa/dfr/2999.htm)
10. [Written Notice for Initial POWER Account Payment (PDF)](http://www.in.gov/fssa/hip/files/Written_Notice_for_Initial_POWER_Account_Payment.pdf)

### Instructions
1. **Enrollment**: To enroll, visit the [How to Enroll](/members/hip/how-to-enroll.html) page.
2. **Changing Health Plans**: To change your health plan, call 1-877-GET-HIP-9 between November 1 and December 15.
3. **POWER Account Contribution**: Payments can be made by logging into your MHS Member Portal Account or by calling Member Services at 1-877-647-4848.
4. To report pregnancy, sign into your Member Portal account and fill out the Notification of Pregnancy form or call an OB Nurse at 1-877-647-4848, Extension 20309.
5. To change health insurance provider, call 1-877-GET-HIP-9 before paying your Fast Track invoice.
6. To make a Fast Track payment, pay either the $10 Fast Track payment or your POWER account contribution amount within 60 days of receiving your initial Fast Track invoice.

### Phone Numbers
1. **General Information**: 1-877-GET-HIP-9 (1-877-438-4479)
2. **Member Services**: 1-877-647-4848 (TTY: 1-800-743-3333)
3. **OB Nurse for Pregnancy**: 1-877-647-4848, Extension 20309

### Key Features
1. **HIP Plans**: HIP offers various plans including HIP Plus, HIP Basic, HIP State Plan, and HIP Pregnancy/HIP Maternity, with benefits varying by plan.
2. **POWER Account**: A special savings account that covers the first $2,500 of medical expenses for covered services.
3. **Fast Track**: A payment option allowing eligible individuals to expedite the start of their HIP Plus coverage by making a $10 payment.
4. **My Health Pays Rewards**: Members can earn rewards for healthy behaviors and use them to pay their POWER Account contributions.

### Other Relevant Details
1. **Eligibility**: HIP covers Hoosiers ages 19 to 64 who meet specific income levels.
2. **Cost Sharing**: Cost-sharing, including copayments and POWER Account contributions, is currently paused for HIP but resumed for CHIP and MEDWorks as of July 1, 2024.
3. **Health Plan Selection**: Members select a health plan or are assigned one and stay with it through the calendar year.
4. **Redetermination**: Eligibility redetermination occurs every 12 months, and members receive reminders to maintain coverage.
5. **HIP Plus**: Provides the best value coverage, including dental, vision, and chiropractic services, with a low, predictable monthly cost.
6. **HIP Basic**: Includes essential health benefits but lacks dental, vision, and chiropractic services.
7. **HIP State Plan**: For members who meet specific eligibility criteria, including Section 1931 eligible parents and caretaker relatives, low-income 19- and 20-year-old dependents, and individuals determined to be medically frail.
8. **HIP Maternity**: Pregnant HIP members receive additional benefits, including waived monthly POWER Account contributions during pregnancy, no copays for healthcare services during pregnancy, and additional benefits like transportation to doctor visits and chiropractic services.

This comprehensive information covers all aspects of Healthy Indiana Plan (HIP) as required.

Attachments:

### Detailed Information about Healthy Indiana Plan (HIP)

#### Purpose
The Healthy Indiana Plan (HIP) is a health coverage program designed for eligible Indiana residents, providing various health benefits based on the member's income and eligibility status.

#### Relevant Links
- [Member Portal account](https://member.mhsindiana.com/sso/login?service=httpsmember.mhsindiana.comhealthconnectj_spring_cas_security_check)
- [Division of Family Resources (DFR)](http://www.in.gov/fssa/dfr/2999.htm)
- [Written Notice for Initial POWER Account Payment (PDF)](http://www.in.gov/fssa/hip/files/Written_Notice_for_Initial_POWER_Account_Payment.pdf)

#### Instructions
1. To report pregnancy, sign into your Member Portal account and fill out the Notification of Pregnancy form or call an OB Nurse at 1-877-647-4848, Extension 20309.
2. To change health insurance provider, call 1-877-GET-HIP-9 before paying your Fast Track invoice.
3. To make a Fast Track payment, pay either the $10 Fast Track payment or your POWER account contribution amount within 60 days of receiving your initial Fast Track invoice.

#### Phone Numbers
- 1-877-GET-HIP-9 (1-877-438-4479) - For help picking the right health plan and to change health plan selection before paying your Fast Track invoice.
- 1-877-647-4848 (TTY: 1-800-743-3333) - For general inquiries and to report pregnancy.
- 1-877-647-4848, Extension 20309 - To complete the Notification of Pregnancy form over the phone.

#### Key Features
1. **HIP Plus**: Provides the best value coverage, including dental, vision, and chiropractic services, with a low, predictable monthly cost.
   - Members pay affordable monthly contributions based on their income.
   - Includes additional services like bariatric surgery and Temporomandibular Joint Disorders (TMJ) treatments.
   - Allows 90-day refills on prescriptions and mail-order medication.

2. **HIP Basic**: Includes essential health benefits but lacks dental, vision, and chiropractic services.
   - Members are responsible for copayments at the time of service.
   - More limits on annual visits for physical, speech, and occupational therapists.

3. **HIP State Plan**: For members who meet specific eligibility criteria, including Section 1931 eligible parents and caretaker relatives, low-income 19- and 20-year-old dependents, and individuals determined to be medically frail.
   - Includes essential health benefits and some enhanced benefits like dental and vision.
   - Costs vary; HIP State Plan Plus members pay monthly contributions, while HIP State Plan Basic members pay copayments.

4. **HIP Maternity**: Pregnant HIP members receive additional benefits, including:
   - Waived monthly POWER Account contribution (PAC) during pregnancy.
   - No copays for healthcare services during pregnancy.
   - Additional benefits like transportation to doctor visits and chiropractic services.
   - Potential for an additional $85 My Health Pays rewards.

#### Other Relevant Details
- **Fast Track Payment**: A payment that can be made to ensure enrollment in HIP Plus as quickly as possible. It's not mandatory, but it can expedite the enrollment process.
- **POWER Account Contribution (PAC)**: Monthly contributions based on income, with variations for tobacco users.
- **Redetermination Process**: Eligibility is reviewed every 12 months based on the month the member entered the program.
- **Health Plan Selection**: Members can change their health insurance provider during the open enrollment period from November 1 to December 15 each year.
</result>

qa_pairs.question: What are the different plans offered under HIP?

qa_pairs.question: Why should I choose HIP Plus?

qa_pairs.question: When can I change my health plan under HIP?

qa_pairs.question: What is the POWER Account Contribution (PAC) under HIP?
qa_pairs.answer: The POWER Account Contribution (PAC) is a monthly contribution based on income, with variations for tobacco users. It's a part of the HIP program, and contributions are used to cover medical expenses. For HIP Plus members, the PAC is waived during pregnancy.

qa_pairs.question: How can I make a Fast Track payment for HIP?
qa_pairs.answer: To make a Fast Track payment, you need to pay either the $10 Fast Track payment or your POWER account contribution amount within 60 days of receiving your initial Fast Track invoice. This payment can expedite the enrollment process for HIP Plus. You can make payments by logging into your MHS Member Portal Account or by calling Member Services at 1-877-647-4848.

browser_content:
## Overview of Hoosier Care Connect

Hoosier Care Connect is a coordinated care program for Indiana Health Coverage Programs (IHCP) members age 65 and over, or with blindness or a disability who are residing in the community and are not eligible for Medicare.

## Key Features

1. **Care Coordination**: Members will select a managed care entity (MCE) responsible for coordinating care in partnership with their medical provider(s).
2. **Medicaid-covered Benefits**: Hoosier Care Connect members will receive all Medicaid-covered benefits.
3. **Individualized Care**: Care coordination services will be individualized based on a member’s assessed level of need determined through a health screening.

## Relevant Details

* More information: [See Hoosier Care Connect Plans](https://www.mhsindiana.com/members/care-connect.html)
* Contact: 1-877-647-4848 (TTY: 1-800-743-3333)

Attachments:

## Hoosier Healthwise Plans

Hoosier Healthwise (HHW) is the State of Indiana’s health care program for children, pregnant women, and families with low income. Based on family income, children up to age 19 may be eligible for coverage. HHW covers medical care like doctor visits, prescription medicine, mental health care, dental care, hospitalizations, surgeries, and family planning at little or no cost to the member or the member’s family.

To see more details about Hoosier Healthwise Plans, you can visit the [Hoosier Healthwise Plans page](/members/medicaid.html).

### Key Features:
- Covers children up to age 19 based on family income
- Covers pregnant women
- Covers families with low income
- Includes medical care such as doctor visits, prescription medicine, mental health care, dental care, hospitalizations, surgeries, and family planning

### Relevant Links:

## Wellcare By Allwell Medicare Advantage Plans

Wellcare By Allwell is becoming Wellcare in 2026. The same dependable coverage and benefits will be available under the refreshed name. Here are the key details extracted from the webpage:

### Key Information
- Wellcare is the Medicare brand for Centene Corporation, an HMO, PPO, PFFS, PDP plan with a Medicare contract and is an approved Part D Sponsor.
- The D-SNP plans have a contract with the state Medicaid program.
- Enrollment in the plans depends on contract renewal.
- Medicare evaluates plans based on a 5-star rating system.
- Out-of-network/non-contracted providers are under no obligation to treat Plan members, except in emergency situations.

### Relevant Links
- [Shop for a Plan](https://wellcare.mhsindiana.com/new-to-plan/our-health-plans.html): Explore available plans and their details.
- [Plan Benefit Materials](https://wellcare.mhsindiana.com/plan-benefit-materials.html): Access documents related to plan benefits.
- [Contact Member Services](https://wellcare.mhsindiana.com/contact-us.html): Get in touch with member services for queries or support.

### Plan Benefits
- Over-the-Counter (OTC) Benefits: Allowance for everyday items.
- Telehealth: Virtual visits with a provider.
- Dental: Benefits to make you smile.
- Wellcare Spendables® Card: Added perks for D-SNP members.
- My Wellcare Rewards: Rewards for making healthy choices.

For more detailed information about Wellcare By Allwell Medicare Advantage Plans, you can explore the provided links or contact Member Services.

Attachments:

## Wellcare Complete Medicare Advantage Plans Overview

Wellcare By Allwell is a Medicare Advantage plan designed with the member's health in mind. It offers various benefits and services to its members.

## Key Features and Benefits

1. **Over-the-Counter Benefits**: Members can get personal care items they need.
2. **Telehealth**: Access to care through telehealth services.
3. **Dental Benefits**: Various dental benefits to make members smile.
4. **Transportation Benefits**: Transportation services to help members get to where they need to go.
5. **Wellcare Spendables Card**: Available for Dual Eligible Special Needs Plans (DSNPs).

## Relevant Links

1. [Shop for a Plan](https://www.wellcare.com/new-to-plan/our-health-plans.html)
2. [Drug Search Tool](https://www.wellcare.com/drug-pharmacy/formulary.html)
3. [Find a Doctor](https://www.wellcare.com/find-doctor.html)
4. [Member Perks](https://www.wellcare.com/member-resources/member-perks.html)
5. [Over-the-Counter Benefits Details](https://www.wellcare.com/member-resources/member-perks/otc-benefit.html)
6. [Telehealth Services](https://www.wellcare.com/member-resources/member-perks/telehealth.html)
7. [Dental Benefits Details](https://www.wellcare.com/member-resources/member-perks/dental.html)
8. [Transportation Benefits Details](https://www.wellcare.com/member-resources/member-perks/transportation.html)
9. [Wellcare Spendables Card Information](https://www.wellcare.com/vbid.html)
10. [Video Library](https://www.wellcare.com/video-library.html)

## Contact Information

1. **Member Services Hours of Operation**:
   - October 1 to March 31: 7 days a week, 8 a.m. to 8 p.m.
   - April 1 to September 30: Monday through Friday, 8 a.m. to 8 p.m.
   - A messaging system is used after hours, weekends, and on federal holidays.
2. **Contact Us**: [Contact Us Page](https://www.wellcare.com/contact-us.html)

## Other Resources

1. [Interoperability and Patient Access Rule Information](https://www.wellcare.com/member-resources/member-rights/interoperability-and-patient-access.html)
2. [Plan Benefit Materials](https://www.wellcare.com/plan-benefit-materials.html)
3. [FAQs](https://www.wellcare.com/faqs.html)
4. [Medicare Extra Help](https://www.wellcare.com/medicare-extra-help.html)

## Important Notices

1. **Wellcare By Allwell is not renewing in 2026**: [Learn about your 2026 coverage options](https://www.wellcare.com/plan-transition.html).

## Company Information

1. **Wellcare By Allwell**: PO Box 10420, Van Nuys, CA 91410.
2. **Centene Corporation**: Wellcare is the Medicare brand for Centene Corporation, an HMO, PPO, PFFS, PDP plan with a Medicare contract and is an approved Part D Sponsor. Enrollment in Wellcare By Allwell depends on contract renewal.

Attachments:

browser_content:
## Overview of Healthy Indiana Plan (HIP)

The Healthy Indiana Plan (HIP) is a health insurance program for qualified adults aged 19 to 64 who meet specific income levels. The plan covers medical costs, including dental, vision, and chiropractic services for members.

### Key Features of HIP

1. **Cost-sharing**: HIP cost-sharing, including copayments and POWER Account contributions, is currently paused.
2. **Plan Options**: Members can be enrolled in one of several HIP plans, including:
   - HIP Plus
   - HIP Basic
   - HIP State Plan
   - HIP Pregnancy/HIP Maternity
3. **Health Plan Selection**: Members can choose a health plan, and if they don't, they will be assigned one. They will stay with that health plan for the calendar year.
4. **POWER Account**: A Personal Wellness and Responsibility (POWER) account is used to pay for the first $2,500 of medical expenses for covered services. Members in HIP Plus or HIP State Plan Plus contribute to their POWER Account.

### Benefits and Services

1. **HIP Plus**: Provides health coverage with no copayments for doctor visits, prescriptions, or hospital emergencies. It includes additional benefits like dental, vision, and chiropractic services.
2. **HIP Basic**: Does not cover dental, vision, or chiropractic services and charges copayments for services received.
3. **Fast Track**: A payment option that allows eligible individuals to expedite their coverage start date by making a $10 payment towards their POWER Account contribution.

### Eligibility and Enrollment

1. **Eligibility**: HIP is available to Hoosiers aged 19 to 64 who meet specific income levels.
2. **Enrollment**: Members can enroll in HIP through an application process. They can make a Fast Track payment to expedite their coverage start date.

### Payment Options

1. **POWER Account Contributions**: Members can make POWER Account contributions online or by calling Member Services.
2. **My Health Pays Rewards**: Members can use their My Health Pays rewards to pay their monthly POWER Account contribution.

### Additional Resources

1. **HIP Terminology Guide**: Available to help members understand HIP terms.
2. **Member Portal**: Members can log in to view claims, obtain an ID card, and more.

### Contact Information

- Members can call 1-877-GET-HIP-9 (1-877-438-4479) for assistance with plan changes or other inquiries.
- Member Services: 1-877-647-4848 for payments and other support.

Attachments:

qa_pairs.question: What is the Healthy Indiana Plan (HIP)?
qa_pairs.answer: The Healthy Indiana Plan (HIP) is a health insurance program for qualified adults aged 19 to 64 who meet specific income levels. It covers medical costs, including dental, vision, and chiropractic services for members.

qa_pairs.question: What are the different HIP plans available?
qa_pairs.answer: Members can be enrolled in one of several HIP plans, including HIP Plus, HIP Basic, HIP State Plan, and HIP Pregnancy/HIP Maternity.

qa_pairs.question: How do I enroll in HIP?
qa_pairs.answer: Members can enroll in HIP through an application process. They can also make a Fast Track payment to expedite their coverage start date by making a $10 payment towards their POWER Account contribution.

qa_pairs.question: What is the POWER Account in HIP?
qa_pairs.answer: A Personal Wellness and Responsibility (POWER) account is used to pay for the first $2,500 of medical expenses for covered services. Members in HIP Plus or HIP State Plan Plus contribute to their POWER Account.

qa_pairs.question: How can I make POWER Account contributions?
qa_pairs.answer: Members can make POWER Account contributions online or by calling Member Services at 1-877-647-4848.

qa_pairs.question: What is HIP Plus?
qa_pairs.answer: HIP Plus provides health coverage with no copayments for doctor visits, prescriptions, or hospital emergencies. It includes additional benefits like dental, vision, and chiropractic services.

qa_pairs.question: What is the difference between HIP Plus and HIP Basic?
qa_pairs.answer: HIP Plus provides health coverage with no copayments for doctor visits, prescriptions, or hospital emergencies and includes dental, vision, and chiropractic services. HIP Basic does not cover dental, vision, or chiropractic services and charges copayments for services received.

qa_pairs.question: How do I choose a health plan in HIP?
qa_pairs.answer: Members can choose a health plan during enrollment. If they don't choose one, they will be assigned a health plan and will stay with that health plan for the calendar year.

qa_pairs.question: Who should I contact for assistance with HIP?
qa_pairs.answer: Members can call 1-877-GET-HIP-9 (1-877-438-4479) for assistance with plan changes or other inquiries. For payments and other support, they can call Member Services at 1-877-647-4848.

qa_pairs.question: Can I use My Health Pays rewards to pay for HIP?
qa_pairs.answer: Yes, members can use their My Health Pays rewards to pay their monthly POWER Account contribution.

qa_pairs.answer: The available payment methods for your POWER Account contribution are: 1) Online through the MHS Member Portal, and 2) By phone using My Health Pays Rewards by calling Member Services at 1-877-647-4848.

results.md:
## Healthy Indiana Plan (HIP) Member Quick Links

### Overview of HIP
The Healthy Indiana Plan (HIP) is a health insurance program for qualified adults aged 19-64. It includes dental, vision, and chiropractic services. Members are rewarded for taking better care of their health.

### HIP Plans
- **HIP Plus**: Provides health coverage with no copays for doctor visits, prescriptions, or hospital emergencies. Includes dental, vision, and chiropractic services. Requires a monthly POWER Account contribution.
- **HIP Basic**: Does not cover dental, vision, or chiropractic services. Charges copayments for services. Available for those with income at or below the federal poverty level who do not make their POWER Account contribution.

### Member Quick Links
1. **Complete a Health Needs Screening**: [Link](/members/hip/health-services/preventive-care/health-needs-screening.html)
2. **Benefits & Services**: [Link](/members/hip/health-services.html)
3. **LOGIN to view claims, get an ID card, & more**: [Link](/login.html)

### POWER Account
- A special savings account for covered medical expenses up to $2,500.
- Members in HIP Plus or HIP State Plan Plus contribute to their POWER Account.
- **[Learn more about the POWER account](/members/hip/support-services/coverage/hip-power-account.html)**

### Fast Track
- A payment option to expedite HIP Plus coverage by making a $10 payment.
- Coverage begins the first of the month after making the Fast Track payment.
- **[Details on making a Fast Track payment](/members/hip/support-services/coverage/power-account-payments.html)**

### Relevant Phone Numbers
- **1-877-GET-HIP-9 (1-877-438-4479)**: To change your health plan or for general inquiries.
- **1-877-647-4848**: Member Services for making a payment with My Health Pays Rewards.

### Other Resources
- **HIP Terminology Guide**: [External Link](http://www.in.gov/fssa/hip/2456.htm)
- **My Health Pays Rewards Program**: [Link](/members/hip/health-services/rewards/healthy-rewards-program.html)
- **POWER Account Payments**: [Link](/members/hip/support-services/coverage/power-account-payments.html)
- **Member Handbook**: Likely available under Member Tools & Education section, though not directly linked in the provided content.

### Instructions
1. To change your health plan, call **1-877-GET-HIP-9** between November 1 and December 15.
2. To make a POWER Account contribution, log into your MHS Member Portal Account or call Member Services.
3. To expedite HIP Plus coverage, make a $10 Fast Track payment online or upon receiving the invoice from your Managed Care Entity.

### Additional Information
- Cost-sharing (copayments and POWER Account contributions) for HIP is currently paused.
- Eligibility redetermination occurs every 12 months.

qa_pairs.question: What is the Healthy Indiana Plan (HIP) and who is it for?
qa_pairs.answer: The Healthy Indiana Plan (HIP) is a health insurance program for qualified adults aged 19-64. It includes dental, vision, and chiropractic services, and members are rewarded for taking better care of their health.

qa_pairs.question: What are the different plans available under HIP?
qa_pairs.answer: There are two main plans under HIP: HIP Plus and HIP Basic. HIP Plus provides health coverage with no copays for doctor visits, prescriptions, or hospital emergencies, and includes dental, vision, and chiropractic services. It requires a monthly POWER Account contribution. HIP Basic does not cover dental, vision, or chiropractic services, charges copayments for services, and is available for those with income at or below the federal poverty level who do not make their POWER Account contribution.

qa_pairs.question: How do I complete a Health Needs Screening?
qa_pairs.answer: You can complete a Health Needs Screening by visiting the link provided in the HIP Member Quick Links section: /members/hip/health-services/preventive-care/health-needs-screening.html

qa_pairs.question: What is the POWER Account and how does it work?
qa_pairs.answer: The POWER Account is a special savings account for covered medical expenses up to $2,500. Members in HIP Plus or HIP State Plan Plus contribute to their POWER Account. You can learn more about the POWER account by visiting: /members/hip/support-services/coverage/hip-power-account.html

qa_pairs.question: How can I expedite my HIP Plus coverage?
qa_pairs.answer: You can expedite your HIP Plus coverage by making a $10 Fast Track payment online or upon receiving the invoice from your Managed Care Entity. Coverage begins the first of the month after making the Fast Track payment. For details, visit: /members/hip/support-services/coverage/power-account-payments.html

qa_pairs.question: Where can I find information about my benefits and services under HIP?
qa_pairs.answer: You can view your benefits and services by visiting the link provided in the HIP Member Quick Links section: /members/hip/health-services.html

qa_pairs.question: How do I contact Member Services for making a payment with My Health Pays Rewards?
qa_pairs.answer: You can contact Member Services for making a payment with My Health Pays Rewards by calling 1-877-647-4848.

qa_pairs.question: When can I change my health plan under HIP?
qa_pairs.answer: You can change your health plan by calling 1-877-GET-HIP-9 between November 1 and December 15.

qa_pairs.question: Why is cost-sharing (copayments and POWER Account contributions) currently paused for HIP?
qa_pairs.answer: The content does not specify why cost-sharing is paused, but it mentions that cost-sharing (copayments and POWER Account contributions) for HIP is currently paused.

qa_pairs.question: How often does eligibility redetermination occur for HIP?
qa_pairs.answer: Eligibility redetermination occurs every 12 months.

## Detailed Information about 'LOGIN to view claims, get an ID card, more'

### Explanation and Purpose
'LOGIN to view claims, get an ID card, more' is a link that allows Healthy Indiana Plan (HIP) members to log in to their account securely. The purpose is to provide members with access to their personal health information, related claims, and other relevant resources.

### Relevant Links
1. [LOGIN to view claims, get an ID card, & more ](/login.html) - Member Portal login page
2. [Payment Options](/members/hip/support-services/coverage/power-account-payments.html) - Information on making payments
3. [My Health Pays rewards information](/members/hip/health-services/rewards/healthy-rewards-program.html) - Details about the rewards program
4. [Complete a Health Needs Screening ](/members/hip/health-services/preventive-care/health-needs-screening.html) - Information on health needs screening
5. [Benefits & Services ](/members/hip/health-services.html) - Overview of benefits and services offered

### Instructions
1. Make a Fast Track payment by credit card when applying online or while the application is being processed.
2. Log in to the MHS Member Portal Account to make a payment.
3. Call Member Services at [1-877-647-4848](Tel:1-877-647-4848) to make a payment with rewards.
4. Call [1-877-GET-HIP-9](tel:1-877-438-4479) to change the health plan for the next Benefit Year.

### Phone Numbers
1. [1-877-GET-HIP-9](tel:1-877-438-4479) - HIP Customer Service
2. [1-877-647-4848](Tel:1-877-647-4848) - Member Services

### Resources
1. [HIP Terminology guide](http://www.in.gov/fssa/hip/2456.htm) - External link to HIP terminology guide
2. [POWER account information](/members/hip/support-services/coverage/hip-power-account.html) - Details about POWER account
3. [My Health Pays rewards information](/members/hip/health-services/rewards/healthy-rewards-program.html) - Information on My Health Pays rewards
4. [Payment Options](/members/hip/support-services/coverage/power-account-payments.html) - Payment options for members

### Key Features and Capabilities
- View claims
- Obtain ID card
- Access other related information through the member portal

### Other Relevant Information
The Healthy Indiana Plan (HIP) is a Medicaid health coverage program for low-income adults in Indiana. The page provides various resources and instructions for members to manage their accounts and access necessary information.

## HIP POWER Account

### Explanation and Purpose
The HIP POWER Account, also known as the Personal Wellness and Responsibility (POWER) account, is a special savings account used to pay for the first $2,500 of medical expenses for covered services. It is a key component of the HIP program, helping members manage their healthcare expenses.

### Key Features and Instructions
1. **POWER Account Contribution**: Members in HIP Plus or HIP State Plan Plus are responsible for paying a portion of the $2,500.
2. **Payment Options**: Members can make payments by logging into their MHS Member Portal Account and clicking on 'Pay Premium.'
3. **Pay with Rewards**: Members can pay their monthly POWER Account contribution with My Health Pays Rewards by calling Member Services at 1-877-647-4848.
4. **Fast Track Payment**: A $10 payment can be made to expedite the start of HIP Plus coverage.

### Relevant Links

## HIP POWER Account

The Healthy Indiana Plan (HIP) program uses a Personal Wellness and Responsibility (POWER) account to pay for the first $2,500 of medical expenses for covered services. Every HIP member has their own POWER Account, with the state paying most of the $2,500 and members in HIP Plus or HIP State Plan Plus responsible for paying a portion.

### Key Points about HIP POWER Account:

1. **Purpose**: The POWER Account is a special savings account used to pay for initial health expenses.
2. **Contribution**: Members in HIP Plus or HIP State Plan Plus contribute to the POWER Account.
3. **Payment Options**: Members can make payments online through the MHS Member Portal Account.
4. **Using Rewards**: Members can use My Health Pays Rewards to pay their monthly POWER Account contribution.
5. **Fast Track Payment**: A $10 payment can be made to expedite the start of HIP Plus coverage.
6. **Contribution Amount**: The monthly POWER Account contribution is based on the member's income and may be more or less than $10.

### More Information

For detailed information about the HIP POWER Account, including how to make payments and the implications of not making a Fast Track payment, members can refer to the [HIP POWER Account page](/members/hip/support-services/coverage/hip-power-account.html).
</result>

browser_content:
## POWER Up to HIP Plus

To 'POWER Up to HIP Plus,' you need to make a POWER account contribution. HIP Plus is a health plan that includes additional benefits like dental, vision, and chiropractic services, with no copayments for doctor visits, prescriptions, or hospital emergencies.

* HIP Plus requires a monthly contribution to the POWER Account to help cover initial health expenses.
* Individuals with income at or below the federal poverty level will default to HIP Basic if they don't make their POWER Account contribution.
* To expedite coverage, eligible individuals can make a $10 'Fast Track' payment.

Key benefits of HIP Plus include:
1. Additional benefits: dental, vision, and chiropractic services
2. No copayments for doctor visits, prescriptions, or hospital emergencies
3. Predictable monthly costs

To enroll in HIP Plus or make a Fast Track payment, you can:
1. Apply online and make a payment by credit card.
2. Call 1-877-GET-HIP-9 for assistance.
3. Make a payment while your application is being processed.

Making a Fast Track payment or POWER account contribution will determine the start date of your HIP Plus coverage.

Attachments:

browser_content:
## HIP Fast Track Details

### What is Fast Track?
Fast Track is a payment option that allows eligible Hoosiers to expedite the start of their coverage in the HIP Plus program. It allows you to make a $10 payment while your application is being processed. The $10 payment goes toward your first POWER account contribution.

### How it Works
- If you make a Fast Track payment and are eligible for HIP, your HIP Plus coverage will begin the first of the month in which you made your Fast Track payment.
- You can make a Fast Track payment by credit card when you apply online or after applying while your application is being processed.
- Payments are made to the Managed Care Entity (MCE) or health plan you select on your application.

### Consequences of Not Making a Fast Track Payment
- If you do not make a Fast Track payment, you may face a delay in the start of your coverage.
- If your income is below the federal poverty level and you don't make a Fast Track payment or POWER account contribution within 60 days, you will default to HIP Basic coverage.
- HIP Basic does not cover dental, vision, or chiropractic services and charges a copayment for each service received.

### Payment Application
- The $10 Fast Track payment will be applied toward your POWER account contribution(s).
- If your POWER account contribution is less than $10, the remaining amount will be applied to future months.
- If your POWER account contribution is more than $10, you will owe the balance for the first coverage month.

### Eligibility
- You are offered the opportunity to make a Fast Track payment before you have been found eligible for HIP.

### Relevant Links and Resources
- The webpage contains links to 'Complete a Health Needs Screening', 'Benefits & Services', 'LOGIN to view claims, get an ID card, & more', 'Learn more about the POWER account', and 'Need help with some of the HIP terms? Try this guide'.
- Contact Information: 1-877-647-4848 (TTY: 1-800-743-3333)

The detailed information about 'HIP Fast Track' has been successfully extracted and analyzed. The structured response covers all aspects found on the page, including its definition, purpose, how it works, consequences of not making a payment, payment application, eligibility, relevant links, and contact information.

semantic_path: https://www.mhsindiana.com/Healthy Indiana Plan (HIP)/What is Fast Track
browser_content:
## What is Fast Track?

Fast Track is a payment option that allows eligible Hoosiers to expedite the start of their coverage in the HIP Plus program. It enables individuals to make a $10 payment while their application is being processed. The $10 payment goes toward their first POWER account contribution. If eligible for HIP, HIP Plus coverage begins the first of the month in which the Fast Track payment is made.

### Key Details:
1. **Purpose**: Expedite the start of HIP Plus coverage.
2. **Payment Amount**: $10.
3. **Application**: Can be made online during application or after applying while the application is being processed.
4. **Effect on Coverage**: If eligible, HIP Plus coverage starts the first day of the month in which the Fast Track payment is made.
5. **Managed Care Entity (MCE)**: The $10 payment is made to the selected MCE/health plan, and the choice cannot be changed after payment.
6. **POWER Account Contribution**: The $10 is applied to the POWER account contribution, which may be more or less than $10 based on income.

### Consequences of Not Making a Fast Track Payment:
- May face a delay in the start of coverage.
- Default to HIP Basic if income is below the federal poverty level and no payment is made within 60 days.
- HIP Basic does not cover dental, vision, or chiropractic services and requires copayments for services.

### Making a Fast Track Payment:
- Online during application by credit card.
- After applying, through an invoice from the selected MCE/health plan.

### Additional Information:
- The monthly POWER Account contribution is based on income and may be more or less than $10.
- If the contribution is less than $10, the remaining amount is applied to future months.
- If the contribution is more than $10, the balance must be paid for the first month's coverage.

Attachments:

topic: What happens if I dont make a Fast Track payment
semantic_path: https://www.mhsindiana.com/Healthy Indiana Plan (HIP)/What happens if I dont make a Fast Track payment
browser_content:
## What happens if I don't make a Fast Track payment

If you don't make a Fast Track payment, you may face a delay in the start of your HIP Plus coverage. For example, if you apply on June 5 and receive a $10 Fast Track invoice on June 12, your HIP Plus coverage could be effective beginning June 1 if you make your $10 payment in June. If you make your Fast Track payment or first POWER account contribution in July, your HIP Plus coverage will begin July 1. If you don't make a Fast Track payment or POWER account contribution within 60 days, you will default to HIP Basic coverage if your income is below the federal poverty level. HIP Basic does not cover dental, vision, or chiropractic services and requires a payment for most health services.

## Relevant Links

1. [Healthy Indiana Plan (HIP)](https://www.mhsindiana.com/members/hip.html) - Main page for HIP information
2. [Member Handbook](https://www.mhsindiana.com/members/handbook.html) - Comprehensive guide for members
3. [Contact Us](https://www.mhsindiana.com/members/contact-us.html) - Contact information for MHS

### External Links:

- Phone Number: 1-877-647-4848 (TTY: 1-800-743-3333)
- Language Assistance: MHS provides information in different languages and formats at no cost to members.
- Member Resources: Includes FAQs, Notice of Privacy Practices, and Terms & Conditions.

qa_pairs.question: How do I avoid a delay in my HIP Plus coverage?
qa_pairs.answer: To avoid a delay in your HIP Plus coverage, make your Fast Track payment or POWER account contribution on time. qa_pairs.question: Why is making a Fast Track payment important?

qa_pairs.question: When will my HIP Plus coverage begin if I make a Fast Track payment?
qa_pairs.answer: If you make your Fast Track payment or first POWER account contribution in the same month you receive the invoice, your HIP Plus coverage will begin on the first day of that month. For example, if you receive an invoice in June and make the payment in June, your coverage will start on June 1.

qa_pairs.question: Where can I find more information about HIP Plus coverage?
qa_pairs.answer: You can find more information about HIP Plus coverage on the Healthy Indiana Plan (HIP) main page at https://www.mhsindiana.com/members/hip.html or in the Member Handbook at https://www.mhsindiana.com/members/handbook.html.

qa_pairs.question: Who should I contact if I have questions about Fast Track payments?
qa_pairs.answer: If you have questions about Fast Track payments, you can contact MHS at 1-877-647-4848 (TTY: 1-800-743-3333) or visit their contact page at https://www.mhsindiana.com/members/contact-us.html.

qa_pairs.question: What is HIP Basic coverage?
qa_pairs.answer: HIP Basic coverage is a default coverage option if you don't make a Fast Track payment or POWER account contribution within 60 days and your income is below the federal poverty level. HIP Basic does not cover dental, vision, or chiropractic services and requires a payment for most health services.

qa_pairs.question: How does HIP Basic coverage differ from HIP Plus coverage?
qa_pairs.answer: HIP Basic coverage differs from HIP Plus coverage in that it does not cover dental, vision, or chiropractic services and requires a payment for most health services. HIP Plus coverage, on the other hand, provides more comprehensive benefits.

qa_pairs.question: What happens if I don't make a POWER account contribution?
qa_pairs.answer: If you don't make a POWER account contribution within 60 days, you will default to HIP Basic coverage if your income is below the federal poverty level, similar to not making a Fast Track payment.

qa_pairs.question: Can I get language assistance for understanding Fast Track payments?
qa_pairs.answer: Yes, MHS provides information in different languages and formats at no cost to members. You can contact them at 1-877-647-4848 (TTY: 1-800-743-3333) for assistance.

topic: How do I make a Fast Track payment
semantic_path: https://www.mhsindiana.com/Healthy Indiana Plan (HIP)/How do I make a Fast Track payment
browser_content:
## How to Make a Fast Track Payment for Healthy Indiana Plan (HIP)

### Introduction
The Healthy Indiana Plan (HIP) offers a Fast Track payment option to help applicants secure coverage. This payment method is crucial for those applying for HIP Plus coverage.

### How to Make a Fast Track Payment
1. **Make a payment by credit card when you apply online**: Select a Managed Care Entity (MCE) or health plan to provide your HIP coverage. If you make a Fast Track payment and are determined to be eligible for HIP, your HIP Plus coverage will begin the first of the month that you submitted your application.
2. **Make a payment while your application is being processed**: You will receive a Fast Track invoice from the Managed Care Entity (MCE) you selected. If you pay the Fast Track invoice and are determined to be eligible for HIP, your HIP Plus coverage will begin the first of the month that your payment was received and processed.

### Additional Payment Methods
- Log in to your MHS Member Portal Account to make a payment.
- Call Member Services at 1-877-647-4848 to make a payment with My Health Pays Rewards.

### Relevant Links
1. https://www-es.mhsindiana.com/members/hip.html (Spanish version of HIP page)
2. /members/hip/login1.html (HIP Login)
3. /members/hip/how-to-enroll.html (How to Enroll in HIP)
4. /members/hip/find-a-provider.html (Find a Provider for HIP)
5. /members/hip/health-services.html (Benefits & Services for HIP)
6. /members/hip/support-services.html (Resources for HIP)
7. /members/hip/health-services/mental-health.html (Behavioral Health for HIP)
8. /members/hip/health-services/pharmacy-services.html (Pharmacy Services for HIP)
9. /members/hip/health-services/pregnancy.html (Pregnancy Services for HIP)
10. /members/hip/health-services/preventive-care.html (Preventive Care for HIP)
11. /members/hip/health-services/rewards.html (Rewards Program for HIP)
12. /members/hip/support-services/coverage.html (Coverage Information for HIP)
13. /members/hip/support-services/coverage/hip-power-account.html (HIP POWER Account Information)
14. /members/hip/support-services/coverage/power-account-payments.html (POWER Account Payments)
15. http://www.in.gov/fssa/hip/2456.htm (HIP Terminology Guide)

### Phone Numbers
1. 1-877-GET-HIP-9 (1-877-438-4479) - To change health plan or for general inquiries
2. 1-877-647-4848 - Member Services for making payments with rewards

### Instructions
1. To change your health plan for the next Benefit Year, call 1-877-GET-HIP-9 between November 1 and December 15.
2. To make a POWER Account contribution, log in to your MHS Member Portal Account and click on 'Pay Premium.'
3. To make a Fast Track payment, use a credit card when applying online or after applying while your application is being processed.
4. To maintain HIP Plus enrollment, make monthly POWER Account contributions based on your income level.

### Additional Information
- The Healthy Indiana Plan (HIP) is a health insurance program for qualified adults aged 19-64 with specific income levels.
- HIP offers different plans, including HIP Plus, HIP Basic, HIP State Plan, and HIP Pregnancy/HIP Maternity, with varying benefits.
- Members can earn rewards through the My Health Pays Rewards program.
- Cost-sharing for HIP was paused, but CHIP and MEDWorks cost-sharing resumed on July 1, 2024.

Attachments:

qa_pairs.question: What is a Fast Track payment for Healthy Indiana Plan (HIP)?
qa_pairs.answer: A Fast Track payment is an option for HIP applicants to secure coverage by making a payment by credit card when applying online or while their application is being processed. This payment method is crucial for those applying for HIP Plus coverage.

qa_pairs.question: How do I make a Fast Track payment for HIP?
qa_pairs.answer: To make a Fast Track payment, you can either make a payment by credit card when you apply online or after applying while your application is being processed. You will receive a Fast Track invoice from the Managed Care Entity (MCE) you selected. You can also log in to your MHS Member Portal Account to make a payment or call Member Services at 1-877-647-4848 to make a payment with My Health Pays Rewards.

qa_pairs.question: When does my HIP Plus coverage begin if I make a Fast Track payment?
qa_pairs.answer: If you make a Fast Track payment and are determined to be eligible for HIP, your HIP Plus coverage will begin the first of the month that you submitted your application or the first of the month that your payment was received and processed.

qa_pairs.question: Why is making a Fast Track payment important for HIP applicants?
qa_pairs.answer: Making a Fast Track payment is crucial for HIP applicants because it helps secure HIP Plus coverage. HIP Plus is a more comprehensive plan compared to other HIP options, offering more benefits.

qa_pairs.question: Where can I find more information about making a Fast Track payment for HIP?
qa_pairs.answer: You can find more information about making a Fast Track payment on the HIP website. Relevant links include https://www-es.mhsindiana.com/members/hip.html (Spanish version of HIP page), /members/hip/login1.html (HIP Login), and /members/hip/how-to-enroll.html (How to Enroll in HIP).

qa_pairs.question: Who should I contact if I have questions about making a Fast Track payment?
qa_pairs.answer: You can contact Member Services at 1-877-647-4848 for assistance with making a Fast Track payment or other inquiries related to your HIP coverage. You can also call 1-877-GET-HIP-9 (1-877-438-4479) for general inquiries or to change your health plan.

qa_pairs.question: Can I make a Fast Track payment after I've already applied for HIP?
qa_pairs.answer: Yes, you can make a Fast Track payment while your application is being processed. You will receive a Fast Track invoice from the Managed Care Entity (MCE) you selected, and you can make the payment according to the instructions provided.

qa_pairs.question: What are the different ways to make a payment for HIP?
qa_pairs.answer: You can make a payment for HIP in several ways: by credit card when applying online, by paying a Fast Track invoice received from the MCE, by logging into your MHS Member Portal Account, or by calling Member Services at 1-877-647-4848 to make a payment with My Health Pays Rewards.

qa_pairs.question: How do I maintain my HIP Plus enrollment after making a Fast Track payment?
qa_pairs.answer: To maintain your HIP Plus enrollment, you need to make monthly POWER Account contributions based on your income level. You can make these contributions by logging into your MHS Member Portal Account and clicking on 'Pay Premium'.

qa_pairs.question: What happens if I don't make a Fast Track payment?
qa_pairs.answer: If you don't make a Fast Track payment, your HIP Plus coverage may not begin as early as it would if you had made the payment. The exact impact depends on your eligibility determination and the processing of your application.

## Comprehensive Information about 'Payments made with the online application'

### Explanation and Purpose
The Healthy Indiana Plan (HIP) allows members to make a Fast Track payment when applying online for Indiana Health Coverage Programs. This payment is made by credit card and requires selecting a Managed Care Entity. If a member makes a Fast Track payment and is determined eligible for HIP, their HIP Plus coverage begins the first of the month they submitted their application.

### Relevant Links
1. [/members/hip.html](/members/hip.html)
2. [/members/hip/how-to-enroll.html](/members/hip/how-to-enroll.html)
3. [/members/hip/health-services.html](/members/hip/health-services.html)
4. [/members/hip/support-services.html](/members/hip/support-services.html)
5. [/members/hip/support-services/coverage/power-account-payments.html](/members/hip/support-services/coverage/power-account-payments.html)
6. [/members/hip/health-services/rewards/healthy-rewards-program.html](/members/hip/health-services/rewards/healthy-rewards-program.html)
7. [http://www.in.gov/fssa/hip/2456.htm](http://www.in.gov/fssa/hip/2456.htm)

### Instructions
1. To change your health plan, call [1-877-GET-HIP-9](tel:1-877-438-4479) between November 1-December 15.
2. To make a POWER Account contribution payment, log into your MHS Member Portal Account.
3. To make a Fast Track payment, use credit card when applying online or while the application is being processed.

### Phone Numbers
1. [1-877-GET-HIP-9](tel:1-877-438-4479) - To change health plan or for general inquiries.
2. [1-877-647-4848](tel:1-877-647-4848) - Member Services to make a payment with rewards.

### People Names
None mentioned.

### Addresses
None mentioned.

### Key Features
1. **HIP Plans**: HIP Plus, HIP Basic, HIP State Plan, and HIP Pregnancy/HIP Maternity.
2. **POWER Account**: A special savings account for medical expenses, with a maximum of $2,500.
3. **Fast Track**: A payment option to expedite HIP Plus coverage by making a $10 payment.
4. **My Health Pays Rewards**: A rewards program for members to earn rewards.
5. **Health Needs Screening**: A required screening for members.
6. **Dental, Vision, Chiropractic Services**: Included in HIP Plus plan.

### Additional Information
The page contains various other resources related to HIP, including member handbooks, FAQs, and language assistance information.

Attachments:

topic: Payments made while your application is being processed
semantic_path: https://www.mhsindiana.com/Healthy Indiana Plan (HIP)/Payments made while your application is being processed
browser_content:
## Comprehensive Information about HIP Payments

### Payments made while your application is being processed
You can make a Fast Track payment by credit card when you apply online or, after applying, while your application is being processed. Fast Track payments are made to the Managed Care Entity (MCE) or health plan you select on your application. If you do not apply online, or choose not to make a Fast Track payment when you apply, you will still have the opportunity to make a Fast Track payment while your application is being processed. You will receive a Fast Track invoice from the Managed Care Entity (MCE) you selected to provide your health coverage. If you pay the Fast Track invoice and are determined to be eligible for HIP, your HIP Plus coverage will begin the first of the month that your payment was received and processed.

### Relevant Links and Resources
- [Healthy Indiana Plan](https://www.mhsindiana.com/members/hip.html): Main page for HIP information.
- [HIP Terminology Guide](link_to_guide): External link to HIP terminology guide.
- [Payment Options](link_to_payment_options): Information on how to make payments.

### Instructions and Contact Information
To make a payment, you can:
1. Make a payment online when applying.
2. Receive a Fast Track invoice from the MCE and make a payment.

For more information, you can call 1-877-GET-HIP-9.

### Key Features and Benefits
- HIP Plus includes additional benefits like dental, vision, and chiropractic services.
- With HIP Plus, there are no copays for doctor visits, prescriptions, or emergency hospital visits.
- HIP Basic and other plans have varying benefits based on the specific plan.

### Additional Information
HIP is a health insurance program for qualified adults in Indiana, offering various plans including HIP Plus, HIP Basic, HIP State Plan, and HIP Pregnancy/HIP Maternity. Members can choose their health plan, which they will stay with for the calendar year. The POWER Account is a special savings account for medical expenses, with the state covering most of the $2,500 and members contributing a portion if they are in HIP Plus or HIP State Plan Plus.

Attachments:

topic: What if my POWER account contribution is not 10
semantic_path: https://www.mhsindiana.com/Healthy Indiana Plan (HIP)/What if my POWER account contribution is not 10
browser_content:
## HIP Information

### What if my POWER account contribution is not 10

If your POWER account contribution is more than $10, then you will owe the balance in the first coverage month. For example, if your POWER account contribution is $15, then your $10 payment will be applied to your first month’s coverage, and you will owe an additional $5 for that month of coverage and $15 for each following month. If your POWER account contribution is less than $10 per month, your $10 payment will be applied to your initial coverage month with the remaining amount applied to future months. For example, if your POWER account contribution is $4, then your first two months of coverage will be paid in full, you will owe a balance of $2 in the third month, and then $4 for every following month to maintain HIP Plus enrollment.

### Relevant Links and Resources

- [Member Handbook](https://www.mhsindiana.com/members/handbook.html)
- [Member FAQs](https://www.mhsindiana.com/members/faq.html)
- [Language Assistance](https://www.mhsindiana.com/members/language-assistance.html)
- [Notice of Privacy Practices](https://www.mhsindiana.com/members/notice-of-privacy-practices.html)

### Key Features and Details

- HIP Plus and HIP Basic plans are available.
- POWER Account contributions are a key component of the HIP program.
- Member resources include contact information for support and additional resources.

### Contact Information

- Phone: 1-877-647-4848
- TTY: 1-800-743-3333

Attachments:

If your POWER account contribution is less than $10 per month, your $10 payment will be applied to your initial coverage month with the remaining amount applied to future months. For example, if your POWER account contribution is $4, then your first two months of coverage will be paid in full, you will owe a balance of $2 in the third month, and then $4 for every following month to maintain HIP Plus enrollment.

### Relevant Links and Resources

- [Member Handbook](https://www.mhsindiana.com/members/handbook.html)
- [Member FAQs](https://www.mhsindiana.com/members/faq.html)
- [Language Assistance](https://www.mhsindiana.com/members/language-assistance.html)
- [Notice of Privacy Practices](https://www.mhsindiana.com/members/notice-of-privacy-practices.html)

### Key Features and Details

- HIP Plus and HIP Basic plans are available.
- POWER Account contributions are a key component of the HIP program.
- Member resources include contact information for support and additional resources.

### Contact Information

- Phone: 1-877-647-4848
- TTY: 1-800-743-3333

The Healthy Indiana Plan (HIP) is a healthcare program for Indiana residents. If you are not eligible for HIP, you can still make a Fast Track payment before being found eligible. topic: Do I have to make a Fast Track payment
semantic_path: https://www.mhsindiana.com/Healthy Indiana Plan (HIP)/Do I have to make a Fast Track payment
browser_content:
## Detailed Information about 'Do I have to make a Fast Track payment'

### 1. Explanation of 'Do I have to make a Fast Track payment' and its Purpose
- **What is Fast Track?**: Fast Track is a payment option that allows eligible Hoosiers to expedite the start of their coverage in the HIP Plus program. It involves making a $10 payment while the application is being processed. This payment goes toward the first POWER account contribution.
- **Purpose**: The purpose of Fast Track is to allow HIP Plus coverage to begin the first of the month in which the Fast Track payment is made, thus expediting the coverage start date.

### 2. Relevant Links and Information
- **Links Mentioned on the Page**:
  - https://www.mhsindiana.com/members/hip.html - Main page for Healthy Indiana Plan (HIP) information.
  - https://www.mhsindiana.com/members/hip.html# - Internal links to various sections on the HIP page.
- **Phone Numbers**:
  - 1-877-GET-HIP-9 (1-877-438-4479) - For help with selecting a health plan.
  - 1-877-647-4848 - For making a payment with My Health Pays Rewards.

### 3. Instructions and Resources
- **How to Make a Fast Track Payment**:
  1. Online during application using a credit card.
  2. After applying, through an invoice from the selected Managed Care Entity (MCE).
- **Managed Care Entities (MCEs)**:
  - Anthem
  - Caresource
  - MDwise
  - MHS
- **Implications of Not Making a Fast Track Payment**:
  - Delay in the start of HIP Plus coverage. Coverage begins the first of the month after the payment is made.
  - Default to HIP Basic if income is below the federal poverty level and no payment is made within 60 days. HIP Basic involves copayments and does not cover dental, vision, or chiropractic services.

### 4. Key Features and Capabilities
- **HIP Plus Benefits**:
  - Includes dental, vision, and chiropractic services.
  - No copayments except for non-emergency use of the emergency room.
- **POWER Account Contribution**:
  - Based on income.
  - The $10 Fast Track payment is applied toward this contribution.

### 5. Other Relevant Information
- **Eligibility and Coverage**:
  - HIP Plus coverage begins the first of the month in which the Fast Track payment is made.
  - If not eligible for HIP, the Fast Track payment is refunded.
- **Payment Consequences**:
  - If the POWER account contribution is less than $10, the remaining amount covers future months.
  - If it's more than $10, the balance is owed for the first month.

### Conclusion
Making a Fast Track payment is not mandatory but expedites HIP Plus coverage. Individuals have 60 days from the initial Fast Track invoice to make a payment to start their HIP Plus coverage. Failure to make a payment within 60 days may result in being defaulted to HIP Basic if income is below the federal poverty level.

Attachments:

## HIP Fast Track Section Details

### What is Fast Track?
Fast Track is a payment option that allows eligible Hoosiers to expedite the start of their coverage in the HIP Plus program. It allows making a $10 payment while the application is being processed. The $10 payment goes toward the first POWER account contribution.

### Key Details:
1. **Coverage Start Date**: If a Fast Track payment is made and the individual is eligible for HIP, HIP Plus coverage begins the first of the month in which the Fast Track payment was made.
2. **Payment Method**: Fast Track payments can be made by credit card when applying online or after applying while the application is being processed.
3. **Managed Care Entity (MCE)**: The payment is made to the selected MCE or health plan (Anthem, Caresource, MDwise, or MHS). The MCE cannot be changed after making the payment.
4. **Consequence of Not Making a Fast Track Payment**: Without a Fast Track payment, there may be a delay in the start of coverage. For instance, applying on June 5 and making a $10 Fast Track payment in June can make HIP Plus coverage effective from June 1. If the payment is made in July, coverage starts July 1.
5. **POWER Account Contribution**: The $10 Fast Track payment is applied toward the POWER account contribution, which is based on income. If the contribution is less than $10, the remaining amount covers future months. If it's more than $10, the balance is owed for the first month.

### How to Make a Fast Track Payment:
- Online during application using a credit card.
- After applying, through an invoice from the selected MCE.

### Implications:
- HIP Plus includes dental, vision, and chiropractic services with no copayments except for non-emergency use of the emergency room.
- Defaulting to HIP Basic occurs if the POWER account contribution is not made within 60 days of the invoice, for individuals with income below the federal poverty level. HIP Basic does not cover additional services like dental, vision, or chiropractic care and involves copayments.

topic: What if I didnt get a Fast Track invoice
semantic_path: https://www.mhsindiana.com/Healthy Indiana Plan (HIP)/What if I didnt get a Fast Track invoice
browser_content:
## What if I didn't get a Fast Track invoice?

If you don't make a Fast Track payment, you may face a delay in the start of your HIP Plus coverage. For example, if you apply on June 5 and receive a $10 Fast Track invoice on June 12, your HIP Plus coverage could be effective beginning June 1 if you make your $10 payment in June. If you make your Fast Track payment or first POWER account contribution in July, your HIP Plus coverage will begin July 1. If you don't make a Fast Track payment or POWER account contribution within 60 days, you will default to HIP Basic coverage if your income is below the federal poverty level. HIP Basic does not cover dental, vision, or chiropractic services and requires a payment for most health services.

### Key Features and Instructions for Healthy Indiana Plan (HIP)

#### Eligibility and Coverage
- HIP is a health insurance program for qualified adults aged 19 to 64 who meet specific income levels.
- The plan covers medical costs and may include dental, vision, and chiropractic services depending on the plan.

#### Types of HIP Plans
1. **HIP Plus**: 
   - Offers better benefits including dental, vision, and chiropractic services.
   - No copayments for doctor visits, prescriptions, or hospital emergencies.
   - Requires a monthly POWER Account contribution based on income.
2. **HIP Basic**:
   - Does not cover dental, vision, or chiropractic services.
   - Charges copayments for services.
   - Default plan for those with income below the federal poverty level if they don't make POWER Account contributions.

#### POWER Account
- A special savings account used to pay the first $2,500 of medical expenses for covered services.
- Contributions are required for HIP Plus members; the amount is based on income.

#### Enrollment and Payment Instructions
1. **Enrollment**:
   - Members can choose a health plan or will be assigned one.
   - Stay with the same health plan through the calendar year.
   - Can change health plans during the annual open enrollment period (November 1 - December 15).

2. **POWER Account Contributions**:
   - Can be made online through the MHS Member Portal.
   - Can use My Health Pays Rewards to pay contributions.
   - Fast Track payment option: A $10 payment can be made to expedite HIP Plus coverage.

3. **Fast Track**:
   - Allows eligible individuals to start HIP Plus coverage sooner.
   - Coverage begins the first of the month after making the $10 Fast Track payment.

#### Benefits and Services
- Preventive care, pregnancy services, pharmacy services, and behavioral health services are covered.
- Rewards program (My Health Pays) for healthy behaviors.

#### Additional Resources
- **Member Handbook**: Provides detailed information about the program.
- **Member Support**: Available through Member Services for questions and assistance.
- Contact Information:
  - Phone: 1-877-647-4848
  - TTY: 1-800-743-3333

Attachments:
