browser_content:
## How to Apply for Healthy Indiana Plan (HIP)

### Clear Explanation and Purpose
The Healthy Indiana Plan (HIP) is a health coverage program for Indiana residents. The purpose of HIP is to provide affordable health insurance to eligible individuals and families.

### Application Methods
1. **Online**: Apply at [HIP.IN.gov](http://www.hip.in.gov/)
2. **By Mail**: Mail your application to the address provided on the HIP website
3. **By Fax**: Fax your application to the number provided on the HIP website
4. **By Phone**: Call 1-877-GET-HIP-9 (1-877-438-4479) to apply over the phone
5. **In-person**: Visit a local FSSA Division of Family Resources (DFR) office. Find your local DFR office at [HIP.IN.gov](http://www.hip.in.gov/)

### Additional Resources
- **Eligibility Check**: Check your eligibility at [HIP.IN.gov](http://www.hip.in.gov/) or call 1-877-GET-HIP-9 (1-877-438-4479)
- **Fast Track Eligibility**: Pay a $10 prepayment within 60 days of applying to potentially advance your benefit start date. If you're found ineligible, the prepayment is fully refunded. If approved, it applies to your initial POWER Account contribution.

### Important Details
- The ongoing monthly POWER Account contribution may differ from the initial Fast Track prepayment.
- Last Updated: 06/03/2025

### Contact Information
- Phone: 1-877-GET-HIP-9 (1-877-438-4479)
- Website: [HIP.IN.gov](http://www.hip.in.gov/)

### Other Relevant Information
- For language assistance or different formats, call 1-877-647-4848 (TTY: 1-800-743-3333)

topic: Before applying for Healthy Indiana Plan
semantic_path: https://www.mhsindiana.com/How to Apply for Healthy Indiana Plan (HIP)/Before applying for Healthy Indiana Plan
browser_content:
## Before applying for Healthy Indiana Plan

### Purpose and Explanation
The Healthy Indiana Plan (HIP) is a healthcare program for Indiana residents. Before applying, individuals can check their eligibility and learn more about the program.

### Relevant Links and Information
- To learn more about HIP or to check eligibility, visit [HIP.IN.gov](http://www.hip.in.gov/) or call 1-877-GET-HIP-9.
- Hoosiers can check their eligibility based on income and family size using the calculator on [HIP.IN.gov](http://www.hip.in.gov/). The calculator will indicate whether to apply through the state or federal marketplace.

### Instructions and Resources
- Applications can be made online at [HIP.IN.gov](http://www.hip.in.gov/), by mail, fax, or phone, or by visiting a local FSSA Division of Family Resources (DFR) office. The local DFR office can be found at [HIP.IN.gov](http://www.hip.in.gov/).
- MHS Customer Service: 1-877-647-4848 (TTY: 1-800-743-3333)

### Fast Track Eligibility
- Hoosiers can participate in Fast Track Eligibility when applying for HIP.
- To participate, a $10 prepayment is required within 60 calendar days of completing the response.
- The prepayment can advance the benefit start date. If determined ineligible, the prepayment will be fully refunded. If approved, it will be applied to the initial POWER Account contribution.
- The ongoing monthly POWER Account contribution may differ from the initial Fast Track prepayment.

### Key Features and Capabilities
- Eligibility check based on income and family size.
- Application process through state or federal marketplace.
- Fast Track Eligibility option with prepayment.

### Additional Information
- Last Updated: 06/03/2025
- Customer support available at 1-877-647-4848 (TTY: 1-800-743-3333)

This information should help understand the process and requirements for applying for the Healthy Indiana Plan.

Attachments:

topic: Emergency Room Know When to Go
semantic_path: https://www.mhsindiana.com/Benefits & Services/Emergency Room Know When to Go
browser_content:
### Emergency Room: Know When to Go

#### Explanation and Purpose
MHS cares about you and your family. You need to go to the emergency room (ER) if you think your life is in danger. For most other health problems, your MHS doctor knows about your health and is the best person to call.

#### Relevant Information
- If you are not sure whether you should go to the ER, please call your MHS doctor or the MHS 24-Hour Nurse Advice line at 1-877-647-4848.
- For more information about when to go to the ER, check out the _Emergency Room: Know When to Go_ flyer on the [Brochures and Guides](https://www.mhsindiana.com/members/hip/support-services/education/brochures-and-guides.html) page.

#### Links
- [Brochures and Guides](https://www.mhsindiana.com/members/hip/support-services/education/brochures-and-guides.html): Contains the 'Emergency Room: Know When to Go' flyer.

#### Phone Numbers
- MHS 24-Hour Nurse Advice line: 1-877-647-4848

#### Key Features and Capabilities
- The page provides clear instructions on when to visit the ER and who to contact for advice.
- It includes a link to further resources on the 'Brochures and Guides' page.

#### Other Relevant Information
- The page also contains information about various health benefits and services offered by MHS, including:
  - Different HIP plans (HIP Plus, HIP Basic, HIP State Plan, HIP Pregnancy/HIP Maternity)
  - Health plan selection and changes
  - Self-referral services
  - Contact information for MHS (phone numbers and TTY)
  - Link to the MHS Member Handbook

#### Additional Resources
- [MHS Member Handbook](https://www.mhsindiana.com/members/hip/support-services/education/member-handbook.html): Available in English and Spanish, contains detailed information about covered services.
- [Self-referrals page](https://www.mhsindiana.com/members/hip/health-services/self-referrals.html): Lists services that do not require a referral from your doctor.
- [HIP Terminology guide](https://www.mhsindiana.com/members/hip/support-services/education/hip-terminology-guide.html): Explains various HIP-related terms.

qa_pairs.question: What is Emergency Room Know When to Go?
qa_pairs.answer: Emergency Room Know When to Go is a resource provided by MHS to help members determine when to visit the emergency room. It provides guidance on when to seek immediate medical attention and who to contact for advice.

qa_pairs.question: When should I go to the emergency room?
qa_pairs.answer: You should go to the emergency room if you think your life is in danger. For other health problems, it's best to call your MHS doctor first.

qa_pairs.question: Who should I contact if I'm unsure about going to the ER?
qa_pairs.answer: If you're unsure whether to go to the ER, you should call your MHS doctor or the MHS 24-Hour Nurse Advice line at 1-877-647-4848.

qa_pairs.question: How do I access the Emergency Room Know When to Go flyer?
qa_pairs.answer: You can find the 'Emergency Room: Know When to Go' flyer on the MHS Brochures and Guides page at https://www.mhsindiana.com/members/hip/support-services/education/brochures-and-guides.html.

qa_pairs.question: What is the phone number for the MHS 24-Hour Nurse Advice line?
qa_pairs.answer: The phone number for the MHS 24-Hour Nurse Advice line is 1-877-647-4848.

qa_pairs.question: Where can I find more information about MHS health plans?
qa_pairs.answer: You can find more information about MHS health plans, including HIP Plus, HIP Basic, HIP State Plan, and HIP Pregnancy/HIP Maternity, in the MHS Member Handbook available at https://www.mhsindiana.com/members/hip/support-services/education/member-handbook.html.

qa_pairs.question: Why is it important to call my MHS doctor for non-life-threatening conditions?
qa_pairs.answer: It's important to call your MHS doctor for non-life-threatening conditions because they know your health history and can provide the best advice for your specific situation.

qa_pairs.question: What other resources are available from MHS?
qa_pairs.answer: MHS provides several other resources, including the Self-referrals page listing services that don't require a doctor's referral (https://www.mhsindiana.com/members/hip/health-services/self-referrals.html) and the HIP Terminology guide explaining various HIP-related terms (https://www.mhsindiana.com/members/hip/support-services/education/hip-terminology-guide.html).

qa_pairs.question: How can I get more information about covered services under my MHS plan?
qa_pairs.answer: You can find detailed information about covered services in the MHS Member Handbook, available at https://www.mhsindiana.com/members/hip/support-services/education/member-handbook.html.

qa_pairs.question: Can I access the Emergency Room Know When to Go information online?
qa_pairs.answer: Yes, you can access the 'Emergency Room: Know When to Go' flyer online on the MHS Brochures and Guides page at https://www.mhsindiana.com/members/hip/support-services/education/brochures-and-guides.html.

topic: Emergency Room Know When to Go
semantic_path: https://www.mhsindiana.com/Benefits and Services/Emergency Room Know When to Go
browser_content:
## Emergency Room Know When to Go

MHS cares about you and your family. You need to go to the emergency room (ER) if you think your life is in danger. For most health problems, your MHS doctor knows about your health and is the best person to call.

If you are not sure whether you should go to the ER, please call your MHS doctor or the MHS 24-Hour Nurse advice line at 1-877 647-4848. For more information about when to go to the ER, check out the _Emergency Room: Know When to Go_ flyer on the [Brochures and Guides](/members/hip/life-support-services/education-services/education/brochures-and-guides.html) page.

### Key Information:
- **Purpose**: Informing patients when to visit the emergency room.
- **Contact Information**: MHS 24-Hour Nurse advice line at 1-877 647-4848.
- **Relevant Link**: [Brochures and Guides](/members/hip/life-support-services/education/brochures-and-guides.html)

### Related Resources:
- MHS Member Handbook: Contains detailed information about covered services, including emergency room visits.
- MHS 24/7 Nurse Advice Line: Available for health-related questions.

### Instructions:
1. Call your MHS doctor for most health problems.

emergency_room_info.md:
## Emergency Room Know When to Go

MHS cares about you and your family. You need to go to the emergency room (ER) if you think your life is in danger. For most health problems, your MHS doctor knows about your health and is the best person to call.

If you are not sure whether you should go to the ER, please call your MHS doctor or the MHS 24-Hour Nurse advice line at 1-877 647-4848. For more information about when to go to the ER, check out the _Emergency Room: Know When to Go_ flyer on the [Brochures and Guides](/members/hip/life-support-services/education/brochures-and-guides.html) page.

qa_pairs.question: What is Emergency Room Know When to Go?
qa_pairs.answer: Emergency Room Know When to Go is a resource provided by MHS to inform patients when to visit the emergency room. It advises patients to go to the ER if they think their life is in danger and to call their MHS doctor or the MHS 24-Hour Nurse advice line for other health problems.

qa_pairs.question: When should I go to the emergency room?
qa_pairs.answer: You should go to the emergency room if you think your life is in danger. For other health problems, you should first call your MHS doctor or the MHS 24-Hour Nurse advice line at 1-877 647-4848.

qa_pairs.question: How do I know if I should go to the ER?
qa_pairs.answer: If you're unsure whether to go to the ER, you should call your MHS doctor or the MHS 24-Hour Nurse advice line at 1-877 647-4848 for guidance.

qa_pairs.question: Who should I contact if I'm unsure about going to the ER?
qa_pairs.answer: You should contact your MHS doctor or the MHS 24-Hour Nurse advice line at 1-877 647-4848 if you're unsure about going to the ER.

qa_pairs.question: Why is it important to call my MHS doctor for most health problems?
qa_pairs.answer: It's important to call your MHS doctor for most health problems because they know about your health and can provide the best advice.

qa_pairs.question: Where can I find more information about when to go to the ER?
qa_pairs.answer: You can find more information about when to go to the ER on the 'Brochures and Guides' page at [this link](/members/hip/life-support-services/education/brochures-and-guides.html), which includes the _Emergency Room: Know When to Go_ flyer.

qa_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the MHS 24-Hour Nurse advice line?
qa_pairs.answer: The MHS 24-Hour Nurse advice line is available for health-related questions and can be contacted at 1-877 647-4848. It's a resource for patients who are unsure about their health issues and need guidance.

qa_pairs.question: Can I directly visit the ER without calling anyone?
qa_pairs.answer: You should visit the ER directly only if you think your life is in danger. For other health issues, it's recommended to first call your MHS doctor or the MHS 24-Hour Nurse advice line.

qa_pairs.question: How do I access the MHS 24-Hour Nurse advice line?
qa_pairs.answer: You can access the MHS 24-Hour Nurse advice line by calling 1-877 647-4848. This service is available for health-related questions and guidance.

qa_pairs.question: Is there any additional resource I can refer to for emergency room information?
qa_pairs.answer: Yes, you can refer to the MHS Member Handbook for detailed information about covered services, including emergency room visits. Additionally, the _Emergency Room: Know When to Go_ flyer on the 'Brochures and Guides' page provides further guidance.

qa_pairs.question: What is Preventive Care?
qa_pairs.answer: Preventive care includes various health services aimed at preventing illnesses and detecting health problems early. Members can find information about preventive care services under the Healthy Indiana Plan (HIP). For more details, visit the [Preventive Care page](/members/hip/health-services/preventive-care.html).

qa_pairs.question: How do I access Preventive Care services?
qa_pairs.answer: Members can access preventive care services as outlined in the HIP benefits. Specific services and instructions are available on the linked pages, including [Benefits Overview](/members/hip/health-services/preventive-care/benefits-overview.html), [Dental Care](/members/hip/health-services/preventive-care/dental-care.html), and others.

qa_pairs.question: Why is Preventive Care important?
qa_pairs.answer: Preventive care is important because it helps prevent illnesses and detect health problems early. This can lead to better health outcomes and potentially reduce healthcare costs in the long run.

qa_pairs.question: When can I receive Preventive Care services?
qa_pairs.answer: The specific timing for receiving preventive care services is not detailed in the provided information. However, members can access these services as outlined in the HIP benefits. qa_pairs.question: Where can I find more information about Preventive Care services?

qa_pairs.answer: For general inquiries about preventive care, members can contact the general inquiries phone number at [1-877-647-4848](tel:1-877-647-4848). For TTY, the number is [1-800-743-3333](tel:1-800-743-3333).

qa_pairs.question: What are the different types of Preventive Care services available?

Pregnancy services are available under HIP plans. Specific details about pregnancy services can be found on the [Pregnancy page](/members/hip/health-services/pregnancy.html). The 'Start Smart for Your Baby' program is available for pregnant members.

qa_pairs.answer: You can contact the MHS 24-Hour Nurse Advice line at 1-877-647-4848.

qa_pairs.question: Why is eligibility redetermination important?
qa_pairs.answer: Eligibility redetermination occurs every 12 months to ensure continued coverage under HIP plans.

qa_pairs.question: Where can I find guidelines on using the emergency room during pregnancy?
qa_pairs.answer: Guidelines on using the emergency room can be found in the 'Emergency Room: Know When to Go' flyer, available under Brochures and Guides (/members/hip/support-services/education/brochures-and-guides.html).

## Comprehensive Information about TTY 1-800-743-3333

### Explanation and Purpose
The TTY number 1-800-743-3333 is a contact number provided by Managed Health Services (MHS) for members who are deaf or hard of hearing. It is used as an alternative to the main phone number, 1-877-647-4848, for individuals who need assistance or have questions about their health services.

### Relevant Information and Resources
- The TTY number is mentioned multiple times on the webpage as a contact number for members who need assistance.
- The main contact number associated with the TTY is 1-877-647-4848.
- Members can call these numbers for help with understanding their services or to inquire about their plan.
- The MHS Member Handbook is available in both English and Spanish and can be obtained by calling the main contact number or through the website.
- Additional resources include the HIP Terminology guide and the Emergency Room: Know When to Go flyer, available on the website.

### Relevant Links and Resources
1. [MHS Member Handbook](http://managedhealthservices.com/members/hip/support-services/education/member-handbook.html)
2. [Self-referral services](http://managedhealthservices.com/members/hip/benefits-services/self-referral.html)
3. [HIP Terminology guide](http://www.in.gov/fssa/hip/2456.htm)
4. [Brochures and Guides, including Emergency Room: Know When to Go flyer](http://managedhealthservices.com/members/hip/support-services/education/brochures-and-guides.html)

### Key Features and Capabilities
- The TTY number ensures that MHS is accessible to everyone, including those with hearing impairments.
- MHS provides information in different languages or formats at no cost to the individual.

### Other Relevant Information
- MHS cares about its members and provides various resources to help them understand and navigate their health services.
- Members can change their health plan during the annual enrollment period by calling 1-877-GET-HIP-9.
- The website requires Adobe Reader to open PDF documents.

By providing the TTY number and other resources, MHS demonstrates its commitment to making healthcare accessible to all members, including those with disabilities.

Attachments:

### MHS Member Handbook Details

#### What is the MHS Member Handbook?
The MHS Member Handbook is a comprehensive guide provided to members of the Healthy Indiana Plan (HIP). It contains detailed information about covered services, self-referral specialist visits, and other member benefits and responsibilities.

#### Purpose
The handbook serves as a reference for members to understand their health benefits, how to access various services, and their responsibilities as members of the HIP program.

#### Availability
- The handbook is available in both English and Spanish.
- Members can obtain a paper copy at no cost.
- Requests are processed within 5 business days.

#### How to Obtain the Handbook
Members can request a paper copy by contacting MHS at:
- Phone: 1-877-647-4848
- TTY: 1-800-743-3333

#### Content
The handbook includes information on:
- Covered services
- Self-referral services
- Emergency room guidelines
- Other member benefits and responsibilities

#### Relevant Links
- [MHS Member Handbook](/members/hip/support-services/education/member-handbook.html): Direct link to the MHS Member Handbook page.
- [Self-Referrals](/members/hip/benefits-services/self-referral.html): Information on self-referral services.
- [Brochures and Guides](/members/hip/support-services/education/brochures-and-guides.html): Additional resources related to health services.
- [HIP Terminology guide](http://www.in.gov/fssa/hip/2456.htm): External link to HIP terminology guide.

#### Related Resources
- Phone numbers:
  - 1-877-GET-HIP-9 (1-877-438-4479)
  - 1-877-647-4848 (TTY: 1-800-743-3333)
- Links:
  - [Self-Referrals](/members/hip/benefits-services/self-referral.html)
  - [Brochures and Guides](/members/hip/support-services/education/brochures-and-guides.html)
  - [HIP Terminology guide](http://www.in.gov/fssa/hip/2456.htm)

This detailed information should provide a comprehensive understanding of the MHS Member Handbook and its significance for HIP members.

qa_pairs.question: When can I access the 'Brochures and Guides' page on the MHS Indiana website?

browser_content:
### Brochures and Guides

The 'Brochures and Guides' page on the MHS website provides various resources and information to members about health programs, insurance understanding, and health topics. It includes multiple sections with links to PDF documents.

#### Purpose and Explanation
The 'Brochures and Guides' section is designed to offer comprehensive information to MHS members about various health programs, understanding health insurance, and important health topics. It serves as a resource hub where members can access detailed guides and brochures.

#### MHS Programs
1. **Member Handbook (PDF)**: Overview of health coverage - [Link](/content/dam/centene/mhsindiana/medicaid/pdfs/HCC-Member-Handbook-2024-508.pdf)
2. **MHS Overview (PDF)**: Information about MHS and its programs - [Link](/content/dam/centene/mhsindiana/medicaid/pdfs/508-Who-Is-MHS-broch.pdf)
3. **Behavioral Health Flyer (PDF)**: Emotional health support - [Link](/content/dam/centene/mhsindiana/medicaid/pdfs/mystrength-Flyer-508.pdf)
4. **Caregiving Collaborations™ (PDF)**: Support for caregivers - [Link](/content/dam/centene/mhsindiana/medicaid/pdfs/508-CaregivingColabortinsFlyer.pdf)

#### Moms and Kids
1. **Doula and Me**: Support for expectant mothers - [Link](/pdfs/doula-and-me.html)
2. **EPSDT Brochure (Ages 0-6) (PDF)**: Recommended vaccines for children aged 0-6 - [Link](/content/dam/centene/mhsindiana/medicaid/pdfs/MHS-EPSDT-0-6-Brochure-508.pdf)
3. **EPSDT Brochure (Ages 7-21) (PDF)**: Recommended vaccines for children aged 7-21 - [Link](/content/dam/centene/mhsindiana/medicaid/pdfs/MHS-EPSDT-7-21-Brochure-508.pdf)

#### Understanding Your Health Insurance
1. **Average Healthcare Costs (PDF)**: Guide to healthcare costs - [Link](/content/dam/centene/mhsindiana/medicaid/pdfs/Average-Cost-per-Visit-Flyer-508.pdf)
2. **Behavioral Health Emergency: Know When to Go (PDF)**: Guidance on handling behavioral health emergencies - [Link](/content/dam/centene/mhsindiana/medicaid/pdfs/Behavioral-Health-ER-flyer-508.pdf)

#### Your Health
1. **Advanced Directives (PDF)**: Information on making healthcare decisions - [Link](/content/dam/centene/mhsindiana/medicaid/pdfs/Advance-Directive-brochure-508.pdf)
2. **Diabetes Oral Health Flyer (PDF)**: Oral health tips for diabetes patients - [Link](/content/dam/centene/mhsindiana/medicaid/pdfs/Diabetes-Oral-Health-Flyer-508.pdf)

### On-Hold Messages
1. **Healthy Kids Club**: Free educational program for kids - [Sign up here](http://cloud.email.mhsindiana.com/kids-club)
2. **Address Update**: Update address with Department of Family Resources at [1-800-403-0864](Tel:1-800-403-0864)

### Contact Information
- Phone: [1-877-647-4848](tel:1-877-647-4848) (TTY: [1-800-743-3333](tel:1-800-743-3333))
- Need information in a different language or format? Call [1-877-647-4848](tel:1-877-647-4848) (TTY: [1-800-743-3333](tel:1-800-743-3333))


Attachments:

browser_content:
# Rights and Responsibilities Summary

## Overview
The 'Rights & Responsibilities' section on the MHS Indiana website provides comprehensive information about the rights and responsibilities of members enrolled in the Healthy Indiana Plan. It includes details on member rights, advance directives, and the process for reporting fraud, waste, and abuse.

## Relevant Links and Information
1. **Rights & Responsibilities Main Page**: [/members/hip/support-services/responsibilities.html](https://www.mhsindiana.com/members/hip/support-services/responsibilities.html)
2. **Member Rights and Responsibilities**: [/members/hip/support-services/responsibilities/member-rights.html](https://www.mhsindiana.com/members/hip/support-services/responsibilities/member-rights.html)
3. **Advance Directive**: [/members/hip/support-services/responsibilities/advance-directive.html](https://www.mhsindiana.com/members/hip/support-services/responsibilities/advance-directive.html)
4. **Reporting Fraud, Waste and Abuse**: [/members/hip/support-services/responsibilities/reducing-fraud.html](https://www.mhsindiana.com/members/hip/support-services/responsibilities/reducing-fraud.html)

## Member Rights
1. Receive information about MHS, its services, practitioners, providers, and your rights and responsibilities.
2. Be treated with respect and dignity.
3. Receive information on available treatment options and alternatives.
4. Participate in decisions regarding your healthcare, including refusing treatment.
5. Be free from restraint or seclusion used as coercion, discipline, convenience, or retaliation.
6. Request and receive a copy of your medical records and request amendments or corrections.
7. Voice complaints, grievances, or appeals about the organization or care provided.
8. Make recommendations about the Member Rights and Responsibilities policy.
9. Have an ongoing source of primary care and a designated person responsible for coordinating your healthcare services.
10. Receive personalized help from MHS staff, especially for special healthcare needs.
11. Have timely access to covered services.
12. Have services available 24 hours a day, seven days a week when medically necessary.
13. Get a second opinion from a qualified healthcare professional at no charge.
14. Direct access to women’s health specialists for routine and preventive care.

## Member Responsibilities
1. Provide information needed by MHS, its practitioners, and other healthcare providers to properly care for you.
2. Follow plans and instructions for care agreed upon with your MHS doctors.
3. Understand your health problems and participate in developing mutually-agreed-upon treatment goals.

## Advance Directive
- A form that lets you write down what kind of care you want.
- The ability to choose someone you trust to speak for you if you are unable to.
- The importance of sharing your Advance Directive with your doctor.

## Reporting Fraud, Waste, and Abuse
Members are encouraged to report suspected fraud, waste, and abuse. The website provides a link to report such activities.

## Contact Information
For more information, members can call MHS at [877-647-4848](tel:877-647-4848) and ask to speak to an MHS Care Manager.

Attachments:

1. **Rights & Responsibilities Main Page**: [/members/hip/support-services/responsibilities.html](https://www.mhsindiana.com/members/hip/support-services/responsibilities.html)
2. **Member Rights and Responsibilities**: [/members/hip/support-services/responsibilities/member-rights.html](https://www.mhsindiana.com/members/hip/support-services/responsibilities/member-rights.html)
3. **Advance Directive**: [/members/hip/support-services/responsibilities/advance-directive.html](https://www.mhsindiana.com/members/hip/support-services/responsibilities/advance-directive.html)
4. **Reporting Fraud, Waste and Abuse**: [/members/hip/support-services/responsibilities/reducing-fraud.html](https://www.mhsindiana.com/members/hip/support-services/responsibilities/reducing-fraud.html)

## Member Rights
1. Receive information about MHS, its services, practitioners, providers, and your rights and responsibilities.
2. Be treated with respect and dignity.
3. Receive information on available treatment options and alternatives.
4. Participate in decisions regarding your healthcare, including refusing treatment.
5. Be free from restraint or seclusion used as coercion, discipline, convenience, or retaliation.
6. Request and receive a copy of your medical records and request amendments or corrections.
7. Voice complaints, grievances, or appeals about the organization or care provided.
8. Make recommendations about the Member Rights and Responsibilities policy.
9. Have an ongoing source of primary care and a designated person responsible for coordinating your healthcare services.
10. Receive personalized help from MHS staff, especially for special healthcare needs.
11. Have timely access to covered services.
12. Have services available 24 hours a day, seven days a week when medically necessary.
13. Get a second opinion from a qualified healthcare professional at no charge.
14. Direct access to women’s health specialists for routine and preventive care.

## Member Responsibilities
1. Provide information needed by MHS, its practitioners, and other healthcare providers to properly care for you.
2. Follow plans and instructions for care agreed upon with your MHS doctors.
3. Understand your health problems and participate in developing mutually-agreed-upon treatment goals.

## Advance Directive
- A form that lets you write down what kind of care you want.
- The ability to choose someone you trust to speak for you if you are unable to.
- The importance of sharing your Advance Directive with your doctor.

## Reporting Fraud, Waste, and Abuse
Members are encouraged to report suspected fraud, waste, and abuse. The website provides a link to report such activities.

## Contact Information
For more information, members can call MHS at [877-647-4848](tel:877-647-4848) and ask to speak to an MHS Care Manager.

qa_pairs.question: What is the Rights and Responsibilities section on the MHS Indiana website?
qa_pairs.answer: The 'Rights & Responsibilities' section on the MHS Indiana website provides comprehensive information about the rights and responsibilities of members enrolled in the Healthy Indiana Plan. It includes details on member rights, advance directives, and the process for reporting fraud, waste, and abuse. You can find more information on the Rights & Responsibilities Main Page: https://www.mhsindiana.com/members/hip/support-services/responsibilities.html

qa_pairs.question: What are my rights as a member of the Healthy Indiana Plan?
qa_pairs.answer: As a member of the Healthy Indiana Plan, your rights include: receiving information about MHS, its services, practitioners, and providers; being treated with respect and dignity; receiving information on available treatment options and alternatives; participating in decisions regarding your healthcare; being free from restraint or seclusion used as coercion; requesting and receiving a copy of your medical records; voicing complaints or grievances; having an ongoing source of primary care; receiving personalized help from MHS staff; having timely access to covered services; having services available 24/7 when medically necessary; getting a second opinion at no charge; and direct access to women's health specialists for routine and preventive care. For more details, visit: https://www.mhsindiana.com/members/hip/support-services/responsibilities/member-rights.html

qa_pairs.question: What are my responsibilities as a member of the Healthy Indiana Plan?
qa_pairs.answer: As a member of the Healthy Indiana Plan, your responsibilities include: providing information needed by MHS and healthcare providers to properly care for you; following plans and instructions for care agreed upon with your MHS doctors; and understanding your health problems and participating in developing mutually-agreed-upon treatment goals. More information can be found on the Member Rights and Responsibilities page: https://www.mhsindiana.com/members/hip/support-services/responsibilities/member-rights.html

qa_pairs.question: How do I create an Advance Directive?
qa_pairs.answer: An Advance Directive is a form that lets you write down what kind of care you want. You can also choose someone you trust to speak for you if you are unable to. It's important to share your Advance Directive with your doctor. For more information on Advance Directives, visit: https://www.mhsindiana.com/members/hip/support-services/responsibilities/advance-directive.html

qa_pairs.question: Why is it important to report fraud, waste, and abuse?
qa_pairs.answer: Reporting fraud, waste, and abuse is important to maintain the integrity of the healthcare system and ensure that resources are used appropriately. Members are encouraged to report suspected fraud, waste, and abuse. The website provides a link to report such activities. For more information, visit: https://www.mhsindiana.com/members/hip/support-services/responsibilities/reducing-fraud.html

qa_pairs.question: When can I access covered services?
qa_pairs.answer: You have the right to have timely access to covered services. Services are available 24 hours a day, seven days a week when medically necessary. For more information on your rights and accessing services, visit: https://www.mhsindiana.com/members/hip/support-services/responsibilities/member-rights.html

qa_pairs.question: Where can I find more information about my rights and responsibilities?
qa_pairs.answer: You can find more information about your rights and responsibilities on the MHS Indiana website. The Rights & Responsibilities Main Page (https://www.mhsindiana.com/members/hip/support-services/responsibilities.html) and the Member Rights and Responsibilities page (https://www.mhsindiana.com/members/hip/support-services/responsibilities/member-rights.html) provide comprehensive details.

qa_pairs.question: Who should I contact if I have questions about my rights and responsibilities?
qa_pairs.answer: For more information or questions about your rights and responsibilities, you can call MHS at 877-647-4848 and ask to speak to an MHS Care Manager.

qa_pairs.question: How do I get a second opinion?
qa_pairs.answer: You have the right to get a second opinion from a qualified healthcare professional at no charge. For more information on how to obtain a second opinion, you can contact MHS by calling 877-647-4848 and asking to speak to an MHS Care Manager.

qa_pairs.question: What should I do if I need help understanding my health problems?
qa_pairs.answer: You have the responsibility to understand your health problems and participate in developing mutually-agreed-upon treatment goals. You can receive personalized help from MHS staff, especially for special healthcare needs. For assistance, contact MHS at 877-647-4848 and ask to speak to an MHS Care Manager.

## Caregiving Collaborations
MHS started the Caregiving Collaborations™ program to support caregivers. The program aims to improve caregivers' quality of life and provide extra support as they help others with personal care, chores, emotional support, medical care, and finances. The program offers useful tools and information to help caregivers care for MHS members while continuing to care for themselves. Caregivers can contact the MHS Care Team at 1-877-647-4848 for more information.

### Key Details:
- **Program Purpose**: Improve caregivers' quality of life and provide support.
- **Contact Information**: 1-877-647-4848 (TTY: 1-800-743-3333)
- **Relevant Links**: None found on the page.
- **Additional Resources**: Useful tools and information for caregivers.

The webpage provides comprehensive information about the 'Caregiving Collaborations' program, including its purpose, contact details, and the support it offers to caregivers.

Attachments:

browser_content:
## MHS Resources for Foster Care

### Purpose and Overview
MHS Resources is dedicated to providing support and services for foster care in Indiana. The page offers various resources, including helpful links, phone numbers, and instructions for foster parents and families.

### Helpful Links
1. [Adult & Child Health](https://adultandchild.org/) - Provides therapeutic foster care training programs, licensing forms, and other foster care resources.
2. [Firefly Children & Family Alliance](https://fireflyin.org/) - Offers information on foster care, older youth services, adoption, child care, home-based services, and training opportunities.
3. [Child Welfare Information Gateway](https://www.childwelfare.gov/fostercaremonth/) - Provides information about National Foster Care Month, partners of the organization, resources, real-life foster care stories, and ways to connect.
4. [Indiana Association of Resources and Child Advocacy (IARCA)](http://www.iarca.org/) - Promotes cooperation among organizations providing services to children and their families.
5. [Indiana Department of Child Services](https://www.in.gov/dcs/foster-and-kinship-care/) - Provides access to information for foster parents, foster children, relative/kinship caregivers, forms, and policies.
6. [Indiana’s Waiting Children](https://www.adoptuskids.org/states/in/browse.aspx) - Features Indiana’s children in foster care waiting for adoption.
7. [Foster Success](https://fostersuccess.org/) - Offers assistance and resources to help youth transitioning out of the foster care system.
8. [The Villages of Indiana](https://www.villageskids.org/) - Provides programs related to Indiana families and children, including information on becoming a foster or adoptive parent.
9. [CBH Training](http://www.centenefostercare.com) - MHS Resource

### Phone Numbers
1. Indiana Child Abuse and Neglect Hotline: 1-800-800-5556
2. Foster Care Helpline: 888-631-9510
3. MHS Dedicated Foster Care Team: 1-877-647-4848 (ask for Foster Care Team)

### Need Help Right Now?
1. Dial **2-1-1** for free, confidential services available 24/7/365. Connects to food, shelter, housing assistance, employment services, counseling resources, and safety from crises and emergencies.
2. Text **MHS** to **741741** for free, anonymous support available 24/7.

### Additional Information
For information in a different language or format, call 1-877-647-4848 (TTY: 1-800-743-3333).

Attachments:

browser_content:
## MHS Resources Information

### Definition and Purpose
'MHS Resources' refers to the resources provided by Managed Health Services (MHS) to support individuals struggling with opioid use disorder and substance abuse. The purpose is to provide access to information, treatment options, and support services.

### Relevant Links
1. [Indiana 211](https://www.in211.org/need-help-call-2-1-1-or-search-our-database/) - Connects Hoosiers to substance abuse resources.
2. [Indiana Commission to Combat Substance Use Disorder](https://www.in.gov/recovery/) - Provides resources on prevention, education, and treatment options.
3. [Krames Health Library](https://mhsindiana.kramesonline.com/) - Offers evidence-based information on health topics, including opioid use.

### MHS Resources
1. [Fresh Start for You (PDF)](/content/dam/centene/mhsindiana/medicaid/pdfs/508-Medicaid-Substance-Abuse.pdf) - Information on Behavioral Health programs and My Health Pays rewards.
2. [Indiana's Opioid Epidemic (PDF)](/content/dam/centene/mhsindiana/medicaid/pdfs/Opioid-Use-flyer-508.pdf) - Details on MHS programs for substance use.
3. Health sheets on opioid use:
   - [Forming an Opioid Treatment Plan](https://mhsindiana.kramesonline.com/3,S,90891)
   - [Taking Opioid Medicines](https://mhsindiana.kramesonline.com/3,S,90892)
   - [Understanding Opioid Medicines for Pain Management](https://mhsindiana.kramesonline.com/3,S,90890)
   - [Understanding the Risks and Side Effects of Opioid Medicines (PDF)](/content/dam/centene/mhsindiana/medicaid/pdfs/Recovery-Is-Possible-flyer-508.pdf)
4. [Recovery is Possible (PDF)](/content/dam/centene/mhsindiana/medicaid/pdfs/Recovery-Is-Possible-flyer-508.pdf) - Treatment options for substance use disorder.
5. [Stay Safe When Using Pain Medication (PDF)](/content/dam/centene/mhsindiana/medicaid/pdfs/Opioid-MemberFlyer-508.pdf) - Guidance on safe use of opioid medications.

### Instructions and Phone Numbers
1. To contact a MHS Care Manager, call **1-877-647-4848** and ask for Care Management.
2. For immediate support, text **MHS** to **741741** (free, anonymous, and available 24/7).
3. For nurse advice when a doctor's office is closed, call **1-877-647-4848** (TTY **1-800-743-3333**) and select 'nurse'.

### Other Important Details
- MHS provides information at no cost in different languages and formats. Call **1-877-647-4848** (TTY: **1-800-743-3333**).
- PDFs on the site require Adobe Reader, available for free at [Adobe Reader](https://get.adobe.com/reader/).

Attachments:

need_help_right_now_info.md:
## Need Help Right Now?

* Dial **2-1-1** for free, confidential services any time, any day of the week. Connect to food, shelter, housing assistance, employment services, counseling resources, and safety from crises and emergencies. Available 24/7/365.
* If you are struggling & need support, text **MHS** to **741741**. It’s free, anonymous & available 24/7. You are not alone. Learn more on the [Crisis Text Line page](https://www.mhsindiana.com/members/care-connect/foster-care-resources.html).


relevant_links_and_resources.md:

1. [Crisis Text Line page](https://www.mhsindiana.com/members/care-connect/foster-care-resources.html) - Learn more about the crisis text line services.
2. Indiana Child Abuse and Neglect Hotline: [1-800-800-5556](tel:1-800-800-5556)
3. Foster Care Helpline: [888-631-9510](tel:888-631-9510)
4. MHS Dedicated Foster Care Team: [1-877-647-4848](tel:1-877-647-4848) - ask for Foster Care Team
5. Language Assistance: Call [1-877-647-4848](tel:1-877-647-4848) (TTY: [1-800-743-3333](tel:1-800-743-3333)) for information in different languages or formats at no cost.

qa_pairs.question: How do I contact Need Help Right Now?
qa_pairs.answer: You can contact Need Help Right Now by dialing **2-1-1** for free, confidential services any time. Alternatively, you can text **MHS** to **741741** for support. Both services are available 24/7.

- Link: https://www.in.gov/dcs/foster-and-kinship-care/
- Description: Provides access to information for foster parents, foster children, relative/kinship caregivers, forms, and policies.

### Other Relevant Links
- Adult & Child Health: Provides therapeutic foster care training programs, licensing forms and information, and other foster care resources.
- Firefly Children & Family Alliance: For information on foster care, older youth services, adoption, child care and home-based services, and training opportunities.
- Child Welfare Information Gateway: For information about National Foster Care Month, partners of the organization, resources, real life foster care stories, and ways to connect.
- Indiana Association of Resources and Child Advocacy (IARCA): Promotes cooperation among organizations providing services to children and their families.
- Indiana’s Waiting Children: Meet Indiana’s children in foster care waiting for adoption.
- Foster Success: Offers assistance and resources designed to successfully help youth transitioning out of the foster care system.
- The Villages of Indiana: Offers a number of programs related to Indiana families and children. Find information on becoming a foster or adoptive parent, including info sessions and foster parent training opportunities.

### Phone Numbers
- Indiana Child Abuse and Neglect Hotline: 1-800-800-5556
- Foster Care Helpline: 888-631-9510
- MHS Dedicated Foster Care Team: 1-877-647-4848 (ask for Foster Care Team)
- Need Help Right Now? Dial 2-1-1 for free, confidential services any time, any day of the week. Connect to food, shelter, housing assistance, employment services, counseling resources, and safety from crises and emergencies. Available 24/7/365.
- If you are struggling & need support, text MHS to 741741. Learn more on the Crisis Text Line page.

qa_pairs.question: What kind of programs does The Villages of Indiana offer?
qa_pairs.answer: The Villages of Indiana offers programs related to Indiana families and children, including information on becoming a foster or adoptive parent, info sessions, and foster parent training opportunities.

qa_pairs.question: How can I get help right now if I'm struggling?
qa_pairs.answer: If you're struggling, you can dial 2-1-1 for free, confidential services, or text 'MHS' to 741741 for free, anonymous support.

qa_pairs.answer: Other resources available for foster care in Indiana include Adult & Child Health, Firefly Children & Family Alliance, Child Welfare Information Gateway, Indiana Association of Resources and Child Advocacy (IARCA), Indiana Department of Child Services, Indiana’s Waiting Children, and Foster Success, with their respective websites providing more information.

qa_pairs.question: Can I find information on foster care training opportunities through The Villages of Indiana?
qa_pairs.answer: Yes, The Villages of Indiana provides information on foster parent training opportunities through their website at https://www.villageskids.org/.

browser_content:
## Comprehensive Information about '1 800 800 5556'

### What is '1 800 800 5556'?
The phone number '1-800-800-5556' is the Indiana Child Abuse and Neglect Hotline.

### Purpose
The purpose of this hotline is to report child abuse and neglect.

### Related Links
- [Adult & Child Health](https://adultandchild.org/): Provides therapeutic foster care training programs, licensing forms and information, and other foster care resources.
- [Firefly Children & Family Alliance](https://fireflyin.org/): Information on foster care, older youth services, adoption, child care and home-based services, and training opportunities.
- [Child Welfare Information Gateway](https://www.childwelfare.gov/fostercaremonth/): Information about National Foster Care Month, partners of the organization, resources, real life foster care stories, and ways to connect.
- [Indiana Association of Resources and Child Advocacy (IARCA)](http://www.iarca.org/): Promotes cooperation among organizations providing services to children and their families.
- [Indiana Department of Child Services](https://www.in.gov/dcs/foster-and-kinship-care/): Provides access to information for foster parents, foster children, relative/kinship caregivers, forms, and policies.
- [Indiana’s Waiting Children](https://www.adoptuskids.org/states/in/browse.aspx): Meet Indiana’s children in foster care waiting for adoption.
- [Foster Success](https://fostersuccess.org/): Offers assistance and resources designed to successfully help youth transitioning out of the foster care system.
- [The Villages of Indiana](https://www.villageskids.org/): Offers programs related to Indiana families and children. Information on becoming a foster or adoptive parent, including info sessions and foster parent training opportunities.

### Other Relevant Phone Numbers
- Foster Care Helpline: 888-631-9510
- MHS Dedicated Foster Care Team: 1-877-647-4848

### Additional Resources
- Dial 2-1-1 for free, confidential services.
- Text 'MHS' to 741741 for support.

### Key Features/Capabilities
The Indiana Child Abuse and Neglect Hotline provides a crucial service for reporting child abuse and neglect, ensuring the safety and well-being of children in Indiana.

### Important Details
The hotline is available for anyone to report suspected child abuse or neglect. It is part of a broader network of foster care resources and services provided by various organizations in Indiana.

Attachments:

browser_content:
## Comprehensive Information about Crisis Text Line Page

### What is Crisis Text Line?
Crisis Text Line is a service that provides free, confidential, and 24/7 support via text messaging for individuals experiencing a crisis.

### Purpose
The purpose of Crisis Text Line is to offer immediate support and resources to individuals struggling with various issues, including substance use, relationships, bullying, depression, anxiety, and other crisis-related topics.

### Key Features and Capabilities
- **Free**: The service is free of charge.
- **Confidential**: All conversations are confidential.
- **Available 24/7**: Support is available 24 hours a day, 7 days a week.
- **Trained Crisis Counselors**: Counselors are trained to handle a wide range of crisis situations.

### Relevant Information
- **Text Number**: Text 'MHS' to 741741 to access the service.
- **Language Assistance**: Information is available in different languages or formats upon request. Call 1-877-647-4848 (TTY: 1-800-743-3333) for assistance.
- **Last Updated**: The Crisis Text Line page was last updated on 08/22/2022.

### Issues Counselors Can Help With
1. Substance use issues
2. Relationships with friends or family
3. Bullying and isolation
4. Depression
5. Anxiety and stress
6. Any other topic causing a crisis in your life

### Related Resources and Links
- **Spanish Version**: [https://www-es.mhsindiana.com/campaign/crisis-text-line.html](https://www-es.mhsindiana.com/campaign/crisis-text-line.html)
- **Adobe Reader Download**: [https://get.adobe.com/reader/](https://get.adobe.com/reader/) (required to open PDFs on the site)
- **Social Media Links**:
  - Facebook: [https://www.facebook.com/ManagedHealthServices](https://www.facebook.com/ManagedHealthServices)
  - YouTube: [http://www.youtube.com/user/MHSIndiana](http://www.youtube.com/user/MHSIndiana)
  - LinkedIn: [https://www.linkedin.com/company/managed-health-services/mycompany/](https://www.linkedin.com/company/managed-health-services/mycompany/)

### Contact Information
- **Phone**: 1-877-647-4848
- **TTY**: 1-800-743-3333

- **Language Assistance**: Information is available in different languages or formats upon request. Call 1-877-647-4848 (TTY: 1-800-743-3333) for assistance.
- **Last Updated**: The Crisis Text Line page was last updated on 08/22/2022.

### Issues Counselors Can Help With
1. Substance use issues
2. Relationships with friends or family
3. Bullying and isolation
4. Depression
5. Anxiety and stress
6. Any other topic causing a crisis in your life

### Related Resources and Links

qa_pairs.question: What is Crisis Text Line?
qa_pairs.answer: Crisis Text Line is a service that provides free, confidential, and 24/7 support via text messaging for individuals experiencing a crisis.

qa_pairs.question: How do I access Crisis Text Line?
qa_pairs.answer: To access Crisis Text Line, text 'MHS' to 741741. This service is available 24/7 and is free of charge.

qa_pairs.question: What kind of issues can Crisis Text Line counselors help with?
qa_pairs.answer: Crisis Text Line counselors can help with a variety of issues including substance use, relationships with friends or family, bullying and isolation, depression, anxiety and stress, and any other topic causing a crisis in your life.

qa_pairs.question: Is Crisis Text Line available in languages other than English?
qa_pairs.answer: Yes, information is available in different languages or formats upon request. You can call 1-877-647-4848 (TTY: 1-800-743-3333) for language assistance.

qa_pairs.question: When is Crisis Text Line available?
qa_pairs.answer: Crisis Text Line is available 24 hours a day, 7 days a week.

qa_pairs.question: Where can I find more information about Crisis Text Line?
qa_pairs.answer: You can find more information about Crisis Text Line on their webpage at https://www.mhsindiana.com/campaign/crisis-text-line.html. There's also a Spanish version available at https://www-es.mhsindiana.com/campaign/crisis-text-line.html.

qa_pairs.question: Who should I contact if I need help with Crisis Text Line?
qa_pairs.answer: If you need help or have questions about Crisis Text Line, you can contact them by phone at 1-877-647-4848 or via TTY at 1-800-743-3333.

qa_pairs.question: Why should I use Crisis Text Line?
qa_pairs.answer: You should use Crisis Text Line because it offers immediate, free, and confidential support via text messaging for individuals experiencing a crisis, staffed by trained crisis counselors.

qa_pairs.question: Can I remain anonymous when using Crisis Text Line?
qa_pairs.answer: Yes, Crisis Text Line allows for anonymous support. You can text 'MHS' to 741741 for free and confidential help.

qa_pairs.question: How recent is the information on the Crisis Text Line page?
qa_pairs.answer: The Crisis Text Line page was last updated on 08/22/2022, ensuring that the information is relatively current.

browser_content:
## Comprehensive Information about Contact a MHS Care Manager

To contact a MHS Care Manager, call 1-877-647-4848 and ask for Care Management.

Additional Resources:
1. Indiana 211 - Connects Hoosiers to substance abuse resources by dialing 2-1-1 on your landline or cellular phone
2. Indiana Commission to Combat Substance Use Disorder - Provides access to resources on prevention, education, treatment options, and how parents can protect their kids
3. Crisis Text Line - Text 'MHS' to 741741 for free, anonymous, 24/7 support
4. 24-Hour Nurse Advice Line - Call 1-877-647-4848 (TTY: 1-800-743-3333) and select 'nurse' for health concerns

Key Details:
- Phone Number: 1-877-647-4848
- Ask for Care Management
- Additional resources available on the MHS website for opioid use and support

The 'Contact a MHS Care Manager' service is designed to provide personalized support and services to individuals struggling with opioid use. By calling the provided phone number and asking for Care Management, individuals can access guidance and resources to help manage their condition.

Attachments:

mhs_care_manager_info.md:
## Comprehensive Information about Contact a MHS Care Manager

To contact a MHS Care Manager, call 1-877-647-4848 and ask for Care Management.

Additional Resources:
1. Indiana 211 - Connects Hoosiers to substance abuse resources by dialing 2-1-1 on your landline or cellular phone.
2. Indiana Commission to Combat Substance Use Disorder - Provides access to resources on prevention, education, treatment options, and how parents can protect their kids.
3. Fresh Start for You (PDF) - Learn more about the Behavioral Health program and earning My Health Pays rewards.
4. Indiana's Opioid Epidemic (PDF) - MHS programs to help with substance use.
5. Krames Health Library - Extensive library of evidence-based, peer-reviewed information written specifically for patients.
6. Crisis Text Line - Text 'MHS' to 741741 for free, anonymous, 24/7 support.
7. 24-Hour Nurse Advice Line - Call 1-877-647-4848 (TTY: 1-800-743-3333) and select 'nurse' for health concerns.

qa_pairs.answer: Besides Contact a MHS Care Manager, additional resources include: Indiana 211 (dial 2-1-1), Indiana Commission to Combat Substance Use Disorder, Crisis Text Line (text 'MHS' to 741741), and 24-Hour Nurse Advice Line (call 1-877-647-4848 and select 'nurse'). You can also access the Krames Health Library for evidence-based information.

qa_pairs.question: How can I get support for opioid use?
qa_pairs.answer: You can get support for opioid use by contacting a MHS Care Manager at 1-877-647-4848, using the Crisis Text Line by texting 'MHS' to 741741, or accessing resources through Indiana 211 and the Indiana Commission to Combat Substance Use Disorder.

qa_pairs.question: Can I get anonymous support through Contact a MHS Care Manager?
qa_pairs.answer: While the primary contact method for MHS Care Manager is not anonymous, you can access anonymous support through the Crisis Text Line by texting 'MHS' to 741741. This service is available 24/7.

qa_pairs.question: What is the phone number for Contact a MHS Care Manager?
qa_pairs.answer: The phone number for Contact a MHS Care Manager is 1-877-647-4848. You need to ask for Care Management when you call.

## Comprehensive Information for 'In Crisis Need To Talk Right Now'

### What is 'In Crisis Need To Talk Right Now'?
'In Crisis Need To Talk Right Now' is a resource for individuals struggling with substance use disorder who need immediate support. It provides access to crisis text lines, phone numbers for care managers, and nurse advice lines.

### Relevant Links:
1. [Indiana 211](https://www.in211.org/need-help-call-2-1-1-or-search-our-database/) - Connects Hoosiers to substance abuse resources.
2. [Indiana Commission to Combat Substance Use Disorder](https://www.in.gov/recovery/) - Provides resources on prevention, education, and treatment options.
3. [Krames Health Library](https://mhsindiana.kramesonline.com/) - Extensive library of evidence-based information on health topics, including opioid use.
4. [Crisis Text Line page](/campaign/crisis-text-line.html) - Information on crisis text line services.
5. [24-Hour Nurse Advice Line (PDF)](/content/dam/centene/mhsindiana/medicaid/pdfs/508-NurseLnBrch.pdf) - Details on nurse advice line services.

### Phone Numbers:
1. **1-877-647-4848** - For speaking with a MHS Care Manager or using the nurse advice line.
2. **1-800-743-3333** (TTY) - For individuals who are deaf or hard of hearing.

### Instructions:
1. **Text 'MHS' to 741741** - For immediate support regarding substance use. This service is free, anonymous, and available 24/7.
2. **Call 1-877-647-4848 and select 'nurse'** - For questions about health concerns, including proper dosage of medications, when your doctor's office is closed.
3. **Dial 2-1-1** - To connect with substance abuse resources in your area through Indiana 211.

### Key Features and Capabilities:
- Crisis text line available 24/7
- Support from MHS Care Managers
- Nurse advice line for health concerns
- Resources for substance abuse treatment

### Additional Resources:
- [Fresh Start for You (PDF)](/content/dam/centene/mhsindiana/medicaid/pdfs/508-Medicaid-Substance-Abuse.pdf) - Information on Behavioral Health programs and My Health Pays rewards.
- [Indiana's Opioid Epidemic (PDF)](/content/dam/centene/mhsindiana/medicaid/pdfs/Opioid-Use-flyer-508.pdf) - Overview of MHS programs to help with substance use.
- [Recovery is Possible (PDF)](/content/dam/centene/mhsindiana/medicaid/pdfs/Recovery-Is-Possible-flyer-508.pdf) - Treatment options for substance use disorder.
- [Stay Safe When Using Pain Medication (PDF)](/content/dam/centene/mhsindiana/medicaid/pdfs/Opioid-MemberFlyer-508.pdf) - Guidelines for safe use of opioid medications.

These resources are designed to provide support and information for individuals struggling with substance use and those in crisis.

Attachments:

## Indiana Commission to Combat Substance Use Disorder Website

### Purpose
The Indiana Commission to Combat Substance Use Disorder Website provides access to resources on prevention, education, treatment options, and how parents can protect their kids. It also has a geolocation feature to find treatment services in real-time.

### Relevant Links
* [Indiana Commission to Combat Substance Use Disorder Website](https://www.in.gov/recovery/)
* [Indiana 211](https://www.in211.org/need-help-call-2-1-1-or-search-our-database/)
* [Krames Health Library](https://mhsindiana.kramesonline.com/)

### Instructions and Resources
* Dial 2-1-1 on your landline or cellular phone to connect with substance abuse resources.
* Use the geolocation feature on the Indiana Commission to Combat Substance Use Disorder website to find treatment services.
* Access PDF resources such as 'Fresh Start for You', 'Indiana's Opioid Epidemic', 'Recovery is Possible', and 'Stay Safe When Using Pain Medication'.

### Phone Numbers
* 1-877-647-4848 (Care Management and Nurse Advice Line)
* 1-800-743-3333 (TTY)

### Other Related Resources
* Crisis Text Line: Text 'MHS' to 741741 (free, anonymous, and available 24/7)
* [Forming an Opioid Treatment Plan](https://mhsindiana.kramesonline.com/3,S,90891)
* [Taking Opioid Medicines](https://mhsindiana.kramesonline.com/3,S,90892)
* [Understanding Opioid Medicines for Pain Management](https://mhsindiana.kramesonline.com/3,S,90890)

Attachments:

## Indiana Commission to Combat Substance Use Disorder External Link

The Indiana Commission to Combat Substance Use Disorder is a resource for information on prevention, education, treatment options, and how parents can protect their kids. The commission's website provides access to various resources and a geolocation feature to find treatment services available in real-time.

### Purpose
The Indiana Commission to Combat Substance Use Disorder aims to combat substance use disorder through various initiatives and resources.

### Relevant Links
- [Indiana Commission to Combat Substance Use Disorder Website](https://www.in.gov/recovery/): Provides access to resources on prevention, education, treatment options, and how parents can protect their kids. The geolocation feature can tell you what treatment services are available in real-time.

### Instructions
1. Visit the [Indiana Commission to Combat Substance Use Disorder Website](https://www.in.gov/recovery/) to access resources on prevention, education, and treatment options.
2. Use the geolocation feature on the website to find available treatment services in your area.

### Related Resources
- [Indiana 211](https://www.indiana211.org/): Connects Hoosiers to substance abuse resources by dialing 2-1-1 on your landline or cellular phone.
- [Fresh Start for You (PDF)](https://www.mhsindiana.com/...): Learn more about the Behavioral Health program and earning My Health Pays rewards.
- [Indiana's Opioid Epidemic (PDF)](https://www.mhsindiana.com/...): MHS programs to help with substance use.
- [Krames Health Library](https://www.mhsindiana.com/...): Extensive library of evidence-based, peer-reviewed information written specifically for patients.
- [Forming an Opioid Treatment Plan](https://www.mhsindiana.com/...): How to form a treatment plan when prescribed opioids for your pain.
- [Taking Opioid Medicines](https://www.mhsindiana.com/...): How to use, store and dispose of opioids safely.
- [Understanding Opioid Medicines for Pain Management](https://www.mhsindiana.com/...): Learn how opioids work to treat your pain.
- [Understanding the Risks and Side Effects of Opioid Medicines](https://www.mhsindiana.com/...): Understand the signs and symptoms of an opioid overdose and what to do if it occurs.
- [Recovery is Possible (PDF)](https://www.mhsindiana.com/...): Treatment options for substance use disorder.
- [Stay Safe When Using Pain Medication (PDF)](https://www.mhsindiana.com/...): Safety tips for opioid medications.

### Contact Information
- For personalized support and services, contact a MHS Care Manager at 1-877-647-4848.
- In crisis, text 'MHS' to 741741 for free, anonymous support available 24/7.
- For health concerns, call the nurse advice line at 1-877-647-4848 (TTY: 1-800-743-3333).


Attachments:

## Indiana's Opioid Epidemic (PDF) details, links, instructions, and related resources

### Details on Indiana's Opioid Epidemic (PDF)
* The document is available at: https://mhsindiana.com/content/dam/centene/mhsindiana/medicaid/pdfs/Opioid-Use-flyer-508.pdf
* It discusses MHS programs to help with substance use.

### Related Resources
1. **Fresh Start for You (PDF)**: Available at https://mhsindiana.com/content/dam/centene/mhsindiana/medicaid/pdfs/508-Medicaid-Substance-Abuse.pdf. It provides information on the Behavioral Health program and earning My Health Pays rewards.
2. **Recovery is Possible (PDF)**: Available at https://mhsindiana.com/content/dam/centene/mhsindiana/medicaid/pdfs/Recovery-Is-Possible-flyer-508.pdf. It discusses treatment options for substance use disorder.
3. **Stay Safe When Using Pain Medication (PDF)**: Available at https://mhsindiana.com/content/dam/centene/mhsindiana/medicaid/pdfs/Opioid-MemberFlyer-508.pdf. It provides guidance on safely using opioid medications.

### Helpful Links
1. **Indiana 211**: Available at https://www.in211.org/need-help-call-2-1-1-or-search-our-database/. It connects Hoosiers to substance abuse resources by dialing 2-1-1.
2. **Indiana Commission to Combat Substance Use Disorder**: Available at https://www.in.gov/recovery/. It provides resources on prevention, education, treatment options, and how parents can protect their kids.
3. **Krames Health Library**: Available at https://mhsindiana.kramesonline.com/. It offers evidence-based information on various health topics, including opioid use.

1. To contact a MHS Care Manager, call 1-877-647-4848 and ask for Care Management.

1. **Forming an Opioid Treatment Plan**: https://mhsindiana.kramesonline.com/3,S,90891 - How to form a treatment plan when prescribed opioids for your pain.
2. **Taking Opioid Medicines**: https://mhsindiana.kramesonline.com/3,S,90892 - How to use, store, and dispose of opioids safely.
3. **Understanding Opioid Medicines for Pain Management**: https://mhsindiana.kramesonline.com/3,S,90890 - Learn how opioids work to treat your pain.
4. **Understanding the Risks and Side Effects of Opioid Medicines** - Understand the signs and symptoms of an opioid overdose and what to do if it occurs.
5. **Indiana Commission to Combat Substance Use Disorder Website**: https://www.in.gov/commission/substance-use-disorder/ - Provides access to resources on prevention, education, treatment options, and how parents can protect their kids.
6. **Indiana 211**: https://www.in211.org/ - Connects Hoosiers to substance abuse resources by dialing 2-1-1 on your landline or cellular phone.

### Instructions and Contact Information:
1. **Care Management Contact**: Call 1-877-647-4848 and ask for Care Management.
2. **Crisis Support**: Text 'MHS' to 741741 for free, anonymous, and 24/7 support.
3. **Nurse Advice Line**: Call 1-877-647-4848 (TTY: 1-800-743-3333) and select 'nurse' for health concerns.

### Key Features and Capabilities:
- The Krames Health Library provides extensive, evidence-based information on opioid use.
- Various PDF resources are available for download, including 'Fresh Start for You', 'Indiana's Opioid Epidemic', 'Recovery is Possible', and 'Stay Safe When Using Pain Medication'.

### Additional Relevant Information:
- Opioid use disorder is recognized as a disease, and treatment is available.
- Recovery is emphasized as possible.
- The webpage is part of the MHS (Managed Health Services) resources for members.

This detailed information should help in understanding 'Forming an Opioid Treatment Plan External Link' and its related resources.

The 'Recovery is Possible (PDF)' is a resource provided by MHS (Managed Health Services) to inform individuals about treatment options for substance use disorder. It is part of a broader set of resources aimed at combating opioid use disorder.

## Comprehensive Information about 'Stay Safe When Using Pain Medication (PDF)'

The PDF document titled 'Stay Safe When Using Pain Medication' is available at the following link: [Stay Safe When Using Pain Medication (PDF)](https://mhsindiana.com/content/dam/centene/mhsindiana/medicaid/pdfs/Opioid-MemberFlyer-508.pdf)

This resource provides information on how to safely use pain medication, particularly opioids. It includes guidance on proper usage, storage, and disposal of opioid medications. The document aims to educate patients and their families on the risks associated with opioid use and how to mitigate these risks.

Additional resources available on the webpage include:
- [Fresh Start for You (PDF)](https://mhsindiana.com/content/dam/centene/mhsindiana/medicaid/pdfs/FreshStartForYou.pdf): Information about the Behavioral Health program and earning My Health Pays rewards.
- [Indiana's Opioid Epidemic (PDF)](https://mhsindiana.com/content/dam/centene/mhsindiana/medicaid/pdfs/IndianaOpioidEpidemic.pdf): Details on MHS programs to help with substance use.
- [Krames Health Library](https://www.krames.com/): Extensive library of evidence-based, peer-reviewed information written specifically for patients.
- [Forming an Opioid Treatment Plan](https://www.krames.com/health-library/article/forming-opioid-treatment-plan): How to form a treatment plan when prescribed opioids for pain.
- [Taking Opioid Medicines](https://www.krames.com/health-library/article/taking-opioid-medicines): How to use, store, and dispose of opioids safely.
- [Understanding Opioid Medicines for Pain Management](https://www.krames.com/health-library/article/understanding-opioid-medicines-pain-management): Learn how opioids work to treat pain.
- [Understanding the Risks and Side Effects of Opioid Medicines](https://www.krames.com/health-library/article/understanding-risks-side-effects-opioid-medicines): Understand the signs and symptoms of an opioid overdose and what to do if it occurs.
- [Recovery is Possible (PDF)](https://mhsindiana.com/content/dam/centene/mhsindiana/medicaid/pdfs/RecoveryIsPossible.pdf): Treatment options for substance use disorder.

Contact Information:
- Care Management: 1-877-647-4848
- Crisis Text Line: Text 'MHS' to 741741
- Nurse Advice Line: 1-877-647-4848 (TTY: 1-800-743-3333)

Attachments:

## Information about '1 800 743 3333'

### Purpose
The phone number '1 800 743 3333' is a TTY number for Managed Health Services (MHS). It is used for individuals who are deaf or hard of hearing to contact MHS.

### Mentions on the Webpage
1. Under the 'In crisis? Need to talk right now?' section, it is listed as the TTY number for the nurse advice line: 'If your doctor's office is closed, call our nurse advice line at **[1-877-647-4848](tel:1-877-647-4848)**  (TTY **[1-800-743-3333](tel:1-800-743-3333)**) and select 'nurse' for questions about health concerns such as proper dosage of medications.'
2. At the bottom of the webpage, it is listed as the TTY number for general inquiries: 'Need information in a different language or format? MHS will provide it at no cost to you. Call 1-877-647-4848 (TTY: **[1-800-743-3333](tel:1-800-743-3333)**).'

### Relevant Links
1. https://www.mhsindiana.com/members/care-connect/opioid-resources.html - The current webpage containing information about '1 800 743 3333'.
2. https://www.mhsindiana.com/content/dam/centene/mhsindiana/medicaid/pdfs/508-NurseLnBrch.pdf - PDF document about the 24-Hour Nurse Advice Line.

### Related Resources
1. MHS Care Manager contact information: Call [1-877-647-4848](tel:1-877-647-4848) and ask for Care Management.
2. Crisis Text Line: Text **MHS** to **741741** for support with substance use.
3. Indiana 211: Dial 2-1-1 on your landline or cellular phone to connect with substance abuse resources.
4. Indiana Commission to Combat Substance Use Disorder: https://www.in.gov/recovery/ for resources on prevention, education, treatment options, and more.

## Comprehensive Information about '24 Hour Nurse Advice Line (PDF)'

### Purpose
The '24 Hour Nurse Advice Line' is a service provided for members to call and get advice on health concerns, including proper dosage of medications.

### Relevant Links
- [24-Hour Nurse Advice Line (PDF)](https://www.mhsindiana.com/content/dam/centene/mhsindiana/medicaid/pdfs/508-NurseLnBrch.pdf)

- TTY: 1-800-743-3333

To use the '24 Hour Nurse Advice Line', members should:
1. Call 1-877-647-4848.
2. Select 'nurse' for questions about health concerns.

- Available 24/7 for immediate health concerns.
- Provides guidance on proper medication dosage.
- Accessible via phone or TTY for members with hearing impairments.

- MHS Care Manager: Members can call 1-877-647-4848 and ask for Care Management for personalized support and services.
- Crisis Text Line: Text 'MHS' to 741741 for support related to substance use. It's free, anonymous, and available 24/7.

qa_pairs.question: What is the 24 Hour Nurse Advice Line?
qa_pairs.answer: The '24 Hour Nurse Advice Line' is a service provided for members to call and get advice on health concerns, including proper dosage of medications.

qa_pairs.question: How do I use the 24 Hour Nurse Advice Line?
qa_pairs.answer: To use the '24 Hour Nurse Advice Line', members should call 1-877-647-4848 and select 'nurse' for questions about health concerns.

qa_pairs.question: Why should I use the 24 Hour Nurse Advice Line?
qa_pairs.answer: You should use the '24 Hour Nurse Advice Line' because it is available 24/7 for immediate health concerns and provides guidance on proper medication dosage.

qa_pairs.question: When is the 24 Hour Nurse Advice Line available?
qa_pairs.answer: The '24 Hour Nurse Advice Line' is available 24 hours a day, 7 days a week.

qa_pairs.question: Where can I find more information about the 24 Hour Nurse Advice Line?
qa_pairs.answer: You can find more information about the '24 Hour Nurse Advice Line' in the PDF document available at https://www.mhsindiana.com/content/dam/centene/mhsindiana/medicaid/pdfs/508-NurseLnBrch.pdf

qa_pairs.question: Who should I contact for health concerns?
qa_pairs.answer: For health concerns, you should contact the '24 Hour Nurse Advice Line' by calling 1-877-647-4848.

qa_pairs.question: What phone number do I call for the 24 Hour Nurse Advice Line?
qa_pairs.answer: The phone number for the '24 Hour Nurse Advice Line' is 1-877-647-4848. For members with hearing impairments, the TTY number is 1-800-743-3333.

qa_pairs.question: Can I access the 24 Hour Nurse Advice Line if I have a hearing impairment?
qa_pairs.answer: Yes, the '24 Hour Nurse Advice Line' is accessible via TTY for members with hearing impairments. The TTY number is 1-800-743-3333.

qa_pairs.question: Are there any related resources available besides the 24 Hour Nurse Advice Line?
qa_pairs.answer: Yes, related resources include MHS Care Manager, which can be reached by calling 1-877-647-4848 and asking for Care Management, and the Crisis Text Line, where you can text 'MHS' to 741741 for support related to substance use.

qa_pairs.question: Is the 24 Hour Nurse Advice Line available for non-medical concerns?
qa_pairs.answer: The '24 Hour Nurse Advice Line' is primarily for health concerns. However, members can also contact MHS Care Manager for personalized support and services by calling 1-877-647-4848 and asking for Care Management.

browser_content:
## Renewing Ambetter Health Insurance

### What is Renewing Ambetter Health Insurance?
Renewing Ambetter Health insurance involves updating your existing health insurance plan to continue coverage. This process typically occurs during the Open Enrollment period.

### Key Features and Instructions:
1. Open Enrollment: The annual period when you can renew or change your health insurance plan.
2. Important Coverage Changes: Review the 'Important Coverage Changes' tab on the Ambetter Health website for updates.
3. How to Renew: Follow the four steps outlined on the 'How to Renew' tab.
4. Helpful FAQs: Refer to the 'Helpful FAQs' section for common questions and answers.
5. Customer Support: Contact Ambetter Health at 1-877-288-9172 or TTY 711 for assistance.

### Relevant Links:
- [Ambetter Health Website](http://www.ambetterhealth.com)
- [Member Resources](http://www.ambetterhealth.com/resources)
- [Renewal Information](https://ambetter.mhsindiana.com/resources/renewal-information.html)

### Additional Resources:
- Log in to your Online Member Account: [https://www.ambetterhealth.com/login](https://www.ambetterhealth.com/login)
- Contact Broker or call Ambetter Health at 1-844-907-0983 (TTY 711)

### Renewal Deadlines:
- Renew by December 15th for January 1st coverage

### Income Verification Documents:
- 1040 Federal or State Tax Return
- Wages and Tax Statement
- Pay Stub
- Self-Employment Ledger Documentation
- Social Security Administration Statements
- Unemployment Benefits Letter
- 'Written Explanation Form'

### Purpose:
The purpose of renewing Ambetter Health insurance is to ensure continuous health coverage, access to healthcare providers, and financial protection against unexpected medical expenses.

Attachments:
